name: Albin Saji
review_text:
The Taj Mahal in Agra, India has been the subject of many positive reviews. Some people call it a must-see while others describe it as stunning and mesmerizing. Here are some insights from reviews:

Beauty

Most people see the Taj Mahal as architecture and beauty at its best because it changes color during different times of the day.

Time of day

Others say that sun rises up at six am when gates open. It is also said to be a busy place during sunset especially near marble seating.

Photography

It has also been mentioned that photographing inside isn't allowed but outside can be done from a distance. Security personnel will blow whistles on anybody who tries taking photos within the mausoleum's precincts since cameras may also be seized.

Other attractions

They also encourage tourists to visit other places such as Sikandra, Fatehpur Sikri and other tombs of Akbar, Itmad-ud-Daulah's tomb etc in Agra beside famous AgraFort.
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Amit G
review_text: Keep the ticket prices for Indian citizens and foreign nationals same. Treat them like a guest. Most of other countries don't charge different ticket prices based on nationality, don't be greedy. Also why is the ticket price so high for foreign nationals not everyone is coming from Europe or US, people are also coming from developing countries. Fact, the people who actually created the monument never charged a single rupee for anyone to visit it. Please reform the ticketing prices.

Thanks to active police team who helped us to file an FIR.

name: Arun Kumar J
review_text:
I would give 5 star to the place. But, I would like to list the things which would make me think to never visit this place again in my lifetime
1. Ticket cost - 50(to see only the garden), 250(to go inside the mausoleum) - even this seems acceptable as they want to control the crowd visiting the mahal inside and preserve its heritage
2. Electric Golf cart - for taking one from the parking to entrance charged at 20/person(for less than 500m) - most imp is the tickets are not provided for everyone (given only those who asks for it) and the fare is taken by this drivers without any accountability to government.
3. Shoe cover - for going inside the mausoleum, the shoes need to be covered with the cover. But the reusable cloth cover(provided free of cost) has all the dirt than the shoes. Also the clean use and throw cover is charged 10 each separately (as a separte business inside) - wonder why all these are charged outside the ticket cost when we cant go imside without it
Its not about the amount they charge, but its about the unethical practice they are following.
Visited on
Weekday

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Rajeevan Neeraj
review_text:
Went to Taj Mahal on a Monday. I got a government approved Photographer to do a mini photo shoot for me and my wife. His replies were prompt. He promised to edit all our videos that were taken on my phone but he did a crappy job. The songs were old and totally not in sync. The editing looked like it was done by a 12 year old. He told us he would edit about 20 photos for us. However he only edited 18 and editing looked like it was done on an app in an iPhone. We paid 6K INR for the service but the service output looked like only worth 1-2K INR.

Be wary of such people if you want to do a photoshoot.

His Instagram: tajmahal_photographyy

name: The Well Wisher
review_text:
I want to particularly talk about the Night Visit at Taj Mahal.

- Smartphones/phones are not allowed at Taj Mahal (these are orders by magistrate)
- How much ever you try plan viewing the Taj Mahal with the Moon. IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO SEE BOTH TOGETHER, as the direction of the moon is always above you not the Taj Mahal. It is better recommended to view it from the Taj View Point which is ok the other side of Taj Mahal across the river
- You can barely see the Taj Mahal clearly
- They are always late by 15mins of the 30mins slot that you have booked
- The ids and tickets are checked on the Taj East Gate Road itself and they take you in the golf carts till the entry point where they scan your tickets and collect your smartphones
- You are safe and under good security, enough to feel like a govt. officer.

For 500 bucks it's a waste of money I feel. This photo is a long exposure shot clicked by one of the foreigners with the help of the stairs there

name: Z H
review_text: Its the 3rd times I visit the Taj Mahal I hated it the first time for thousands of reasons, too many people, too much of a fuss for nothing much more to see than the pic we can quietly view from home. This time was the worst ever, they put lots of ugly barriers all around the Taj to contain the local crowd, it spoils the building. But the worst was all network signals were jammed, no Internet no mobile network. They provide WiFi for 30 minutes but after 18 minutes it was turned off. They say you can pay for longer connexion but there is no link to pay to any website anywhere, I went inside expecting to pay and get WiFi but I wasted an hour trying to connect to this stupid WiFi and I wasted energy and patience trying to find a way to get more WiFi. No one was able to help inside about this matter. If you jam the signals provide something to your visitors who are willing to pay for a service! Or else dont jam this stupid signals.

review_text: Unfortunately, this wonder is ruined by the abusive, vile people. Animal lovers, be forewarned! name: Faslu Rahman
review_text: I was absolutely mesmerized by the Taj Mahal during my recent visit. The sheer elegance of its white marble exterior is breathtaking, and the intricate carvings that adorn every surface tell a story of remarkable craftsmanship. As I walked through the beautifully manicured gardens, the sight of the monument reflecting in the tranquil pool was simply enchanting. The historical significance and architectural brilliance of the Taj Mahal make it an absolute must-visit for anyone exploring India.

review_text: The monument is by far the best in India. But never ever visit during weekends or public holidays. This was my third visit but it was the most crowded as it happened to be a Sunday. People were throwing wastes everywhere. We had a very bad experience there. I visited it in corona times so before entering they checked our bags like nothing. I know you have to check bags clearly for security but they were wearing gloves they just rolled our bags upside down. They took everything of and the things that were precious for me like I had a pencil from Japan. They took it and threw it in dustbin. So if next time you go there please dont take things that are not required at that time as they will throw it in dustbin. Very bad experience too. I cant give rating below 1 here so I am giving 1 rating.
Also you will not enjoy at all there there is just nothing there. There is just a name and reputation of taj mahal that it is very nice but it is not at all nice. Also you will have to pay for everything there especially for parking.

name: Nandini
review_text: To be honest, Taj mahal has the worst management. No one knows the directions at the entry area. The ticket counters are not maintained with proper instructions. The worst part is the frisking areas. They require every persona with the baggage to stand in front of thwm while they check the bags, and they remove the unnecessary things. We had an elder member during the visit who has the habit to carry, a torch light, devotional book and few medicines for emergency. The officials there removed all these, which really made no sense. Okay, now after u remove and ask to deposit in the counters, they make another havoc. Those places are the very worst. No lines, no patience among people. No officer controlling those areas. On top of that, the people working there to collect the things from tourists are very careless and ignorant people. They wantedly delay the process of depositing the baggage. It literally took all.the patience and excitement of visiting the place. Just to enter the Taj it took more than an hour due to this worst management. Apart from being oneof the wonders of the world, the place loses its value due to these kind of staff and facilities.

review_text:
It's a beautiful monument , 7th wonder of the world ! Just visit it from outside , no need to buy tickets and go inside ! It's a waste of money ! pls be aware of the local guides and nearby shops ! Tourist guides don't have any knowledge and just fool you around ! We did the mistake of doing a tourist guide who faked his name ! Initially he introduced himself as 'Sunny ' but later on revealed his real name as ' Mansoor Ali '.If a person cannot tell their real name , how can they tell you the real history ? Also the nearby shops , if you visit them and feel like buying anything then reduce the price by half of what the shopkeepers say ! They will give it to you at half of the price they initially quoted ..
The guide spoiled our experience of visiting Tajmahal ..

6. Old people and small children not advisable to go.

review_text: Taj Mahal a magnificent monument and one of the  wonders of the world but access to this wonder is so hard to achieve I realized when I got off the express highway to enter Agra. Roads to Taj are so congested despite that even having 3 hrs in hand and online ticket we could manage to have a glimpse. The approach is full of filth and crowd management is very very bad. People are made to stand in long queue as if it is some sacred place or pilgrimage. No management for unusually high traffic. What are they doing with money they are generating. I was expecting a magnificent access to the magnificent Taj. I really feel pity.

name: Aneesh Mangla
review_text: 1/4 of it has been covered in scaffolding for the past 3 years, likely another 5 years. The cleanup is necessary but completely takes away from the experience. Add to that the massive crowds and getting even a single pristine photograph of the Taj is IMPOSSIBLE. Bide your time, go when the cleanup is complete. Your trip will be wasted before then.

name: Leena Wadhwa
review_text: I was really taken aback by the the kind of security arrangements at the beautiful monument of our country which is supposed to be one of the wonders of the world. There is no system of queuing up for entering the area where the graves are there. Also used dirty shoe covers are being given to the visitors. There are a lot of hooligans who have to be checked.

name: Ashish Goyal
review_text: Pathetic place to visit in summers. Very hot weather. No safe RO water to drink by the government. No shelter to sit in hot weather.

name: Ajay Sharma
review_text: Price for visiting monument is more then it should be and there is not much more to visit in Taj Mahal. It is one of the wonder of world, so you have more expectation but there is nothing like you will feel there. It is more of business for the authority there.

name: Nabeela Usmani
review_text:
If you are an Indian and you take ticket of Rs 50 (for foreigners the ticket is of 1100) then make sure you reach as early as possible which means before 7-8am to avoid that loooooonnggg queue.. We went in the month of Oct and reached around 10 am, we really wanted to leave looking the queue waiting to enter Taj Mahal. And once you enter its not even worth a wait. Theres nothing inside except for 2 graves, you take a round and come out. You cant even think of staying inside the Taj Mahal and sit for sometime. Can you imagine standing in a queue for like an hour to take a round of graves. And once you come out securities start asking you to leave and not sit. Anyway you can take pictures and videos, once outside. But its so hot that you yourself dont even feel like being there. We just ran for our lives. We were thirsty waiting for more than an hour in that queue. They dont let you carry your bags inside so we didnt know we can carry water bottles. Anyway my experience was bad. DO NOT GO AFTER 9AM! YOU MIGHT HAVE TO WAIT FOR LIKE HOURS.
Please talk to someone for the best time to visit taj Mahal before going. You will be lucky if you have a foreigner with you. Their entry area is opposite to Indians and theres no queue at all..

name: Gautama Buddha
review_text: Nice but OVERRATED. Not sure if it is worth the hassle to get to Agra to see this. Discriminatory ticket pricing (based on nationality ) of 25x the regular Indian ticket, is very annoying. Wont recommend the hike to Agra for foreign tourists.

name: Sandarbh Asthana
review_text: Highly overrated! A lot of historical monuments have much better architecture and mysteries than this white marble structure which doesnt even holds true to its symbol of love.

name: Simantini Sinha
review_text: Full moon romantic night in Taj Mahal is out of this world experiences

name: Harshal Aradhye
review_text:
Do not visit the Taj Mahal. The guides do not follow rules and long queues are observed on weekends. It is no longer the astonishing monument it used to be. Further the local police and the CISF security are probably hand in glove with guides and local people in harassment of the tourists. The light and sound show suggested by guides and autowallas is a big scam, just like the Meena bazaar in Agra and the fake gemstone studded marble artefacts being sold around the TAJ. If you are visiting with family and valuables, pay special attention to your valuables and the women members may also suffer harrassment at the hands of local guides or people.
Still, if you wish to pay a visit, plan a trip on working days to avoid long queues. The ticket to the TAJ can be booked online on ASI payu website. Do not carry any baggage with you as it is not allowed inside and the same has to be deposited at the baggage counter before entry into the TAJ. Women are allowed to carry purse minus food (in any form). Waterbottles are allowed inside.
Wish you a safe journey....

review_text:
When we planned our trip to India we hadnt planned to come here and I wish we had stuck to that plan.
However our friend came to visit and we did a three week Rajasthan tour with him and we decided to slip it in
Did you know you dont pay an entrance fee for the building itself but for the famous view? An entrance fee of a whopping 1000 rupees! (Indians pay 50)
Imagine they built a wall around the Eiffel tower and asked you to pay 16 Euros entrance to take a photo of it?!

It is quite pretty but a total rip-off and if you come here on your trip to India youve done something wrong.

review_text: No water facilities to the public. None of the taps or the drinking water fountains were in working condition, but the water was wasted on the empty walkways in the gardens... I wonder where are the hundreds of crores spent by the officials?

review_text:

name: Gaurav Jain
review_text: Extremely mismanaged, with the entry queue itself needing nearly 2 hours unless you pay a hefty fee to a local guide. Subsequently, more queues to get into the main monument, and another one to go in for a rushed darshan, as though it was a holy shrine, and not a burial site. Sad to see how crass commercialization, overt and unfettered greed, and corrupt officialdom has rendered a visit to such a world famous monument totally forgettable... Ill think twice before ever thinking of even planning another visit to the Taj Mahal.

review_text: The beauty of this place is just destroyed by the stupidness of the people. You can't even enjoy the moment cause you will be told milions of time: move, we are taking a picture.

Saala paise khaane ke tarike hai XX

review_text: In Agra, which unfortunately is not a nice place. I dont feel the stress to get here is worth it. Dont let the guides trick you into thinking they know a short cut for you, theres different lines and prices for foreigners. You pay more as standard but it gets you in a visitors queue meaning you basically jump every line (this wasnt really advertised tho) you also dont have to have a guide despite what they will tell you.

Then the tea cups were all dirty by the tea. I asked one of the guys if i can have a clean glass since the ones they put out were dirty, he said we already put tea cups out well, i just said they were dirty. But i did not wanted to argue so I just left it alone. Just terrible.

The guide will take you to the marble shop and gem shop to scam you, please avoid.

The building and the story behind it are world class, but please be careful of scammers, there is no free tour here, if anyone tells you that there is a free tour for foreigners please avoid it, this is a scam.

After the tour, he will take you to the shop of the so-called family responsible for repairing Taj Mahal marble and force you to buy marble, but this family does not exist at all.

I was so upset that I said "thank you" after buying the ticket. I wish the country would manage the Taj Mahal well instead of just raising the entrance fee. It is a representative cultural property of India, so shouldn't that be the case?

name: Osane Vazquez Blanco
review_text: Very bad organization. There were thousands of people inside the premises. To enter the interior, to the cenotaph, the overcrowding of people was such that there was a serious risk of an avalanche. This should not be allowed, entry should be regulated and organized, just as it is done in other historical sites (The Alhambra in Granada) for the good and safety of the visitors and the monument itself. Be very careful, because there are several scams at the entrance, from not letting you pay with a credit card, under various pretexts (unbelievable in a public place) to trying to trick you into hiring a guide so you can skip the huge line, or pay a fee. plus for skipping the line. Take note foreigners: the entry for foreigners is much more expensive, and has some advantages included, such as entry to the precinct, so you do NOT have to wait in the queue for the Indians, but rather in a shorter specific queue; In addition, to enter the cenotaph, the queue is also preferential. I hope and pray that the Indian administration will take action on the matter, and stop condoning the continued and bloody scams on foreign visitors, and regularize and organize visits to the facility, in order to improve the safety and enjoyment of visitors.
review_translated_text: Muy mala organizacion. Habia miles d personas dentro del recinto. Para entrar al interior, al cenotafio, la masificacion de personas era tal, que habia serio riesgo de avalancha. Esto no debe permitirse, debe regularse y organizarse la entrada, tal y como se hace en otros recintos historicos (La Alhambra de Granada) por el bien y seguridad de los visitantes y del propio monumento. Mucho ojo, porque las estafas en la entrada son varias, desde no dejarte pagar con tarjeta d credito, bajo pretextos varios ( increible en un lugar publico) hasta tratar de enganarse para que contrates un guia para poder saltarte la inmensa cola, o pagar un plus por pasarte la cola. Tomar nota extranjeros: la entrada de extranjeros es muuuuuucho mas cara, y lleva algunas ventajas incluidas, como son entrada al recinto preferente, por lo cual NO teneis que hacer la cola de los indios, sino otra especifica mas corta; ademas para entrar el cenotafio la cola tambien es preferente. Espero y deseo que la administracion India tome cartas en el asunto, y deje de consentir las estafas continuadas y sangrantes a los visitantes extranjeros, y regularice y organice las visitas en el recinto, a fin de mejorar la seguridad y el disfrute de los visitantes.

name: Deepak Jindal
review_text:
According to Oak, based on the evidence obtained, the Taj Mahal was built on Ashwin Shukla Panchami, Sunday, 1155 during the reign of King Paramardidev. Therefore, later many Muslim invaders including Muhammad Ghori broke the doors of Taj Mahal and looted it. This palace was many times bigger than todays Taj Mahal and it used to have three domes. Hindus got it repaired again, but they could not protect this palace for long.

Purshottam Nagesh Oak, after doing research on Taj Mahal, told that Taj Mahal was earlier called Tejo Mahal. 700 such marks have been discovered on the present Taj Mahal which show that it has been reconstructed. Its minarets were built much later.

In the famous book on architecture named Vishwakarma Vastushastra, there is a description of Tej-Linga among Shivalingas. Tej-Ling was established in the Taj Mahal, hence it was named Tejomahalaya.

vaastuklaa ke vishvkrmaa vaastushaastr naamk prsiddh grNth meN shivliNgoN meN tej-liNg kaa vrnnn aataa hai /  taajmhl meN tej-liNg prtisstthit thaa isiilie uskaa naam tejomhaaly pdddhaa thaa /

name: MANJUR SURVIVOR
review_text:
Taj Mahal
Come, walk along the path near the reflecting pool with fountains to the mausoleum finished in soft and pure marble, and interspersed with semi-precious stones, where in the peace of heaven the queen rests at peace with her king to uncover pages from the past. Come to twist the charm out of your brain and enrich your imagination about this wonder of an epic, the Taj, in stone!

The grace of proportion and grandeur of the geometric patterns of the well-appointed gardens enhancing the elegance of the entire complex add grandeur to the freshness of this manse of love, dedication and purity, the Taj!

Take a dive into the saga of Taj, not a fiction but a saga based out of facts, which is nothing but pure love.

Beauty lies in the eyes of the beholder! Perhaps for the Taj Mahal, Axiom is another path. The crown is beauty! The Taj displays your different moods through its diverse colors The Taj has as many colors as any kind of beauty can ever have! The crown is pink in the morning, milky white in the evening, golden when the moon is full and intermediate versions during different hours of the day and during different seasons in a year.

Narrative narration by contemporary historians of the history of the worlds largest montage of facts revealed by todays scholars and archaeologists and the reasons behind its construction, sketched with each step, will bring you closer to the Taj Mahal the next time you visit the mosque. !

A look at the Taj at this time will keep you with the thoughts above your vision and you will feel the presence of Shahjahan, the creator, and Mumtaz Mahal, the reason, as if walking with you.

name: Bacho Zarra
review_text: Taj Mahal (Hin. taaj mhl, Urdu/Persian: taaj mhl; palace-crown) is a marble mausoleum in the Indian city of Agra. Built in 1631-1653 by about 20,000 workers. By order of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, the Taj Mahal was to become the mausoleum of his beloved wife, Arjuman Bano Begum (known as Mumtaz Mahal).

name: Shivam Gupta
review_text:
[9/23, 11:29 PM] Rajaram: We have no interest in being in discussions, everything about us is discussed, so what should we do?
[9/23, 11:29 PM] Rajaram: We do not like the happiness received in charity, because we live like a Nawab even in sorrow..
[9/23, 11:30 PM] Rajaram: The smoke of our rumors rises from the same place...
#Where  #our_name  causes #fire  #...
[9/23, 11:31 PM] Rajaram: If death comes, will I die? I am a river, which will merge into the ocean.
[9/23, 11:31 PM] Rajaram: Nawabs have dirty hobbies, hey, we are kings of the heart, who listen according to the heart and also do according to the heart..
 *price of meat* 

Magadha emperor Bindusara once asked in his meeting:
To solve the countrys food problem

*What is the cheapest item?*

The Council of Ministers and other members were left wondering! Rice, wheat, jowar, millet etc. are available only after a lot of labor and that too when there is no wrath of nature, in such a situation food cannot be cheap.

Then a feudal lord who was fond of hunting said:
Rajan,

*The cheapest food item is meat,*

It takes less effort to get it and nutritious food is available to eat. Everyone supported this, but Prime Minister Chanakya was silent.
Then the emperor asked him:
What is your opinion about this?

Chanakya said: I will present my views before you tomorrow!

When night fell, the Prime Minister reached the feudal lords palace. The feudal lord opened the door and was frightened to see the Prime Minister gone so late.

The Prime Minister said:
In the evening, the king has suddenly become ill, the royal physician has said that if we get two tola meat of a big mans heart then the kings life can be saved, hence I have come to you to get only two tola meat of your heart. For this you should take one lakh gold coins.

On hearing this, Samanthas face turned pale, he held the Prime Ministers feet and apologized and

*On the contrary, he gave him one lakh gold coins and said that with this money he should buy the heart of some other feudal lord.*

The Prime Minister visited all the feudal lords and army officers one by one and

*He asked everyone for two tola of their hearts flesh, but no one agreed, on the contrary, everyone gave one lakh, two lakh, five lakh gold coins to the Prime Minister for his protection.*

In this way, after collecting about two crore gold coins, the Prime Minister returned to his palace before dawn and on time, in the Rajya Sabha, the Prime Minister placed two crore gold coins before the King.

The emperor asked:
What is all this ? Then the Prime Minister told that to buy two tola meat

*So much money was collected, yet two tola meat was not found.*

Rajan ! Now think for yourself how cheap is meat?

Life is priceless, let us not forget that just as we love our life, in the same way all living beings also love their life. But he is unable to save his life.

And man can make every possible effort to save his life. By speaking, persuading, scaring, bribing etc.

*Animals can neither speak nor express their pain.*

*So should his right to live be taken away just because of this?*

*Pure diet, vegetarianism!*
*Human food, vegetarianism!*

If you like this article then please send it to every person.

 *maaNs kaa muuly* 


mgdh smraatt biNndusaar ne ek baar apnii sbhaa me puuchaa :

desh kii khaady smsyaa ko suljhaane ke lie


*sbse sstii vstu kyaa hai ?*


mNtrii prissd tthaa any sdsy soc meN pdd' gye ! caavl, gehuuN, jvaar, baajraa aadi to bhut shrm ke baad milte haiN aur vh bhii tb, jb prkRti kaa prkop n ho, esii haalt meN ann to sstaa ho hii nhiiN sktaa !


tb shikaar kaa shauk paalne vaale ek saamNt ne khaa :

raajn,


*sbse sstaa khaady pdaarth maaNs hai,*


ise paane me mehnt km lgtii hai aur paussttik vstu khaane ko mil jaatii hai  /  sbhii ne is baat kaa smrthn kiyaa, lekin prdhaan mNtrii caannky cup the  / 

tb smraatt ne unse puuchaa :

aapkaa is baare meN kyaa mt hai ?


caannky ne khaa : maiN apne vicaar kl aapke smkss rkhuuNgaa !


raat hone pr prdhaanmNtrii us saamNt ke mhl phuNce, saamnt ne dvaar kholaa, itnii raat gye prdhaanmNtrii ko dekhkr ghbraa gyaa  / 


prdhaanmNtrii ne khaa :

shaam ko mhaaraaj ekaaek biimaar ho gye haiN, raajvaidy ne khaa hai ki kisii bdddhe aadmii ke hRdy kaa do tolaa maaNs mil jaae to raajaa ke praann bc skte haiN, islie maiN aapke paas aapke hRdy  kaa sirph do tolaa maaNs lene aayaa huuN  /  iske lie aap ek laakh svrnn mudraayeN le leN  / 


yh sunte hii saamNt ke cehre kaa rNg udd' gyaa, usne prdhaanmNtrii ke pair pkdd' kr maaphii maaNgii aur


*ultte ek laakh svrnn mudraayeN dekr khaa ki is dhn se vh kisii aur saamnt ke hRdy kaa maaNs khriid leN  / *


prdhaanmNtrii baarii-baarii sbhii saamNtoN, senaadhikaariyoN ke yhaaN phuNce aur


*sbhii se unke hRdy kaa do tolaa maaNs maaNgaa, lekin koii bhii raajii n huaa, ultte sbhii ne apne bcaav ke liye prdhaanmNtrii ko ek laakh, do laakh, paaNc laakh tk svrnn mudraayeN diiN  / *


is prkaar kriib do krodd' svrnn mudraaoN kaa sNgrh kr prdhaanmNtrii sveraa hone se phle vaaps apne mhl phuNce aur smy pr raajsbhaa meN prdhaanmNtrii ne raajaa ke smkss do krodd' svrnn mudraayeN rkh diiN  / 


smraatt ne puuchaa :

yh sb kyaa hai ? tb prdhaanmNtrii ne btaayaa ki do tolaa maaNs khridne ke lie


*itnii dhnraashi iktttthii ho gii phir bhii do tolaa maaNs nhii milaa  / *


raajn ! ab aap svyN vicaar kreN ki maaNs kitnaa sstaa hai ?


jiivn amuuly hai, hm yh n bhuuleN ki jis trh hmeN apnii jaan pyaarii hai, usii trh sbhii jiivoN ko bhii apnii jaan utnii hii pyaarii hai /  lekin vo apnaa jaan bcaane me asmrth hai / 


aur mnussy apne praann bcaane hetu hr smbhv pryaas kr sktaa hai  /  bolkr, rijhaakr, ddraakr, rishvt dekr aadi aadi  / 


*pshu n to bol skte haiN, n hii apnii vythaa btaa skte haiN  / *


*to kyaa bs isii kaarnn uns jiine kaa adhikaar chiin liyaa jaay  / *


*shuddh aahaar, shaakaahaar !*

*maanv aahaar, shaakaahaar !*


agr ye lekh aapko acchaa lge to hr vykti tk jrur bheje /

name: Leena Khaneja
review_text:
One of the seven wonders of the world may not get five star rating. The experience was so pathetic. The human are treated like bugs or bees. The queue was completely mismanaged. There were no navigation board or help to denote which queue is there and every one was going haphazardly. There were school children queue but no one looking out. The gate was flooded with people and the crowd inside was huge. Such a historic place of importance and so poorly managed. I am sure the revenue earned per day through the public would be in crores but unfortunately no one to take care of the simple logistics for them. There is quite a distance from the entrance to the entry gate and there are staff hovering around. Most of the staff who were at work were looking completely troubled and rightly so and the remaining staff was with indifferent attitude and did not care. The second mess is at the screening of bags. The bags are lying there and there are 70 - 80 women around that screened bags screaming and shouting for their purses. No separate queue was there for ladies. There are shoe cover which are mandatory but in a horrible stage. Thus your shoe might be cleaner than the cover. Mind you whether you pay thousand rupees or two hundred rupees you are eligible for same nonsense. If you want to thus enjoy don't visit till the same is better organised. It is a shame on us.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
1 hr+

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Damage Case
review_text:
An experience that youd like to never wish to go through again.

If youre reading this, you will obviously go there. So try to go in peak winters, otherwise its hell due to the heat (along with other issues).

Get your tickets online beforehand as its easier. No timing issue. It has multiple gates. The metro station gate is packed with crowds so take an e rickshaw and take the south gate. Official guides are 1800 bucks so people take cheaper ones.

You cant take much stuff inside so get it submitted outside and take a token. The entry queue is the worst hell ever. First you get yourself checked, then put your bag on the belt. Then they put your bags on a table where other hundreds of bags are kept and then starts a big crowd fight to get it checked by security by hand. They will embarrassingly open up ladies/gents bags and purses and check everything one by one. You can imagine how much time one by one bag checking would take! People are screaming and shouting in crowds and fighting to get their bags checked quickly.

There are no canopies or shades. In heat you will burn yourself while walking. The monument is majestic no doubt but only go there in winters. Guides and photographers will make matters worse. They will irritate you.

If you are planning to visit the mausoleum, then skip it if youre not a history buff. The cost of ticket is extra. You cant take pictures inside it. Its not that big. And you have to wait in line to get shoe covers and pay 10 bucks each for it.

Overall its a money making monument with torturous management. If nothing else, at least put some shades around the walking path. Im sure the photographers and guides that are inside are paying hefty bribes to the management otherwise how come they can make their business without paying for tickets etc.

Only go on the weekends (its closed on Fridays). And only go in winters, if you have to!
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Rajinder Bindra
review_text:
Beautiful Taj Mahal, no need for any introduction.

Problems you might face:

Parking: Authorities including police men will declare Parking Full and direct you to private other parkings. I have place a recent picture where I was redirected elsewhere, but the parking was easily available (I have posted picture of available parking space for sample).

Overcharging of E-rickshaw:
E Rikshaw from private Parking which is hardly 400 meters from Taj Parking will misguide you for exceptional higher charges whereas its 10Rupees per person (I came back on this price, whereas went there at Rs100 for three person).

Electric van is available from Taj Parking to Entry gate for Rs10 per person (one side).

E Ticket: please book E Ticket online so that you dont need to stay in queue. Dealers will surround you to buy tickets and guide from them and they will ensure you to save you from the rush on ticket window, whereas practically when I visited, the window had hardly approx 30 people in queue.

Ticket for Indian national Adult: Rs. 50 for Taj Mahal, Rs 250 if you want to go to the Taj Mahal marble area. You can buy separate Rs200 ticket if you decide it lated from inside the Taj Mahal.

Street Food in all surroundings is pathetic and unhygienic.

Upmarket ITDC restaurant is available near Ticket Window area, well maintained and good food but on a fairly High price as expected from an Elite place.

Buy show cover Rs5/- per pair, only if you wish to buy tickets of Rs250 per person and visit the upper marble area of Mumtaj Mahal.

Try to avoid weekends.

Try to go early morning, to see the best of the views of the Mahal.
Visited on
Weekend

- Accept only cash for tickets. Give a token for entry to be collected back on exit with a penalty for losing it.
- Require ID proof for Indians to enter.
- No proper drinking water and toilet facilities.
- For foreigners, no special facility despite charging whooping Rs 1100.

name: Vikhyath Choradia
review_text:
Totally overrated....
They charge 50 just to get inside and if you have to see what inside Taj Mahal then you have to buy another 200 ticket.
And if you happen to visit on a holiday then then expect a waiting time of 3 hrs to get an inside view of Taj Mahal.(~30 mins to get the ticket, ~1-1:30 hour to get in the monument and ~1 Hr to go inside Taj Mahal).
You can save first 30 mins by buying ticket online, but the rest you will have to suffer.

I say it overrated because you spent 250 and spend about 3 hrs waiting in line and they just let you in not more than 5 mins .

I was very disappointed by the experience .

maybe the company we booked threw our visit had a bad impact as the local guide just kept pushing us to finish within very short time then he kept pushing to get some merchandise from shops outside that are clearly were to give him commission.
The driver brought us threw very bad bumpy road then in the trip back he suggested paying extra if we wanted him to use the high way which was million times better.

name: Baba Jaanveer
review_text:
The Taj Mahal was exactly as I expected but the sour note is a tour guide who was a last minute replacement to the one originally booked. This guy Mohsin Khan (had the card and all that appeared genuine) tried to fleece about Rs1200 extra from the agreed amount from the boss. Quite unprofessional and aloof also, did not answer all the questions asked. We came there in a private car with a driver whom we have known for years and like a member of our family. This guy wanted a lift back to Agra town in the excuse that his motocycle had punctured and started a long tirade about friendship and advice to me on how the driver is at my beck and call. I wanted to cut him off while talking as I had recently retired as a Senior Govt servant in my country and have seen a lot of quacks like these in my working life. I contacted his boss and the boss apologised profusely and arranged the money to be returned to me. (Thank you). To Mohsin, if this line of work is not suitable get a 9-5 job where you can be supervised.

name: sulai sha
review_text:
Prices have shot up. The entry to the Taj costs rs50 and to enter the main building you need to pay an additional 200 which is a total of rs250. On top of that there are high value passes which does literally nothing but allow you to directly enter Taj or else youll have to walk all the way around Taj and come to the same place which makes absolutely no sense to enter. And these passes are even more expensive. Despite the price hike you still need to pay an extra 20 for a footwear cover which the foreigners get for free with a water bottle to go along. Something else that I noticed is that people now started to almost worship the grave and start throwing money in there which of course pays off the guard on point who tells his lungs out when you try to capture whats happening inside fearing losing out on the money.

Wouldnt recommend going at all if youve been there once.

name: Shraddha
review_text:
The monument is ill managed. Its too crowded. The authorities arent well-informed. For people who buy the 50 coupons, spare yourself of nearly 2 hours of torture by standing in the line to get inside the Mahal, its a waste of time and your 50. You need to buy a separate ticket to enter the Mahal, its first floor which costs 200 & youve to buy a cover for your shoes which costs 20 per person. For people who wanna avoid standing in the queue can buy the 250 ticket at the entrance of the monument, theyre allowed to enter the Mahal too. You just additionally have to pay for the shoes cover which you get inside. Thats compulsory for you to wear.

All in all, my experience at Taj was bad. Had the authorities been more strict and alert, we wouldve avoided a couple of arguments with people who mindlessly push you to get ahead or jump the queue as if its their fathers property.

review_text:
Mislead by the officials at the government counter. Multiple times they forced us to get a guide for Taj Mahal. One it is not needed as we all mostly know the history of Taj and have seen documentaries too. Then they somehow pretended to give me an offer and said to just tip him 500rs. So he will help me with the entrance. Telling me that the ladies line is too long and I have to wait in the sun and will be far away from my husband. Government has given these special privileges and the guides can help you fast track.
This is all a lie. There was no long queue. It took us not even 5 minutes to cross the entrance without the guide.

They also made us pay for the shoe covers which are free inside. I am very saddened and felt looted on the name of my own government.

Management should organise more and more activities, art and craft exhibitions to attract tourists and make them visit again.

name: rohul mitro
review_text: This place is very hot...... But its very beautiful also......

name: Jus Tinn
review_text:
Taj Mahal is something which made India renowned. Its a gem that we have. I remember last visit here back in 2010 was very nice but this year its completely changed. Staffs are arrogant and rude not just with Indians but also with foreigners. You will feel very bad seeing how badly foreigners are treated.
On one hand you smile at foreigners so that they too feel good here on the other hand you find tricksters fooling them.

name: Amarendra Kumar
review_text:
Certainly there is nothing wrong with this monument, its a great example of sophisticated art.
But the only reason I am giving it only 2 stars because Indians get discriminated here by the security. They ask Indian visitors to put off the shoes before stepping on the monument but they do not ask the foreign visitors to do the same. I really hated this

name: imsnjuu
review_text:
It was Sunday staff were incapable to handle tourist who came to visit

online tickets portal was down took almost 2 hours to get in & buy the ticket

When we get in we have to buy another pass for the white tomb felt injustice & way to earn more money.

Bad experience

name: Hrishikesh Deshpande
review_text:
Mesmerizing
Beautiful
Gigantic

One huge disappointment -
1) crowd management is very poor
2) its the most important monument in India, yet it isnt free from litter. Shoe covers torn and thrown around in the main building, people throwing bottles in and around the eastern gate. Its saddening

name: priya gowra gowra
review_text:
Entry fee tooo high (250) in side of the taj mahal
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

name: Lynne Gazit
review_text: Ive been blessed to have traveled to more than 50 countries and have seen many famous places if you want to call them that. I never have expectations, which is a good thing. I can honestly say however the Taj Mahal was probably the most underwhelming famous place Ive ever seen.... there are literally millions of more places with more meaning in incredible India. Definitely not a bucket list item.... only if you already happen to be in Agra already.

name: Musunuri Venkatesh
review_text:
Need maintenance, lot of restrictions and entry fees increased to 235rs per person.

Metro work is going through lot of traffic near the monument.

name: Wandering Soul
review_text: I dont knw what the hype is abt,it was an absolute bore,just a building u dont even get to see properly, security keeps u moving along the line, its over crowded,fun to look at other people taking pics,many people were in full attires and shooting their videos for insta i guess, overall wont go ever and wont be recommending..nothing to see or do in agra either..very unclean and hot place

name: Anjaliii
review_text: Theres nothing to do. If youre a big fan of monuments and history only then go. Otherwise I personally wouldnt recommend planning a trip to Agra. Its not my kind of a place.

name: Rajesh Singh
review_text:
Taj Mahal is Beautiful but you have to face lots of traffic on its way. Worst traffic management in the city. Locals always try to make you fool and try to take money from you. Agra is dirty city some cleanliness you can find near Taj Mahal. Yamuna river is totally dry.

Overall you will feel happy if you plan to visit Taj Mahal by road.

name: sharl pear
review_text: They had blocked the entire southern gate today just because a VIP was coming, foreigners had to go through dingy unclean streets to reach the eastern gate. We say Atithi Devo Bhava but who cares right?

name: Captain Yujvizard
review_text: Ive seen pictures of the Taj Mahal portrayed as super majestic and colorful and not the color of stone. They should consider putting another layer of paint or six on. It looks like a medieval castle thats construction went horribly wrong but the creators decided to leave it such, and people enjoy it and royalty actually LIVED there. Maybe it looked better in the past, but for now it isnt worth looking at in person unless you live within eyesight of it.

name: Tushar Aggarwal
review_text: Taj being the most important place in India for domestic as well as International tourism lacks even basic facilities for tourists. Ticket counter had waiting for 1-2 hrs. Never do online booking for entry tickets, as it will not reach them and you will have to purchase tickets again at counter and apply for refund of your online booking which is also not easy to do. All people, guides local transport as well as govt. run transportation, ticket counter guys are cheats and never help. They have settings as queues are very very long and tyring. No place for small children or old people. Please have your whole day free as from ticketing till visiting it will take at least 5 to 7 hrs. No proper fooding as nothing is allowed inside. Indian visitors are treated as worthless people as they are paying less amount and preference is given to international tourist only as. Better to take a Guide who can help you in many places. Apart from mismanagement, in Rs 50/- only you can have a view of one of the seven wonders of the world.

name: Subrata Mukherjee
review_text: Very poor maintenance of the building. A total mismanagement and lack of coordination. Very little number of battery operated vehicles and there is nothing to inform from where these will be available. There is no specific stand, no signboard, no queue..... etc. Water bottles scattered everywhere. Tourists are at the mercy of guides and dalals. Our heritage is certainly not in good hands.

name: Sonu Kumar
review_text:
Over rated!

There so many forts in Rajasthan way more better thn Taj

Only thing is that its made of white sangmarmar.. nothing else!

Disappointed!

name: Pavan Patrick
review_text: Authorities need to ensure good services. Very poor services. The main floor near the tomb is always very hot but nobody cares. Nobody tells you that you will need to have a shoe cover inside the premises. The place where you keep your shoes would always ask for some tip. The way Indian and non indian ticket holders are treated is another disappointing thing. You would feel discriminated in your own country.

name: Jeremy Anchan
review_text: Amazing experience in the Taj itself but gonna tank my rating solely based on the fact they are blatantly ripping off tourists and foreigners. 40 rupees for a local ticket which I was fortunate enough to pay but had I not had my OCI card, Id end up paying the regular rate for foreigners which is 1000! Go figure... India at its finest....

name: Emma November
review_text: Taj Mahal is totally overrated and really expensive! 2h waiting at entrance! Unfriendly stuff! No Videos allowed! Just small cameras! No backpack! Tourists are not welcome! But its a nice building.

name: Sourav Sarkar
review_text: The monument was fantastically designed and was worth having a look. But the service here was extremely bad and disgusting. There were guards standing all over the entrance just to say the words maintain the lign  and dont push . In the main entrance, people start pushing each other to the frames of the hard marble entrance. People usually get fun making chaos by such acts. You wont get into the tomb without using brute force againat others. These things happen usually when there is a large crowd.

name: BHARAT CHOPRA
review_text: Taj Mahal , Historical palace The king made in memory for her 4th wife , cut hands of the poor Labourers who made this beautiful monument how that can be A Love memory, one time attraction, you can see for one time Thats enough. Government Should not charge more entry fee from Foreign Nationals, thats not good tourist policy, government should look for other ways for revenue. Closed on Friday , is that in Saudi Arab or in India ??

name: Dheeraj Thukral
review_text:
I dont see a reason why people form such long queues to go inside Taj Mahal just to come back a little more disappointed. Guys the Taj is beautiful (but only from the outside)
Overall - amazing vibes and a fabulous place.

name: C.M. Suri
review_text:
Sadly, the glow from a great monument has gone.
To make matters worse, the crowds are pathetic, what with local goons wielding cellphones to take 'selfies' of innocent girl children while standing in the entry queue. This is the reality about a decadent society, unfortunately, very alarming and depressing.
I would never bother to see the monument again, esp with my family.
I pity the tourists, especially women. The police should install cctv cameras at every corner covering each inch, else this monument will be "history" abandoned.

name: Sahil Yadav
review_text:
Less of monument, government is using it for earning money, the charges have increased now 250rs and indians get treated not well by the security staff.
There is a very very long queue to enter the white marble area for the general Indians whereas for foreigners there is a special entrance which is shortest path.

Nothing to eat/drink except water, its more of a tourist money spending place.

Rest All its an art everyone must see atleast once in life.

In the parking when we returned my car was damaged by unknown person and there are no camera so no clue who did it, no parking staff was there to take care.

name: Ayush Kenhi
review_text: Nothing to like about this place. Seriously. I mean you have to spend an hour or two in line for watching one Piece of stone.. Which isnt even real*Real one is not for display*. There is no light in there so u can rarely see anything. But if you want to go inside. Try looking above. Its amazing. Outsides is good but its too crowded

name: Mohammad Aqeel Fadayee
review_text: What I was expecting from Taj Mahal was something OPPOSITE of the reality. The reality of Taj Mahal is going to ruin your expectations. I was expecting it to be larger than other ancient buildings in India and with a lot of buildings to visit. But it was a single building and four gates. As a matter of comparison, Safdar Jung Tomb is a better place. Humayun Tomb is even a better place comparing it to both places I named till now.

name: Sanjar Vafoyon
review_text:
It goes without saying that Taj Mahal is one of the iconic mausoleum but staff and service are very awful. Indian people pay for an entry ticket only INR 40 whereas tourists pay INR 1000 (25 times more).

Make sure you do not visit this place during a hot summer day but if you do, always carry much water, sunglasses, and hat.

name: Jai Singh Patel
review_text: Waste of time... :) It may be a symbol of art and lobe in past. But there are better places than Taj to visit now a days. You will waste your time by standing in a row of thousands of people to see just a old art building and not only once its twice standing in a row for 2-4 hours .

name: md rehan
review_text: Good place but never go in winter or foggy day. I repeat never. Taj mahal was in front and was unable to see only fogg. Check weather forecast before visiting.

name: Sumit Kumar
review_text: Its a tomb and very hyped place. There is nothing which one could appreciate. I would suggest not to visit it.

name: Bharat Kholiya
review_text:
West gate entry is worst entry.
Always enter from East gate.

Also locker room is unorganized.. No pure veg hotel at entry gate .. all rikshawala are lyers... They will drop u till middle way.. after that you have to take electric auto which is big lie...

Taj mahal is beautiful experience. Iconic structure.

But entry gate is bad experience.

name: David Carasso
review_text: Lovely garden with esthetic constructions, maybe the main structure is interesting from inside, you wont know. Taj mahal - Check.

Burstest place to visit among one of the best monuments of world.

One can experience the most inferior kind of crowd management here. Never go there on weekends or in holidays.

review_text: A beautiful monument to love, so over run with people, getting shuffled through the inner tomb and constantly being approached by hawkers made what we hoped would be the high point of our trip to India at among the bottom of the list.

name: Sabiha Nagri
review_text:
V crowded,, no space to ourselves,, long queues not worth standing for!! it was not at all bright inside the mosaleum so could not even see the maqbara so well after the 1hour long queue.. To enter one needs an identity proof or else pay rs1000 for the ticket which is not worth...
Click pics of the Taj Mahal from out n closeby but dont try to enter inside the Taj Mahal
Not well maintained!!!??

name: Madasthu Santhosh
review_text: Taj Mahal is a nice monument to watch out for but city Agra is full of fraud people... You can see on their face in words... How they loot you .... No autowala drop you at the destination you asked for when you board the auto not even ola people.... Very dirty roads... Hotels are not at all good in quality and service... Once you can visit but not more that ...

name: Digital Marketing Services India (Sameer Mehta)
review_text:
We visited Taj Mahal on the 9th of October16 evening with family. Well, Taj Mahal is an amazing sight by itself and no words can do justice to the experience of visiting it.

The auto dropped us to ticketing counter. From there we took an electric bus to Taj Mahal Entrance gate. At the main gate the queue was long and at security check, all edible items were thrown out of bags straight to dustbin by security personnel. They did not bother even if the food was for kids accompanying the parents. They did their job. Little one can do. Security could still be good without forgetting the mannerism.

As we walked to the first gate - the real entrance to Taj Mhal, we were swarmed by local photographers selling 50rs a pic! Gone are the days when one could just sit and enjoy the site, or may be it was such only on our visit. We dont know. We took a walk to Taj. Finally we removed our footwear and joined a mile long queue going from one side of the monument to the now closed tomb of Mumtaj and Shah Jahan and were rushed out without much ado.

There were ropes and off limit areas everywhere we went. The real tomb in the basement is now permanently closed to public. Done, we went back to collect out footwear and started our journey back. Once out of the gate, we could not find any electric bus or vehicle to ferry us back to auto stand. We bought some water and walked some. It was growing tiresome because the complex is pretty huge and we had already walked some 3 kms in past 3 hrs. Finally after walking for about 15 minutes we got an auto and went back straight to our hotel.

It was there at the hotel that we realized that we felt way better in the comfort and freedom of the hotel than we ever felt at Taj. As an Indian, i felt much frustrated with the whole visiting experience, so i can understand what the foreigners feel. Its simply not worth it.

I hope someone in the tourism department reads my review and does something to ease the visiting process and make it a worthwhile experience.

name: Ujjwal Sethi
review_text: Though the place is majestic, the management is not. As well as, yet again, too much commercialisation of the place. Everyone wants to loot you. Be careful

name: Animesh Bose
review_text: Been three times in all experience bad in summers when you have to walk barefoot on hot stones to enter the mousliam. Too much hyped. Can see Mumtaj tomb as its covered with iron grails and darkness also hampers view. Yeah for photographic experience pretty awesome. But serpentine lines greeting in and then getting inside the Taj is too much to bear. Avoid summers at any cost. And Friday is closed day.

name: Akshay Dumbre
review_text:
Nice art but Management is not good, even after taking so much entey fees, not a single light inside taj mahal, it would beautify taj from inside, also help people wo visit evening.
Management & police does partiality within Indians & foreigners. High value tickets only given to foreigners.

name: Ajay Gohel
review_text:
Foreigner entry fess very expensive 1100/-
INR.

Some are resricated area and crowded, lots local guide and agent can not keep relaxed sight seeing.

Local transport cheap,

Never go in bus tour from delhi.

name: Jason Kennedy
review_text: Bring earplugs for the tomb inside chamber. Signs are posted to keep quiet yet these workers are blasting whistles to get people to keep walking. Its loud and incredibly annoying. There has to be a better way.

name: Robiul Islam
review_text: Taj Mahal. One of the 7 wonder of the world situated in Agra, uttar pradesh, India. Though I am an Indian I have an wish to visit Taj Mahal once in my lifetime like every Indians .Today I got the opportunity to fulfill my dream but I was shocked to see the arrangements of the U.P police. Nothing is arranged by the uttar pradesh police nor by the CISF. I was reached East gate at around 11:30 AM & someone asked me to stand in que. Like everyone me too stands in a que. I can able to enter into the Taj Mahal campus at around 1:45pm along with my family and my 4 years old son. CISF started checking, allowed only plain a water bottle & kept my all food stuff which I was bought for my kid. Ok, again started que whole day I was supposed to move in a que. Even if somebody wants to have a photo with the monument , CISF asked Line me raho, line me raho. At around 4:50 pm my wish to visit Taj Mahal was finally fulfilled. I spent around Rs :40,000 to visit Taj Mahal & what I got, not even a photo with the monument & whole day fasting with my 4 years old son. I will never recommend to someone to visit Taj Mahal during Aditya Jogis period. Its a source of good revenue for u.p government, if they cant maintain that should give up it to private company ..

name: ramesh chand pandey
review_text: Overrated monument, the marble is showing signs of decay and restoration works are not upto the mark. Ticket prices have been hiked for the Indian citizens which is not justified.Crowd management is bad and place has lots of touts and guides who harass the tourists. River on the north side of the monument (Yamuna) reeks of sewage and is in pretty bad shape. Place for photo ops and checking items in the bucket list apart from that nothing special.

name: Asha Sareen
review_text:
Place is good but very badly maintained:
* Wheelchair people are worst here. Least BOTHERED FOR INDIAN and more concerned for FOREIGNERS
* Despite lot of Greenery and trees, this place doesnt have sufficient BENCH where visitors can sit and rest a while under trees Shadow.
* Drinking water is a big issue. Very few water taps are there which are used for face wash, spit commonly. Minimum 200 more water corners should be there with sign boards.
* Wash room - OH THESE ARE HARD TO FIND.
Overall Disappointed. RIP

name: Pavan Kumar
review_text: Was charged 200 per head for main building access with no facility at all. Do not visit here in summer, its a living hell

name: Sandeep Kumar
review_text:
Honestly speaking what I like is only area. Other then this I do not know why this place is in 7 wonders.

Any way as usual this place is crowdy all the times. And ticket for indian is 50 + 200 =250 for each.

name: Kaustubh Gupta
review_text: Except The Taj everything is horrible. One place where the que for tickets will take 2 hours, 3hiurs in que to go in and 3 hours to stand outside Taj to get in. Best option is to buy vip pass for 550 or 11000. Except foreign crowd the other crowd is not always great.

name: sandeep kumar Gupta
review_text:
Very good but tickets rate so high after increment. And facilities are worst
Jab aap upper jaaoge line me tab aakhir me kahenge jinka 50 rupees ki tickets h bahar nikalo or take pic outside from Minar.
And behavior of guard are like we are theaf, robber they treat us like we are not tourist.
By the way go and enjoy The Tajmahal

name: Neil Stoker
review_text: Beautiful to behold but not worth queing to go inside unless you get there very early before the queue gets too big. Touts and over pushy guides make it a pretty unpleasant experience overall.

name: Pushpinder Saini
review_text: No management ... people wer fighting with each other to site in a battery car no rule for that U.p. govt doing nothing there .No sweepers there no cleaning I think U.P. Govt. have no respect and responsibilities for our historical monuments . In Agra tourist came to c the wonder of the world when they saw this what impact will shown to them .... U.P. Govt. Plz wake up and think about that and make some strick plans to save that wonderful place

name: Aurelien Duchene
review_text:
!!! BE CAREFULL !!! SCAM ON THE OFFICE TICKET !!!
The man at the ticket counter dont give the change back ! He forgot to give us back our 400Rs change, when we bought it at 6AM, not really woken. We claim 2 minutes after and he gave the money. He did the same with 6 others tourists just before and after us. One time can be a mistake, 6 is a thief...
We came back to talk to his manager who just didnt care and said sorry for this... Its just a shame.
CHECK YOUR CHANGE !!!
Hopefully, the Taj is really beautiful ! ;-)

name: Ramandeep Singh
review_text:
This place is in India and there is much too restrictions for Indian people. Thats why India dont grow like other countries.

Anyways this is one of the wonder of the world so people glad to visit here.

name: Nirmesh Bagadwal
review_text: Taj is beautiful, but surrounding and infrastructure sucks. Agra administration is clueless to manage crowd buses and cars. Avoid touring this nasty place and enjoy only in photograph.

name: Bob Loblaw
review_text: 50 rps entrance if your skin is certain color, 1000 rps for every other shade. 2x markup is annoying but tolerable ... 20x is a jack. Herded like cattle inside with yells and whistles. Too bad, because its a pretty nice temple otherwise.

name: Raj kallingal
review_text: The Tajmahal stands as a  beautiful memorial  marble palace. You will have to take off your shoses and wear socks instead to enter. The view of the Tajmahal is an experience that will never be forgotten.

name: Deepak Bansal
review_text: Place is historic. But the govt should take measures to improve the quality of the place. There is no seating area and no water at all.

name: vasu dev
review_text: Please dont visit here at between 11 am to till 3 pm.. Hot climate will turn you to not to enjoy the tajmahal and irritates well.. If theres a childrens with us.. Thats all.. Better take a umbrella

name: aman sharma
review_text:
Hacks while visiting taj mahal .
*--- Tickets of each monument under ASI is available @ each monument example you can purchase ticket for tajmahal @ qutub minar but mention date before taking ticket.but prefer to download ticket online which is available @ ASI site.Take hardcopy of it.
*-- Visit as early as possible coz there is very much rush after that.
*-- taj mahal closed on Friday dont visit.
1- if traveling via Bus ALWAYS take government Bus.DONT take private Bus service you will regret.
*-- also visit Agra red fort which is very near to tajmahal electric auto will charge 10 per person.
2- you are not allowed to visit with shoes on so buy shoe cover outside the taj mahal which you will get @ rupees 5. and there is also FREE shoe submitting place inside tajmahal.but prefer to buy shoe cover.
3- FREE water facility is AVAILABLE inside taj mahal & its very hygienic & clean.
4- Remember there is commission invovled on each service you take for example you will see conveyance is cheap but the rickshawalas and auto wala will try to suggest you to take some specific persons service BEWARE of it.
5- while returning AUTO & rickshawalas will try you to take to PRIVATE BUS STAND particularly if you want to visit Delhi.DONT take private Bus service its worst you will regret.
Instead hire auto and visit govt Bus stand which is 14-15 km far but its very good to take.
6- In Agra conveyance is cheaper because YOU ARE THE PRODUCT.so take suggestion of them wisely.

name: vinay mehta
review_text:
For entering Tajmahal you have to pay 150 per head,but at the ticket counter the person will charge 30 rs extra which is no where mentioned on the ticket.
To visit inner mausoleum again to you have to pay 350rs., which means you have to spend 500rs to watch whole Tajmahal.
Photographers will also ask you to collect photos at their shop where they will force you to purchase items from their shop.

name: poonam sharma
review_text:
Now color of Taj mahal is dull.One thing which is very bad that i am having my small holy Book of Arati
In my bag.they hv not allowed me to take it along with me. Bhut burra laga. Ek chutty si holy book unhone nahi lejane di....Aur sab faltu ka saman allowed hai...
But hamari Holy book sai kya problem hai...
I will not bisit Again...

name: Calista Rosewood
review_text:
Im from north east.... i went to Taj Mahal twice but i was asked if i were an Indian just because of my Mongolian eyes... 
my cousin went today... she got the tickets but was staright away denied to enter as they doubted if shes an Indian... since shes from Assam and adhar hasnt been available in some parts of the state so she doesnt have one although she showed her pan card and her passbook.. and none of the people in line were asked to show their ID proofs!!
so here the question is... why the other people werent asked to show their ID proofs??... why only her... just because she has a very fair complexion and Mongolian eyes...????
does this make us less Indian or non Indian ???

name: Saurav Kumar
review_text: The recent price hike is too much. For entry is 50 but for the main Taj is 200 which is insanely high. These will make sure that it will have less foot falls.

name: Sole
review_text:
For a Person / Tourist who is Visiting Taj there are local E-Rickshaw owner (unauthorized) who are charging Rs 50/ from West gate to the main entry gate.

Why not Government do something about it.

Secondly, there is no proper arrangement made to see Mumtaz inside, its so Humid, Crowded and Unorganized but its a World Heritage ranked 1. Irony...

name: Elena Frolova
review_text:
Visit for show, it's still possible. But to be honest and frank, I liked Akshardham many times more in Delhi.
The heat is wild, there is nowhere to hide from it. There are crowds of people, so crowded that when you go inside the policeman just shouts "move on, move, dont stop"
That is, you can't just stand and look, much less take a picture inside. It's also impossible to take shots without crowds of people. Many other interesting monuments have been built a long time ago. It was a pity that the day was wasted.
review_translated_text:
Posetit dlya galochki, eto eshche mozhno. No esli pryamo chestno i otkrovenno, v Deli Akshardham mne v razy bolshe ponravilsya.

Zhara dikaya, ukrytsya ot nee negde. Naroda tolpy, nastolko tolpy, chto kogda zahodish imenno vnutr policeyskiy tolko i krichit move on, move, dont stop

To est pryam postoyat, posmotret, tem bolee sfotografirovat vnutri nelzya. Kadrov bez tolp naroda tozhe ne sdelat. Uzhe davno postroeno mnogo drugih interesnyh pamyatnikov. Zhalko bylo potrachennogo dnya.

review_text:
Great to look at but the prices are far from reality. Extreme difference between locals and vacationers. Park is partly dirty. Plastic waste is lying around.
Typically Indian, everything is a bit disorganized.

Toll anzusehen aber die Preise sind fern von jeder Realitat. Extreme Differenz zwischen Einheimischen und Urlauber. Park ist teilweise dreckig. Plastikmull liegt herum.

Typisch indisch lauft alles etwas unorganisiert ab.

name: isangug
review_text:
Contrary to its global reputation, the access process is very complicated and nerve-wracking.
If you get off at the tourist bus parking lot located 1.5 km away, you must take a shuttle bus or shuttle train to the east entrance. Not only do you have to wait for a long time for the shuttle buses and electric trains that operate at this time due to the limited number of buses, but the line is also a mess with no management, and when the shuttle car arrives, you have to rush around and board it without order.
The entrance fee is almost USD 20, and domestic and foreigners have to use the shuttle together and compete. Operating only a few small vehicles and transporting so many tourists by shuttle is a very unreasonable administrative method and a method of ignoring tourism order.
When the sun goes down in the evening, the shuttle vehicle does not run, so if you arrive at the end of the day, you have to walk to the parking lot.
You have to go see the Taj Mahal being transformed into the Damn Mahal.
Only the architecture is a world cultural heritage, and Indias tourism culture is ranked last in the world.
Lets not go! Lets not go! Lets not go!

name: Friedmund Stahl
review_text: The visit is a must for every visitor to India, but visiting the interior is, in my opinion, completely overrated! In less than 5 minutes you are pushed through the tomb by a raging crowd. Looking from the outside is enough!
review_translated_text: Der Besuch ist Pflicht fur jeden Indienbesucher, aber die Besichtigung des Inneren wird, meiner Meinung nach, vollig uberbewertet! In weniger als 5 Minuten wird man von einer tobenden Menge durch das Grabmal geschoben. Ansehen von aussen reicht!

name: Jonathan Slouchans
review_text: Certainly its a pretty building, but it wasnt worth getting up very early so as not to queue for 3 hours but only for 1 hour, a price which I believe is 80 times the price of the premises. There are sites in India that are much more beautiful for me and yet are free and where you can wander for hours.
review_translated_text: Certes c est un jolie batiment , mais qui ne valait pas le lever tres tot pour ne pas faire une queue de 3 heures mais de 1 heure seulement , un prix qui est je crois 80 fois le prix des locaux. Il y a des sites en Inde largement plus beau pour moi et qui pourtant sont gratuits et dans lesquels on peut y flaner des heures.

name: H Yu
review_text: Its annoying that guide-like people approach the gate and offer to let you in if you pay, but you can get in if you line up for about an hour. However, the line is so crowded that I have to fight off people who cut in, so its quite nerve-wracking. And no matter what you do in line, the main gate will close at 5pm, so be careful. On the day I went there, it was closed right in front of me and I ended up entering through the west gate, but at that time it was relatively smooth so I dont really know what was going on. Honestly, I think it would be easier to tour from Delhi. The building is wonderful, but the infrastructure is poor. Two stars.

Location: Agra, IndiaCoordinates: 27deg10'29''N78deg02'32''E / 27.174799degN 78.042111degE Altitude above sea level: 171 m. (561 ft)Constructed:1632-1653[facts needed]Architect:Ustad Ahmed Lahauri Architectural style(s):MughalTourists:Over 3 million (2003)UNESCO World Heritage SiteType:Cultural AwardCriteria:InDesignated:1983 (7th session)Reference number:252Nation : India Region: Asia-Pacific

This article is about the Taj Mahal building. For other uses, see Taj Mahal (disambiguation).

Play media

Taj Mahal incomparable heritage

The Taj Mahal is an excellent example of Mughal architecture. Its architectural style is a unique fusion of elements from Persian, Ottoman, Indian and Islamic architecture. In 1983, the Taj Mahal became a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along with this, it was described as one of the universally praised, outstanding human creations of world heritage. The Taj Mahal has also been declared the Jewel of Islamic Art of India. Unlike the buildings commonly seen covered with large sheets of marble blocks, its white dome and tiles are covered with marble [2] in shape. The tomb built in the center shows the combination of beauty in its architectural excellence. The special thing about the structure of the Taj Mahal building group is that it is completely symmetrical. Its construction was completed around 1648. [1] Ustad Ahmed Lahauri is often considered its main designer.

name: Deepak Meher
review_text:
Is it possible to give ratings to Taj. Its just mesmerizing. Though people around arent that polite and helpful. First of all, the taxi drivers, they said there is no place near the monument to keep your luggage, so you have to keep your luggage with us and pay extra. When we reached there was free cloakroom near the monument.

Things didnt end here. Inside the monument a so called photographer said he is certified, clicked random photos and charged us 20 per photo and trust me not a single photo was worth it. We had clicked far better photos in our phones. He charged us around 700 for some unwanted photos.

I would like to say one thing, what do you people gain by cheating tourists around the world for a mere 100 rupees. You would earn a little extra but spoil the travelers whole mood and excitement.

Just felt disgusted.
The photos Im uploading are all clicked by me on my phone. Because I had deleted the ones I had paid for.

name: Konstantin Aushev
review_text:
I believe there are places in India that are evenly beautiful and that have a much more inspiring atmosphere. Yes, the building is impressive, but the overall organisation, infrastructure around do now enable one to feel the place. Yes, the government tries to put some measures to prevent the landmark from dust and mud by banning the gasoline transport around or by fighting the plastic, but still - one should squeeze through crowded dirty streets, rusty gates, not talking about the city nearby. Even the history of the building is, for me, quite far from creating a positive mood. The poor girl was giving birth to another child every 1.5 years during her best years, for the 18th time she died and only after that her husband finally decided to build a home for her, and this construction bankrupted the country. I would not recommend coming specially just for a one-day tour from Delhi. Only if you decide to stay somewhere nearby on the way to another place - then you will probably come by early morning, and will have other feelings than me.
Visited on
Weekend

I went there on 29th of June ... It seems like over crowded than usual because It was bakrid and Ekasdashi holiday.. The entry ticket was Rs. 45 per person . There was a long line for entry ...even we had to wait more if we wouldnt have bought entry ticket online. I gave Rs. 200 per person charges to visit inside part of Taj Mahal and near by museum. Inside Taj Mahal there was only 2 tomb ... one is of Shah Jahan and another of Mumtaz mahal. I think it did not worth paying extra money than entry fee. I also got offended by some Muslim boys there.... they were deliberately taking our pictures which was a sad part of my journey. Rest Taj Mahal is really beautiful .

name: Deepak Joshi
review_text:
Its a big disappointment. Been here many times since 1971. But the present system is just a waste of money. It is an international monument, yet it is not under the government. I am emphatic about this fact. The online payment of 250 or roundabout you make online. Is just to get to the Base of the Taj. If you want to go on the marble platform you pay another 200 per head to another spurious looking ticket window. There is no net and connectivity of mobile. Making an online payment took a combination of three different handsets. All they provide is a set of shoe covers for 200. The marble platform is in shambles. It has marbles as if with bad quality waste stones.
The worst is there was no restriction earlier to go to the mausoleum inside, now they have partition of aluminium. Where they seek if you are a muslim, foreigner or what. Based on that you are given different treatment.. The fountains outside are not working, Earlier they used to work and look nice in day time.
There is the real burial site of Mumtaz Mahal in a storey below the fake ones. Even people say that is not the real ones. The real ones where water seeps in and drips on the burial site is another storey below. But like everything else it is shrouded in secrecy. The plinth of the monument, as the guide tells you is on ebony wood and it is below the level of the Yamuna ji, as ebony requires water to bear load or it will disintegrate. That means there has to be a lot of structure in between the garden level and the plinth. God knows what all is hidden beneath the ground levels.
But just a visit is OK. You dont need to come here again and again.

Weekday

name: Ujjawal
review_text:
Over the centuries the Taj Mahal has been subject to neglect and decay. A major restoration was carried out at the beginning of the 20th century under the direction of Lord Curzon, then the British viceroy of India. More recently, air pollution caused by emissions from foundries and other nearby factories and exhaust from motor vehicles has damaged the mausoleum, notably its marble facade. A number of measures have been taken to reduce the threat to the monument, among them the closing of some foundries and the installation of pollution-control equipment at others, the creation of a parkland buffer zone around the complex, and the banning of nearby vehicular traffic. A restoration and research program for the Taj Mahal was initiated in 1998. Progress in improving environmental conditions around the monument has been slow, however.

From time to time the Taj Mahal has been subject to India's political dynamics. Night viewing was banned there between 1984 and 2004 because it was feared that the monument would be a target of Sikh militants. In addition, it increasingly has come to be seen as an Indian cultural symbol. Some Hindu nationalist groups have attempted to diminish the importance of the Muslim influence in accounting for the origins and design of the Taj Mahal.

name: Suresh Menon
review_text:
One can find innumerable paeans to the poem in white marble on the Internet. No doubt it is a wonderful piece of architecture, but there are far more beautiful monuments throughout the length and breadth of this country with incredible architecture and incorporating science in their construction.
The gardens here are well laid-out and both the times I visited (1989 & 2017), some development or renovation work always mars the photo-ops.
18/12/23: Finally got to see the Tah without any scaffolding nor restoration work going on...
However, from the time one enters within 1/2 a km of the premises, hundreds of so-called guides and representatives of Meena Bazaar, Petha outlets & leather shops keep hounding your footsteps, marring ones experience. This continues inside the premises too with umpteen photographers vying with each other to spoil ones mood...

name: Kamal Joshi
review_text: The Taj Mahal just looks really amazing in personal rather than in photos. A must visit place in Agra. The Agra fort is just 2-3 km away from Tajmahal. Avoid travelling in peak summers and weekend. Use the government site to prebook the tickets as the offline counters are really crowded. Inside the tajmahal there is museum, where you can see the real portraits of mumtaj and shahjahan. You can also find the 14 rare stones which were used in tajmahal which were exported from 14 different cities. The are nearby the Tajmahal is very undeveloped. The roads afe closely packed with damaged buildings and lot of vehicles wrongly parked on streets. Hope the government will spend some revenue from Taj Mahal for the nearby area.overall experience was just awesome .

name: Rohit Kumar
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is a breathtakingly beautiful monument that exceeds expectations. This stunning white marble mausoleum, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, is a masterpiece of Indian architecture. A symbol of eternal love, the Taj Mahal is an unforgettable experience that leaves visitors spellbound and humbled. A must-visit wonder of the world.

review_text: I just cant describe how this monument experience was. But when you experience it for the first time, you just wonder how such a structure can even be built manually with such perfection...
