name: Pawan Shrotria
review_text:
A historical monument over-hyped by Indian government, may be for tourism purpose, as there are several histocial buildings/ temple in South India with much much better and intricate carving and comparatively much amazing architecture, like Konark temple, Meenakshi temple and many others.
Talking about Taj mahal it has normal good carving. Time is leaving stamps all over the building. Marble is worn out at many places. However an ok place to add one more historical monument in your travel list.

name: Ishaan khan
review_text:
My experience was horrible as an Indian point of view. I dont know it was good time to visit or not but this whole place was superly crowed with people. The line for tickets and line for entry was around 300m in total, there was no systems followed anyone would interfere in line and police will not show any concerns . Proper instructions were given that female and male will make 2 separate line as you about to reach at the entry gate the guard will separate the line for male and female which make things worse and now you finally enters the Taj Mahal you will forget all the suffering you had taken to see its beauty and will be mesmerize by its stunning symmetry but if you still want to enter in Taj Mahal it self to see how its look from inside who have to be in line of around 150 m long. Try to find the best time to visit at Taj Mahal ( means when there will less crowd )
Important note : bring socks or shoes cover as marble are hot and you cant enter in it with shoes.

name: Charlotte Jette Lemay
review_text:
The Taj Mahal itself is a beautiful construction. The story around it is however sad and even cruel for the workers but its the most famous monument in India so had to go.

The fee is extremely high, and always rising. Its 1100INR for tourist with a water bottle included + shoe cover. The place is well organized and we went through security really fast.

We went at 5:30 in the morning to be able to enter at sunrise and it was already pretty crowded.

Tips: the best facade to get less crowded pictures are sides. When you visit the inside just get out from the back. Everyone stays there. Go on one of the side. Its a lot better. Also, to have a less crowded picture of the front. Sit in front of the middle structure where everyone is taking pictures. There is shade and you can just wait so get a good snap. Its confortable since you can lean on the structure and beautiful since your next to the water fountains.

name: Eat.And.Travel.Forever
review_text:
The air is really bad - so toxic

especially in the morning  But the Taj Mahal is majestic

name: Vivek Manoharan
review_text: Loved the Grandeur! The artistry the history! But pathetic maintenance, management, no hygiene sense, cleanliness or direction sense, if Indias symbol is maintained and administered like this, something is definitely not right!

name: Atine De
review_text: A beautiful breathtaking monumental structure. Well designed and well conceived by the great Raja in memory of his beloved Mumtaz. The marble stone works is so designed, engraved, cut and pasted, all done manually, that you cant think of it being done in present times. Its well crafted artwork in stone. The system of wearing a disposable bag each on your shoes and walking around in the Taj is not eco friendly. Daily hundreds of bags waste is generated. Yet the premises is not dirt free. Its better to remove your footwear and walk around barefoot in order to maintain the place dust free. The area surrounding the Taj is not clean enough. However it is worth a visit especially to see the intricately designed artwork in marble slabs.

name: Krishan Kumar Aishpunani
review_text:
One of the 7th Wonder of universe. visit this place and enjoy the beautiful scenery of architecture. 5.4 km from Agra bus stand. avoid from heavy fare local auto. foreigners it is approx 213 km from New Delhi.
Foreigners are charged different amount instead of local (50 rs per person). avoid overcharged. once reaching at venue or parking by car its at a walking distance of 200 meter. avoid TANGE WALA and electric vehicle who will charge 100 rs. because its 10 rs per head cost. i experience , electric vehicle person get ready to drop 7 family member in INR30. yes. so bargain.
Show one photo ID to have all tickets for your friends and family . better to book on spot than online take your good food before entrance. Beware of agents. Monument is awesome. hardly you can finish your visit in 4 hours. rs200 is the overcharged imposed on people charge per person to visit Mumtaaz Makbara inside the Taj mahal. this charge was free visit charge inside earlier.

review_text:

people throwing garbage here and there and also no maintenance for queue.

name: Manas Dhall
review_text: One of the seven wonders of the world - Taj Mahal. When for the first time I went to Taj Mahal it was quite exciting. But after visiting Taj Mahal I realise that one can only go there for once. Apart from this Taj Mahal is having four entrace gates in all four directions. So much discrepancy in ticket fare like for Indians INR 50/- then there is ticket of INR 250/- too and for Foreigners it is of INR 1000/-. And we can see they are earning good amount of money from the tickets but cant see the utilisation of that money anywhere. The paths which join Taj Mahal to the main road there is not even a single street light there and in summer after 19hrs you can not see anything on that paths and is also not safe to travel after 19hrs. Last but not the least I recommend to visit Taj Mahal at least once in your life. Have happy and safer journey!

name: Topher Uy
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is indeed majestic and incredible, and all angles are Instagrammable. The only negative aspect I noticed when I was at the Taj Mahal was that I saw a guard beating a stray dog inside the palace. All the foreigners were shocked after witnessing that incident because the dog cried out in pain, and I saw his limbs swaying as if his bones were broken due to the severe beating by the guard or perhaps a police officer. As an animal lover, I was deeply shocked and disturbed by this incident, but unfortunately, there was nothing I or anyone else could do at that moment. I sincerely hope that animal lovers in India will take notice of this and work towards helping these poor dogs.

name: Emy Lee
review_text:
Taj Mahal. The UNESCO world heritage!!
Its beautiful no doubt. Inside the Taj for those who have not seen from pics or videos. As photography is banned. Its only a two min walk inside where the tomb of so called Mumtaz Mahal is placed at the center of the building. It has a history or it has further places beneath the building I am not sure. But we (Indian identity card holders) pay Rs.200 extra to walk this two min and see this tomb sitting admist of hand carved marbles. Rs.50 jus to enter in the garden area. The tickets are hyped for foreign nationals with foreign identity card. Rs.1500 per head. No eatables are allowed inside everything is jus discarded from ur bag before u enter thru one of the gates.

Guides and photographers flock around you as u enter the monument. you will be tired to chase them away of u dont want one.
But u always have one pic clicked there and printed that is stuck on ur fridge or lying on ur photo album as a memory. :)

There are washrooms at one end of the entrance for free. But they are always full and queue goes long way . And there are only three or four cubicles inside the washroom. They hav tried to keep it clean always house-keeping cleans it time to time. But our people make it dirty and dirty. The washroom infrastructure is not maintained. Its broken the fibre doors are falling and thats the way it is .

If u have bought the ticket to go inside the monument. Make sure u have the pair of shoe cover that vendors sell outside for Rs.10. if u dont then u will have to leave ur shoes and walk bare foot and then lose ur footwear if someone else likes it and flicks it.

Im sure lakhs or people are employed with Taj and around its tourism business. Even though there are lakhs of foreign tourists from outside country come to witness this monument, unfortunately the city of Agra is most dirty and poorly maintained.. Especially with litter and garbage and waste all around you in this city. But Taj like a lotus stands out beautifully white admist it.

Last thing. The last 300 or 500 meters around Taj is not allowed to access with cars or taxis. There are tongas or auto rikshaws that carry you from the security check point and then drop u at the entrance. And then back to ur car. U just have to negotiate with the rikshaws for a better price for ur drop.

Beware of the numerous vendors that flock around you selling various things while u walk out of those main gates. Theyre jus those people living around Taj selling some articrafts and photos and making their livelihood.

The feel of having visited Taj in d end will be like - did I come all the way travelling 4 hours jus for this?! But thats the way it is. But its a world heritage and proud of having it. :)

name: Abinash
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is a breathtakingly beautiful monument to love and devotion. The intricate marble work, the perfectly symmetrical design, and the serene gardens all come together to create an unforgettable experience. The changing colors of the marble as the sun rises and sets are a sight to behold. The history and romance surrounding the Taj Mahal only add to its allure. Its a must-visit destination for anyone interested in architecture, history, or simply experiencing one of the most stunning wonders of the world. The Taj Mahal is a true masterpiece that will leave you in awe.

review_text: Taj is most beautiful place of India but tickets charges are not pocket friendly 50+200= 250 Per person for Indian people its not fare...

name: Prince Arora
review_text:
A mesmerizing structure. It is at its best when you enter from the east gate and you view it through the gate. Looks dreamy. However, few points that could be improved.
When you visit from the east gate side on your own vehicle or auto, you are only allowed until the parking. Parking charges are 100 rs. You can take a golf cart from here which takes 10 rs per passenger but you will also see some carts and autos even after this barrier which offer you a ride for 50rs or less, the point is that they too drop you way before where the golf cart would drop you. A lot of people who did not take the govt golf cart and opted for the personal auto had to walk more than 200 meters, this could have been stopped.
There were a lot of empty plastic bottles lying around which could have been picked up.
When you exit from south gate (opposite of taj mahal), a lot of shops are there for shopping, they will try and scam you but you can get a good deal if you bargain, they almost give you 60-80% discount on asking price if you play right.

name: Mohit Joshi
review_text: In reality i dont like it and its enough to say next time i would like to go vrindavan mathura. So you can go if its your first time to visit but you will never think again

name: Vinay Gadiya
review_text: A good historic place but too much crowded. The harrassment to reach the parking is un bearable. Its pathetic. Lines for ticket purchase are also in bad shape. Post ticket purchase, entering into the Taj mahal main gate is also one of the biggest challenge you will have to face. Legally, government says the ticket is valid for hours from purchase. They should also understand that it takes minimum 1 hour to enter the main gate. The lines are so long that its tiring. Its not well managed. People who pay extra money can enter from exit row. After entering to the main gate, next task is to wait for your family members to come who might are in different line. And there is no waiting area where you can sit down and wait after more than 1 hour of queue. To reach main Taj Mahal building is another challenge because waiting queue here is larger. More than 400 to 500 people waiting before you to reach to the white beauty. Practically speaking, to reach to the main tomb, it will at least take your 2 and half hour of struggle and tiredness. Moreover, you can not even see the main makbara inside the Tomb. So suggestion - buy costlier ticket or take a guide who can walk you down without wasting time in queues. Do not rely on people who are saying Will give you quick pass in rs 100 or 200 per person .

name: Sue Chan csy
review_text:
Taj Mahal or Crown of Palace is one of the seven wonders of the world, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh.
It is an ivory-white marble mausoleum of Mughal architecture to house the tomb of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan s favourite wife Mumtaz Mahal and the Emperor himself over 42acres which includes a mosque and a guest house sets in formal gardens.
Beautiful Mughal architecture and majestic looking but I felt something is missing. It seems to have lost its charm.
I was expecting to see the original architecture with their real jewels in it.
Go and visit if you havent been yet.

name: Vikas Anand
review_text:
Its nice monument, a world heritage site but getting here is very painful specially when you are driving. Govt need to work on parking nearby. We could only find parking near Shahjahan Garden which was like 2+ KM away from West gate entry. Almost all roads leading to the Monuments entry are dug for metro work which not only slowed the traffic but made driving little risky too.

Agra has hot climate which made walking around little less enjoyable.

review_text: UNESCO World Heritage site. Amazing monument and huge architecture. its approximately 5.2km from Agra station. 50 is the entry fees and 200 is for taj Mahal entry. name: Caleb Friesen
review_text: The Taj itself is spectacular, but there were a few things that detracted from our visit and experience. Guides were being quite loud inside of the Taj, and it would have been nice for that space to be quiet. Also, there is a lot of waste surrounding the Taj. The river is full of it, as is the beach of said river. We looked out from the outdoor area at the northern side of the Taj and could see the bloated corpse of a cow in the river. This isnt the fault of those who manage the Taj Mahal property, but something really should be done to clean this area up.

name: B P_e
review_text: For the price I paid it was ok. This place needs way more information posted about this wonderful structures history. Secondly, keep the guides 300 metres away from the entrance. Theyre annoying for people that arent in tour groups. I thought I would spend at least 2 hours in here. I didnt. It was kind of disappointing to experience especially with the people of Agra and the way they treat foreigners

name: Shantonil Nag (Shaan)
review_text: Avoid going on the weekends as it is extreme rush. The Taj Mahal is best seen if you reach early morning. The regular vehicles are not allowed near the complex of Taj because of pollution, youll have to walk for 800 metres or take electric buses that take Rs. 5 each. Try to book the tickets online. Remember that online tickets require print out. There are official tour guides available near the ticket counters who charge only Rs. 100 to tell you everything very nicely. Make sure that you check their badges. Take shoe covers and wear it only after you enter the white marble area. Avoid eating or buying things from the nearby areas as they are extremely expensive.

review_text:
Personally, I wont recommend going on weekend or public holidays. It gets very crowded and you cant enjoy much. Entry fee for Indian is 250/- for both premise entry and entry inside the tajmahal. However it gets little costlier for foreign nationals.
Its little far from the parking and you can walk or book the golf cart for just 20/- per person one way. Public conveniences are available inside the premises. Parking is 100/- for personal vehicle.

name: Devraj Singh
review_text: The Taj Mahal is an architectural masterpiece that captivates with its intricate marble work, graceful proportions, and serene ambiance. This iconic monument stands as a testament to love and craftsmanship, showcasing the Mughal eras grandeur. The symmetrical layout, reflecting pools, and stunning gardens create a mesmerizing visual experience. However, the large crowds can sometimes diminish the sense of tranquility. Overall, the Taj Mahal is a must-visit for anyone seeking to witness the splendor of Indian history and culture.

name: Sushma K
review_text:
The roads that lead to Taj Mahal are extremely dirty and disgusting.
No maintenance, it's even worse during the rains. Measures have been taken only to keep the inside of Taj Mahal neat but as one of the seven wonders of the world, it's extremely disappointing to see the state of maintenance of such a beautiful architecture.
Do not get your tripod or gimbal as these are not allowed. Better to pay for the tickets online rather than staying in the queue for long times.
Also in the online version, we had a child (free for kids less than 15 y/o) accompanying us which should actually be free of cost but the option to select child is greyed out. We ended up paying full cost for the child as well since we had no other option.
The queue gets crowded, increasingly frustrating during hot afternoons - getting tickets online would be the easiest way to avoid long queues.
You can pay for Taj Mahal + Mausoleum (available online) where you can walk inside the Taj Mahal and see the tombs and architecture.
We had taken shoe covers from a vendor outside that allowed us to put these covers directly on our shoes and walk inside.
Overall, Taj Mahal is breathtakingly beautiful once you see it in front of your eyes 
Apart from crowd and minor inconveniences, your trip should be a good one!

name: Arpit Jain
review_text:
Things to remember when you go to visit Taj Mahal, as on 11 nov 2022
1. Book tickets online. mausoleum visit is 200 rs - 5 min wastage.
2. Foot covers cost rs 5 per pair
3. If travelling alone or just as a couple. Book a tour guide, he will be ur unofficial photographer for entire tour.
4. Only water bottles are allowed inside, no food item is permitted. so avoid bags with food items, sharp objects. Camera and phones are OK. Large bags are not deposited near entry point. So deposit them beforehand.
5. Dont buy blindly any memoirs , u will be charged double near Taj.
6. Visit early in the morning at 07:30 to avoid heavy crowds..
7. Delhis Akshardham Temple was way better than this monument with due respect to its centuries old construction.

name: Oliver Kemsley
review_text: Its iconic, but very, very crowded. I thought the views may be more impressive from across the River (saves a ticket purchase). Ticket entry is about 25 times more expensive for foreign tourists. Closed on Fridays. You receive a free bottle of water with ticket. Card payment allowed for ticket, but wasnt working. South gate is exit only. No food or other drink allowed inside. Less famous but equally impressive temple complexes elsewhere in India with a fraction of the crowds and at a fraction of the entry price.

name: Lazytadaki
review_text:
Stay overnight in Agra and visit the famous Taj Mahal, a tomb made entirely of marble.
It was apparently built by Shah Jahan, the fifth emperor of the Mughal Empire, for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal, who died in 1631.

Unparalleled beauty, registered as a World Heritage Site
It is said that Shahjahan built it as a symbol of his eternal love for his beloved wife.
It is said that there are many wonderful stories.
White Marble (Marlboro) The beautiful appearance of the pure white marble reflecting the sunlight and changing its appearance during the day and night attracted many people, and it was a truly wonderful space that did not seem like a grave.
The delicate carvings and inlays on the marble are a masterpiece of Islamic art, and are truly magnificent.
All the buildings are symmetrical, demonstrating the architectural techniques of the time and the great power of the emperor.

Registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983.
It was a masterpiece of Indian architecture, a fusion of Mughal culture and Islamic art!
Visited on
Weekday

name: Elis Nayara Prado de Godoi
review_text:
The expectations were higher, of course, its a beautiful, imposing building, it doesnt need any comments, but the number of scammers around and relentlessly approaching you almost ruins your experience here.

If you buy tickets at the entrance, there is a small window where you will get free bottled water and shoe covers (so no need to buy from people offering them on the street if you dont want to). You can buy your tickets alone at the entrance, no matter what the people who approach you on the street tell you.

At the entrance, people say they work there and tried to offer free tours, free photos... all scams, of course, so always be careful and refuse anything you dont want to pay for.

There are water fountains inside TAJ, but there are no vendors and you cannot bring food.

Dont take a tripod, drone, cigarette, pen... the list of what you cant enter is huge.

At 2pm, TAJ wasnt that crowded, we were able to take beautiful photos, but when we were leaving at 5pm, the number of people had tripled. It was 35 degrees on the day and there are few shadows.

Inside TAJ you can take photos wherever you want, but some photographers try to convince you otherwise, dominating the best photo spots, as if you could only take photos there if you paid them. Dont accept this, organize your space and only leave after photographing as you wish.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure
review_translated_text:
A expectativa era maior, claro, e uma linda construcao, imponente, dispensa comentarios, mas a quantidade de golpistas ao redor e te abordando incansavelmente quase estraga sua experiencia aqui.


Se voce comprar os ingressos na entrada, ha uma pequena janela onde voce pegara garrafa de agua gratuita e protetores para os sapatos (portanto nao precisa comprar das pessoas que oferecem na rua se voce nao quiser). Voce pode comprar seus ingressos sozinho na entrada, nao importa o que as pessoas que te abordam na rua te digam.


Na entrada, pessoas dizem que trabalham la e tentaram oferecer tour gratuito, foto gratuito.. tudo golpe, claro, entao esteja sempre atento e recuse tudo que nao quiser pagar.


Ha bebedouros de agua dentro do TAJ, mas nao ha vendedores e voce nao pode levar comida.


Nao leve tripe, drone, cigarro, caneta.. a lista do que nao pode ingressar e enorme.


As 2 da tarde, o TAJ nao estava tao cheio, pudemos tirar lindas fotos, mas quando estavamos saindo as 5 da tarde, o numero de pessoas tinha triplicado. Fazia 35 graus no dia e ha poucas sombras.


Dentro do TAJ voce pode tirar foto onde voce quiser, mas alguns fotografos tentam te convencer do contrario, dominando os melhores pontos para foto, como se voce so pudesse tirar foto la se pagasse a eles. Nao aceite isso, arrume seu espaco e so saia depois de fotografar como quiser.

And the gate manager who searches the belongings of Taj Mahal visitors confiscated even a palm-sized plastic fan to block the sun in the heat without knowing why, but people with other items of the same type passed without incident, which made me feel uncomfortable as I thought it was a search without standards. I heard.
Anyway, the Taj Mahal is worth seeing...

review_text:
The visit is definitely worth it. Please note that you are not allowed to take tripods, notepads (sic) or books inside and if they are found in your backpack at the entrance, you have to go outside again.

Away from the famous sightlines, the place is relatively littered, which unfortunately spoils the overall impression a bit, like the water in the ditches. Shoe covers litter the green spaces in abundance and inside, a security guard with a whistle disturbs any peace.

Der Besuch lohnt auf jeden Fall. Zu beachten ist dass man keine Stative, Notizblocke (sic) und Bucher mit rein nehmen darf und wenn sie am Eingang im Rucksack gefunden werden, man nochmal ganz nach draussen muss.


Abseits der beruhmten Sichtachsen, ist der Ort relativ stark vermullt, was den Gesamteindruck leider ein bisschen trubt, wie das Wasser in den Wassergraben. Schuhuberzieher liegen zu Hauf auf den Grunflachen und im Inneren stort ein Wachmann mit Trillerpfeife jegliche Ruhe.

Photography is prohibited inside.

name: Igor Zaharov
review_text:
Rus/Eng
Cost/Price - 1000 Rs
Rus
For the complex - 5
For organization - 1
A very beautiful and well-kept place with an incredible architectural heritage. Its really worth seeing.
There are 3 entrances to the complex. The storage room is located approximately 200 meters from the western entrance. And if you are turned away at another entrance to hand over your things, you will spend half an hour or more, which is what happened to me. I was sent to a storage room because I had a large backpack. And the man didn't care that it was empty. Big and thats it. Although later I saw people with backpacks larger than mine. Yes, you have to pay for entry in cash, which, given the situation in India, is very stupid. There is no cash, and they cannot provide payment by cards. Idiots, honestly. Shoe covers must be worn directly near the main building. If you follow the signs in the correct sequence, you will have to throw them away at the basket that says so. But then shoe covers are needed again. Well, you understand how everything is organized.
Yes, if you are going to Agra Fort, save your ticket.

I esli vas razvernut na drugom vhode, chtoby sdat veshchi, vy potratite polchasa ili bolee, chto so mnoy i proizoshlo. Menya otpravili v kameru hraneniya, potomu chto u menya byl bolshoy ryukzak. I cheloveka ne volnovalo, chto on pustoy. Bolshoy i vse tut. Hotya potom ya videl lyudey s ryukzakami pobolshe moego. Da, zaplatit za vhod neobhodimo nalichnymi, chto v kupe s situaciey v Indii ochen glupo. Nalichki net, a oplatu po kartam oni ne mogut obespechit. Idioty, chestnoe slovo. Neposredstvenno vozle glavnogo stroeniya nuzhno nadevat bahily. Esli idti po znakam v pravilnoy posledovatelnosti, to pridetsya ih vybrosit u korziny, na kotoroy tak i napisano. No potom bahily snova nuzhny. Nu vy ponyali, kak vse organizovano.

Da, esli sobiraetes v Agra fort, sohranite bilet.

name: DAVID KWON
review_text:
There are a lot of people. Its worth a visit once in your life.
You have to be careful of the monkey babies at the entrance.
Im just rushing in.

name: Maria D.
review_text:
Visiting the Taj Mahal is a special experience. We were there one morning and didnt have to wait long at security. We had previously bought the tickets online. Golf carts drive from the parking lot to the entrance of the Taj Mahal. For foreigners, the transfer is included in the ticket price. Nevertheless, the drivers try to ask for money.
Before security checks, foreigners are given free water and shoe covers at a hidden counter. The overcoats are required for visiting the mausoleum. There is a charge to use the toilet in front of the entrance, which is a disgrace given the fairly high ticket prices.
In front of and on the grounds of the Taj Mahal, foreigners are harassed by so-called tour guides and photographers. Its a shame that the police arent doing anything about it. As expected, the well-known photo spots were pretty crowded. So-called photographers constantly want to sell you their services. But I would advise against this. The cameras are so old that today every smartphone takes better photos. In addition, the would-be photographers try to claim certain photo spots only for themselves and try to drive visitors away from the picture section. Here you shouldnt be put off and simply ignore the photographers.
The facility itself is well maintained. But you can save yourself a visit to the museum.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
Yes
review_translated_text:
Der Besuch des Taj Mahal ist ein besonderes Erlebnis. Wir waren an einem Vormittag dort und mussten nicht lange an der Sicherheitskontrolle warten. Die Tickets hatten wir zuvor online gekauft. Vom Parkplatz zum Eingang des Taj Mahal fahren Golf Carts. Fur Auslander ist der Transfer im Ticketpreis enthalten. Nichtsdestotrotz versuchen die Fahrer Geld zu verlangen.

Vor den Sicherheitskontrollen erhalten Auslander an einem versteckten Schalter kostenlos Wasser und Schuhuberzieher. Die Uberzieher werden fur den Besuch des Mausoleums benotigt. Vor dem Eingang ist der Toilettenbesuch kostenpflichtig, was eine Frechheit bei den recht hohen Ticketpreisen ist.

Vor und auf dem Gelande des Taj Mahal werden Auslander von sogenannten Reisefuhrern und Fotografen bedrangt. Schade, dass die Polizei hier nichts dagegen unternimmt. Wie zu erwarten, war es an den bekannten Fotospots ziemlich voll. Sogenannte Fotografen wollen einem permanent ihre Leistungen verkaufen. Hiervon wurde ich aber abraten. Die Kameras sind so alt, dass heute jedes Smartphone bessere Fotos macht. Daruber hinaus versuchen die Mochtegern-Fotografen bestimmte Fotospots nur fur sich zu beanspruchen und versuchen die BesucherInnen aus dem Bildauschnitt zu vertreiben. Hier sollte man sich nicht beirren lassen und die Fotografen einfach ignorieren.

Die Anlage selbst ist gut gepflegt. Den Besuch des Museums kann man sich aber sparen.

name: DB
review_text: Yes, of course, the place is historically remarkable. But I didn't see anything grandiose and I don't recommend paying $100 for travel, even a comfortable one, from Delhi and back. Delhi itself has equally interesting places. Well, yes, there are a lot of scammers, just like everywhere else in India.
review_translated_text: Da, konechno, mesto istoricheski primechatelnoe. No nichego grandioznogo ya ne uvidel i platit 100 dollarov na dorogu, pust i komfortabelnuyu, iz Deli i obratno ya ne sovetuyu. V samom Deli est ne menee interesnye mesta. Nu da, kucha moshennikov, kak i povsyudu v Indii.

name: Joaquin Loaiza
review_text:
I dont understand why it is considered one of the seven wonders of the modern world. Well, yes it is a little impressive, but to see it once and then leave. Inside there are only two tombs surrounded by dirty, poorly maintained marble and people asking for money to show you the glow of some stones with a flashlight.
The photo that can be taken is the same that anyone has taken of the Taj Mahal. In my opinion it is not worth going. Or go but dont stay there for long. Additionally, the place at its entrance and inside is full of people looking to get money from tourists by any means.
review_translated_text:
No entiendo por que es considerada una de las siete maravillas del mundo moderno. Bueno, si es un poco impresionante, pero como para verlo una vez y luego irse. En su interior no hay mas que dos tumbas rodeadas de marmol sucio mal mantenido y de gente pidiendo dinero para mostrarte el fulgor de unas piedras con una linterna.

La foto que se puede tomar es la misma que cualquiera ha tomado del Taj Mahal. En mi concepto no vale la pena ir. O ir pero no quedarse mucho tiempo alli. Adicionalmente el lugar en su ingreso y en su interior esta lleno de personas buscando obtener dinero de los turistas por cualquier medio.

name: S. B.
review_text: Now the Taj Mahal is under renovation as you can see from the photo. Certainly one of the most beautiful monuments in India but full of intrusive people and photographers. In India there are more beautiful and less crowded monuments such as Khajuraho and Ranakpur.

name: Kirill Kuryshev
review_text: To be honest, I expected more. Yes, its beautiful. Yes, one of the wonders of the world. But, firstly, there was very little space inside. Secondly, reconstruction of the minarets, thirdly, huge queues and sooo many people. They ruin any angle. In general, the impression of a fairy tale did not work out. Although the building itself and its design are certainly impressive!

name: Angga Al Santosa
review_text: It is known that The Taj is one of the Wonders of the World! It is known to be one of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites!! The Taj is known as a legend of an Emperors eternal love for his favorite Queen!!! Well, The Taj has distinctions far beyond these! So, The Taj, definitely deserves your visit again and again!!! Come, Walk along the path beside the reflecting pool with fountains to the mausoleum crafted in soft and pure marble and jeweled with semi-precious stones, where in the serenity of paradise rests the Queen in peace with her King. Come and explore the pages of the past to cast the spell from its mystique and enrich your imagination about this wonder of an age in stone, The Taj! The grace of the perfection of the proportions and the grandeur of the geometric patterns of the well-appointed gardens that enhance the position of the entire complex together add magnificence to the delicacy of this cup of love, dedication and purity, The Taj ! Come and take a dip in the saga of The Taj, driven by no fiction but facts and unfolding a saga, which is based only on pure love! Beauty lies in the eyes of the beholder! Probably for Taj Mahal, the axiom is just the other way around. The Taj is beauty personified! The Taj shows its different moods through its varied shades. The Taj has as many shades as any kind of beauty can ever have! The Taj is red in the morning, milky white in the evening, golden when the moon shines and intermediate variations during different hours of the day and during different seasons in a year. The picturesque descriptions of contemporary historians at the period of its creation, the facts revealed by scholars and archaeologists today and the panoramic montage of the reasons for its creation are drawn at every step that you will go towards the mausoleum next time that you visit the Taj! A look this time on the Taj will keep you with thoughts that overlap your view and will make you feel the presence of Shah Jahan, the Creator and Mumtaz Mahal, the Reason, as if walking with you. Where its breathtaking splendor leaves you breathless and you tend to take a break for a while but keep looking at The Taj, you will feel it standing next to you! If one has a heart that beats and that beats beats to seek, the purity of love galore! It definitely deserves a visit to The Taj, as much as The Taj deserves your visit once, and even more! Come to The Taj with blissful pride! Bring the saga to life!! Come; fall in love, every time!!!
review_translated_text: Si sa chi U Taj he unu tra e Meraviglie di u Mondu! Si sa chi he unu di i siti di u Patrimoniu Mondiale di lUNESCO !! Si cunnosce u Taj cume una legenda di lamore eternu di un Imperatore per a so Regina preferita !!! Ebbe, U Taj ha distinzioni assai al di la di queste! Dunque, U Taj, merita sicuramente a vostra visita una volta e piu !!! Venite, Camminate longu u caminu accantu a a piscina riflettente cu fontane finu a u mausoleu artigianale in marmaru dolce e puru e ghjuvellatu di pietre semi preziose, induve in a serenita di u paradisu riposa a Regina in pace cu u so Re. Venite a spiega e pagine di u passatu per scaccia lincantu da a so mistica e arricchisce a vostra fantasia annantu a sta maraviglia di unepica in petra, U Taj! A grazia di a perfezione di e prupurzione e a grandezza di i mudelli geomettrici di i giardini ben numinati chi valurizeghjanu a pusizione di tuttu u cumplessu aghjunghjenu inseme magnificenza a a delicatezza di sta mancia damore, di dedica e di purezza, U Taj! Venite a fa un tuffu in a saga di U Taj, scacciatu da nisuna fittizia ma fatti e sviloppu una saga, chi un si basa ca in amore puru! A bellezza si trova in lochji di u spettatore! Probabilmente per Taj Mahal, lassioma he solu a linversu. U Taj he a bellezza personificata! U Taj mostra i so sfarenti umori attraversu e so sfumature varie. U Taj ha tante sfumature quante ogni tipu di bellezza po mai ave! U Taj he rusulinu a matina, biancu lattosu a sera, doratu quandu a luna splende e e varianti intermediate durante e diverse ore di a ghjurnata e durante e diverse stagioni in un annu. E descrizzioni pittoresche di i storichi cuntempuranei a u periodu di a so creazione, i fatti rivelati da i studiosi e archeologhi doghje e u montagiu panoramicu di e ragioni di a so creazione so disegnati a ogni passu chi andereste versu u mausoleu a prossima volta chi visitate u Taj! Un sguardu sta volta nantu a u Taj vi fara cunserva cun penseri chi sovrapponenu a vostra vista e vi fera sente a presenza di Shah Jahan, u Creatore e Mumtaz Mahal, a Ragione, cume se camminassi cun voi. Induve u so splendore mozzafiato vi face stupisce senza fiatu e avete a tendenza a fa una pausa per un pezzu ma a cuntinuva a fighja U Taj, li senteriate sta accantu a voi! Si unu ha un core chi batte e chi batte batte per circa, a purezza di lamore in galore! Sicuramente si merita una visita a U Taj, quante U Taj merita a vostra visita una volta, e ancu di piu! Venite a <<U Taj>> cu una fierezza beata! Purtate a saga vene in vita !! Veni; innamurati, ogni volta !!!

name: Shakhawan Shekhany
review_text: Great place to photograph

name: Andre Berthelette
review_text: Very beautiful but crowded with tourists. Slightly excessive security measures:. They dont let you pass with a flashlight, a Swiss penknife or a big enough backpack. You must leave everything with a nearby merchant before entering (free service but they hope for a purchase in return)
review_translated_text: Tres beau mais bonde de touristes. Mesures de securite un peu excessives:. Ils ne vous laissent pas passer avec une lampe de poche, un canif suisse ou un sac a dos assez gros. Il faut laisser le tout chez un commercant a proximite avant dentrer (service gratuit mais ils esperent un achat en retour)

name: Anuj Upadhyay
review_text:
#TajMahal Taj Mahal is the sixth most popular in the world

Memorial 

Taj Mahal, a living symbol of the love of Shahjahan and Mumtaz Mahal, is the sixth major monument in the world and the second major monument in Asia. This fine example of Mughal architecture has been selected in the Travellers Choice Award 2018 of online travel advisory company Trip Advisor.

In the last 12 months, people have written many reviews on the companys site about this tale of love carved from white marble and given it their ratings. By assessing these figures, the company has placed Taj Mahal at this position in this years list.
,
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
30-60 min

Reservation recommended
No

#TajMahal taajmhl vishv kaa chtthaa sbse lokpriy


smaark 


shaahjhaaN aur mumtaaj mhl ke prem kii jiitii jaagtii nishaanii taajmhl, duniyaa kaa chtthaa aur eshiyaa kaa duusraa prmukh smaark hai. mugl sthaapty klaa ke is behtriin nmuune ko oNnlaain yaatraa slaah dene vaalii kNpnii ttrip eddvaaijr ke ttraivlrs coNis avaardd 2018 meN cunaa gyaa hai.


sphed sNgmrmr se ukerii gii is ishk kii daastaan ke baare meN pichle 12 mhiinoN meN logoN ne kNpnii kii saaitt pr kii smiikssaaoN ko likhaa aur ise apnii rettiNg dii. inhiiN aaNkdd'oN kaa aakln krke kNpnii ne taajmhl ko is saal kii suucii meN is sthaan pr rkhaa hai.

.

name: riccardo galeano
review_text: On foggy days they shouldnt keep it open because its a theft for tourists since they are the only ones who have to pay 1,000 rupees and see nothing.. the Taj Mahal is wonderful if you admire it in its Magnificence from afar.. Getting under the mausoleum and looking at it through the haze Breaking your neck isnt worth it. .
review_translated_text: In giorni di nebbia non dovrebbero tenerlo aperto perche e un furto per i turisti visto che sono i soli a dover pagare 1.000 rupie e non vedere nulla .. il Taj Mahal e meraviglioso se lo si ammira nella sua Magnificenza dalontano .. Arrivare sotto il mausoleo e guardarlo tra la foschia Spezzandosi il collo no ne vale la pena. .

name: Santiago Meneghetti
review_text:
Very beautiful place, fantastic story and breathtaking views. Its enough to give you goosebumps due to its size and beauty. The only bad point is the continuous approach of guides, sellers and Tuk Tuk drivers on the way to the taj. You have to be rude for them to stop bothering you. Dont believe the guides that talk about huge queues etc, foreigners pay 1300 rupees and can cut the queue, just go in the middle.
Entry with bags, backpacks and the like, nor food, is not permitted. Just water.
Closed on Friday.
review_translated_text:
Lugar muito bonito, historia fantastica e visual de tirar o folego. Chega ate arrepiar pelo seu tamanho e beleza. O unico ponto ruim e a abordagem continua de guias, vendedores e motoristas de Tuk Tuk no caminho ate o taj. Tem que ser grosso para eles pararem de importunar. Nao acredite nos guias q falarem em filas enormes etc, quem eh estrangeiro paga 1300 rupias e consegue cortar fila, so ir pelo meio.

Nao se permite a entrada com sacolas, mochilas e afins, nem comida. So agua.

Fechado na sexta feira.

name: Mars "iKEN" Cc
review_text: Its okay, but the ticket price of 1,000 rupees is a bit expensive. It mainly depends on the overall structure of the building, and the artistic details are not of high value. If you have seen other large buildings, you will feel ordinary. There are huge crowds of people and red flags waving. Indians especially like to take pictures. There will be people in any of your photos. It would be better to come in the morning.

name: Eduardo Majlis
review_text:
The Taj is wonderful, but getting there is very, very overwhelming, at least from Delhi.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
No
review_translated_text:
El Taj es maravilloso, pero llegar es muy pero muy agobiante, al menos desde Delhi.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
No

name: Billy
review_text:
The price has risen to 1000rp. Of course, not expensive for a world-class attraction.
However, the Taj Mahal is not as shocking as imagined (the reflection is stunning) because it is too small! And, there are many more wonderful marble buildings in India.
In addition, it was undergoing major repairs when it arrived, which seriously affected the appearance, but the official had no way to notify the outside world!
Note that there are many people claiming to be tour guides at the ticket office, so ignore them if not necessary.

name: Ali Fazal
review_text: Taj Mahal

name: D Rud
review_text: Very nice experience but terribly poorly organized. Its virtually impossible to see the sunrise because even at 6 in the morning you have to wait in line for at least an hour. In addition, it is explained to you too late what you are not allowed to take with you. If you have anything illegal with you, such as a pack of cigarettes or an e-cigarette, you have to wait in line at the back, which is an absolute joke. In addition, it is not clear where you can buy the tickets because they are not available at the entrance! You have to buy them further down the street. The staff throughout the entire complex is very unfriendly and arrogant. The price is of course far too high but of course you want to see the Tajmahal.
review_translated_text: Sehr schones Erlebnis jedoch schrecklich schlecht organisiert. Es ist quasi unmoglich den Sonnenaufgang zu sehen da man selbst um 6 in der fruh mindestens eine Stunde in der Schlange steht. Ausserdem wird einem zu spat erklart was man alles nicht mitnehmen darf. Sollte man irgendetwas unerlaubtes mit sich fuhren wie etwa eine Packung Zigaretten oder eine E Zigarette muss man sich ganz hinten erneut anstellen ein absoluter Witz. Dazu kommt dass nicht ersichtlich ist wo man die Tickets erwirbt da diese nicht beim Eingang erhaltlich sind! Man muss sie ein Stuck weiter die Strasse runter kaufen. Das Personal ist in der gesamten Anlage sehr unfreundlich und arrogant. Der Preis ist naturlich viel zu hoch aber man will das Tajmahal naturlich gesehen haben.

name: Ogretirim Ogretir
review_text: From the outside, it looks great as an outdoor space, but it is a place where the inside does not support the beauty of the outdoors, it is subjected to a lot of seller harassment, the buses and transportation vehicles there and the location are very bad and it does not suit the place and needs to be fixed immediately.
review_translated_text: Disaridan bakildiginda dis mekan olarak harika gorunuyor, ancak icerisinindis mekan guzelligini desteklemedigi satici tacizine cok fazla maruz birakilan, oradaki otobus ve ulasim araclarinin ve yerinin cok kotu oldugu oraya yakismayan hemen duzeltilmesi gereken bir yer.

name: Victor Kuminov
review_text: Only connoisseurs of monumental architecture should come here. Be prepared for the fact that every Indian who contacts you wants to deceive you or make money from you. A huge number of scammers of all stripes. Don't talk to anyone and silently go to the ticket office, there you will buy a ticket for 1300 rupees per person, which includes a visit to the closed area around the Taj Mahal, inside, as well as a tax on the sights of Agra, you will also have the opportunity to pass through with this ticket special passages for tourists without queuing.
review_translated_text: Syuda stoit ehat tolko cenitelyam monumentalnoy arhitektury. Budte gotovy k tomu chto kazhdyy indus kotoryy obrashchaetsya k vam, hochet vas obmanut ili zarabotat na vas. Ogromnoe kolichestvo moshennikov vseh mastey. Ni s kem ne zagovarivayte i molcha idite k kasse, tam vy kupite bilet za 1300 rupiy na cheloveka, kotoryy vklyuchaet poseshchenie zakrytoy ploshchadi vokrug tadzh mahala, vnutri, a tak zhe nalog na dostoprimechatelnosti Agry, eshche u vas budet vozmozhnost prohodit s htim biletom po specialnym prohodam dlya turistov bez ocheredi.

name: Dr.Govind Vaishnav
review_text: Saw Taj Mahal at 6 pm (on 24-11-18)

name: Fane Youssouf
review_text: I am traveling in Mali currently I am in wellesse bougou.
review_translated_text: je suis en voyage au Mali actuellement je sui a wellesse bougou.

name: Daniel Richter
review_text: It was nice, but when I tried to take a selfie with a so-called Sult rooster, a sack was put over my head and after days of starvation I was dragged to a square and then strangely dressed people started throwing stones at me throw. 3 stars because the stones were not painted.
review_translated_text: War ganz schon, aber als ich versucht habe eine Selfie mit einem so genannten Sult Hahn zu machen, wurde mir ein Sack uber den Kopf gesteckt und nach Tagen des Hungerns wurde ich auf eine Platz geschleift und dann fingen komisch gekleidete an, Steine nach mir zu werfen. 3 Sterne, da die Steine nicht bemalt waren.

name: Silvia
review_text: I expected something better...maybe the light wasnt perfect, maybe there were too many people...they didnt let me bring my stuffed bunny and a guard told me it was forbidden to read the guide near the tai...
review_translated_text: Mi aspettavo qualcosa di meglio..forse la luce non era perfetta,forse cera troppa gente.. non mi hanno fatto portare il mio coniglietto di peluche e una guardia mi ha detto che era vietato leggere la guida vicino al taj...

name: harsh tripathi
review_text:
50 rupees entry ticket, later 250 rupees separately to visit White Marvel,
By the way, it takes only 50 balls to complete the journey.

name: mania google
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is a 16th-century tomb built in northern India for Shahshahan, the fifth emperor of the Mughal Empire, considered the Holy Roman Empire of Central Asia. This mausoleum was constructed of marble over 20 years in memory of a wife who died young in her 30s.
The death of his wife, who had given birth to 14 children in 18 years, was a shock that drove the king crazy.In his later years, he was imprisoned in the castle by his aides due to his orgies in which he violated the wives of his vassals, and he gazed at the Taj Mahal to remember his wife. A historical legacy: Dozens of princesses and princes are born in polygamous kingdoms? The nation is shocked by the sexual overflow

name: Xenofanter
review_text:
Well, because everything is completely touristy. Uhhhh
And you have no way of admiring the Taj Mahal without paying some kind of entrance fee. Even public paths to the river are cordoned off and can only be passed by Indians or with an entrance fee. All in all a money printing machine. In contrast to this, of course, is the Taj Mahal in its enormous size and beauty. Therefore worth a trip.
review_translated_text:
Also weil alles vollig touristisch is. Ahhhh

Und man gar keine Moglichkeit hat das taj Mahal auch so zu bewundern, ohne irgendwelche Eintrittsgelder zu zahlen. Selbst offentliche Wege zum fluss werden abgeriegelt, und sind nur fur Inder oder gegen Eintritt zu passieren. Alles in allem eine Gelddruckmaschiene. Dem gegenuber steht naturlich der Taj Mahal in seiner gewaltigen Grosse und Schonheit. Deshalb eine Reise wert.

name: Eden
review_text: Everything has already been said about the TajMahal. But I have a few more things to tell you that can help you fellow travelers...first pay 200rp to keep your luggage 10 minutes walk from the main entrance...then return to pay for the visit which is worth it first at the counter 1000rp fixed price for foreigners. Then you follow the special foreign passage (often few people compared to Indian visitors) to the monument without queuing. The same during the visit and the same to collect your shoes which are prohibited inside. In short, you overtake everyone. Amazing. The visit takes less than an hour but we take our time so 1h30 quietly and without shopping nearby.
review_translated_text: Tout est deja dit sur le TajMahal. Mais jai quelque trucs en plus a vous dire qui peut vous aider amis voyageurs...dabord payer 200rp pour garder vos bagages a 10mn a pied de l entree principal...puis retourner pour payer la visite quu se paye dabord au guichet 1000rp prix fixe pour les etrangers. Puis ensuite tu suis le passage special etranger (souvent peu de monde compare aux visiteurs indiens) jusquau monument sans faire la queue. Pareil pendant la visite et pareil pour recuperer vos chaussures interdite a l interieur. Bref tu doubles tout le monde. Etonnant. La visite se fait en moins dune heure mais on prends notre temps donc 1h30 tranquille et sans faire les achats a cote.

name: Nomades y Locos
review_text: A lot of trouble getting a small camera in. If you come, dont bring anything but your cell phone!
review_translated_text: Mucho problema para entrar una pequena camara. Si vienen no traigan nada mas que el celular.!

name: Isidro
review_text: The Taj Mahal is a mausoleum built between 1632 and 1653 in the city of Agra, state of Uttar Pradesh, India, on the banks of the Yamuna River, by the Muslim emperor Shah Jahan of the Mughal dynasty. The imposing complex of buildings was erected in honor of his favorite wife.
review_translated_text: El Taj Mahal es un mausoleo construido entre 1632 y 1653 en la ciudad de Agra, estado de Uttar Pradesh (India), a orillas del rio Yamuna, por el emperador musulman Shah Jahan de la dinastia mogol. El imponente conjunto de edificios se erigio en honor de su esposa favorita.

name: Sandeep Delite
review_text: There is nothing as crazy as the people are. Perhaps it is fine for children studying history, but for other children it is better to see in other photos. Looking ahead is just a waste of time and money. watch the rest of my videos
review_translated_text: jitnaa krej hai logo kaa us hisaab se kuch bhii nhiiN hai, /  shaayd histtrii pddh'ne vaale bccoN ke lie tthiik hai, baakii bcco kelie baakii photto meN jyaadaa behtr hai dekhnaa /  saamne dekhkr sirph smy aur paise kii brbaadii hai /  baakii merii viddiyo dekhe

name: Alex Ryabinov
review_text: A beautiful place, but there is a lot of game around. At the entrance there is a search like in a concentration camp. The overall impression is balanced by negative factors. Very crowded. If I had not come here, I would not have regretted it.
review_translated_text: Krasivoe mesto, no dich vokrug polnaya. Na vhode obysk kak v konclagere. Obshchee vpechatlenie vyravnivaetsya otricatelnymi faktorami. Ochen lyudno. Esli by ne doehal do syuda to ne pozhalel by.

name: Aibek Tilekmatov
review_text: A very long queue, a lot of fraudulent guides who speak a little bit of almost all languages   and are ready to follow you to the entrance, they will tell you few interesting facts and after 1 hour they will start to rush you so that you pay the money as soon as possible, because for them time is money and missed opportunities to find other clients, I advise you to watch a couple of documentaries before going to see the Taj Mahal. Entrance fee for Indians is 50 rupees, for foreigners - 1000 rupees. At the entrance they take away any food, books, notepads, monopods, leave everything in the hotels in advance
review_translated_text: Ochen dlinnaya ochered, mnogo moshennikov-gidov, kotorye govoryat pochti na vseh yazykah po chut chut i gotovy idti za vami do vhoda, oni rasskazhut vam malo interesnyh faktov i posle 1 chasa nachnut vas toropit, chtoby vy poskoree oplatili dengi, tak kak dlya nih vremya eto dengi i upushchennye vozmozhnosti nayti drugih klientov, sovetuyu posmotret paru dokumentalok prezhde chem idti smotret Tadzh Mahal. Vhod dlya indusov - 50 rupiy, dlya inostrancev - 1000rupiy. Na vhode otbirayut lyubuyu edu, knigi, bloknoty, monopody, zaranee ostavte vse v otelyah

name: Ekaterina Yakovleva
review_text:
A lot of people. Probably, if we come to the opening, it will be better.
In the spring of 2017, admission cost 1000 rupees per person. In my opinion the price is very high.

name: Aryutokintumi
review_text: You have to go, why you have to go. Why do you put India in Google and the Taj Mahal appears? The entrance costs 1000 rupees if you are a foreigner, compared to the 30 that locals pay to see the same thing as you. It may be irritating, but the truth is that it entitles you to "premium" admission. When you get closer to the entrance you will see a queue that is practically kilometer long, well thats the queue for the locals, I dont even want to imagine when they have to wait at 40 degrees in the shade to be able to enter. With 1000 rupees, foreigners enter without practically queuing. The area is landscaped, with the typical ponds in the photo. The building itself is impressive. But dont be fooled, forget about the Taj Mahal of the Internet. It is completely packed with people, more than it can accommodate. The visit is a constant burden unfortunately. The worst comes when you try to access the building, they only have one staircase with a row of 1. They take turns so that some go up and then go down, it is complete chaos. You find yourself in the middle of the crowd dying of heat with people pushing in all directions. Then inside, from my point of view it is not worth spending said drink. The deserved view is from the outside.
review_translated_text: Tienes que ir, por que tienes que ir. Por que pones India en google y te aparece el Taj Mahal. La entrada cuesta 1000 rupias si eres extranjero, frente a los 30 que pagan los locales por ver lo mismo que tu. Puede resultar irritante, pero lo cierto es que te da derecho a la entrada "tipo premium". Cuando os vayais acercando a la entrada vereis una cola practicamente kilometrica, bien esta es la cola de los locales, ni me quiero imaginar cuando deben esperar ellos a 40 grados a la sombra para poder entrar. Con las 1000 rupias, los extranjeros entran sin hacer cola practicamente. La zona esta ajardinada, con los tipicos estanques de la foto. El edificio en si es impresionante. Pero que no os enganen, olvidaros del Taj Mahal de Internet. Esta completamente repleto de gente, mas de la que puede acoger. La visita es un constante agobio por desgracia. Lo peor viene cuando se intenta acceder al edificio, tienen tan solo una escalera con fila de 1. Hacen turnos para que unos suban y luego bajen, es un completo caos. Te ves en medio de la multitud muerto de calor con empujones a todas direcciones. Luego dentro, desde mi punto de vista no merece la pena pasar dicho trago. La vista merecida es desde fuera.

name: Blitzliner
review_text: You cannot pay with a Visa card and by Indian standards it is extremely overpriced at 1000 INR. Otherwise a remarkable mausoleum. Nevertheless, there are more beautiful places in India than Agra.
review_translated_text: Man kann nicht mit Visa Karte bezahlen und ist nach indischen Verhaltnissen masslos uberteuert mit 1000 INR. Sonst ein beachtliches Mausoleum. Dennoch gibt es schonere Platze in Indien als Agra.

name: nv`h ryyklr
review_text:
A very impressive place, clean and well maintained.
We came to the place only because all the tourists come but I think it is not such an interesting place, the place does have a beautiful history and is impressive in terms of appearance compared to the period but it is not clear how it is one of the seven wonders of the world and why so many travelers come there at a price that is exorbitant compared to India (1100 rupees) which is 55 shekels)...
The attitude to tourists there is very nice and they are not allowed to stand in line to enter the temple (which is really lucky because if I had waited the whole line I would have been disappointed by nothing that I see inside).
There is a place to keep things outside and drinking bottles are distributed.

ysh mqvm lshmyrt khptsym bkhvts vmkhlqym bqbvqy shtyh.

name: Natanael Calderon Pujante
review_text: They have it overexploited. Yes, it is a spectacular and very beautiful mausoleum, but charging tourists with such a high entrance price seems like an abuse to me.
review_translated_text: Lo tienen sobreexplotado. Si, es un mausoleo espectacular y muy bonito, pero cargar a los turistas con el precio de la entrada tan elevada me parece un abuso.

name: Shri Krishna Pandey
review_text: It is a beautiful place..which is now becoming dirty..marvel is here..it is more dirty..plastic bottles have been found..because of the presence of water..I cant even see it.. If you dont have a vehicle..prr..you can also see a few motor bikes..if you want..you can also make a cycle stand..to save from pollution..
review_translated_text: Sundar jagah hai..jo ki ab gandi ho rahi hai..marvel gihis..rahi hai..gandgi jada hai..plastic bottle padi hui h..pani jama hone ki wajah se..kai bhi dikhi..mene..kehne ko vehical ban h..prr..kuch moter bike bhi dekhi..agar chahe..toh cycle stand bhi bnwa skte hai..pollution se bachane k liye..

name: Kishor Helge
review_text: Nothing but taking pictures

name: Mirabela Blendea
review_text: Nice location, just extremely crowded, needs some improvements.
review_translated_text: Locatie frumoasa, doar extrem de aglomerat, necesita unele imbunatatiri.

name: Vadim P
review_text: Well, there is 0 service, everyone is being driven forward and you can't stand in the Taj. The difference in ticket price for a tourist and an Indian is 20 times!!! Pushing aside crowds of Indians in order to at least have time to see something on the go while paying like 20 Indians is a dubious pleasure...
review_translated_text: Nu servisa 0, vseh gonyat vperyod stoyat v tadzhe nelzya. Raznica v cene bileta turistu i indusu 20raz!!! Rastalkivat tolpy indusov chtob hot chto to uspet posmotret na hodu zaplativ kak 20 indusov somnitelnoe udovolstvie...

name: Balint Ureczky
review_text:
when we went there was no water in the fountains and 1 of the 4 columns was being renovated. very crowded. you are not allowed to bring food in, they look through the bag and get lost (a bunch of monkeys are jumping next to the bin and they sneak out and eat it)
it is worth seeing from the tea garden at sunset

name: Alina Arslanova (Alina_yoga_coach)
review_text:
Ive been dreaming of visiting for a very long time. But the expectations were not met. Overpraised place. One feels emptiness and sorrow instead of the happiness of great love. A lot of people. People enter the mausoleum as if on a conveyor belt. The crowd goes in and out in a circle. Everything else is just a park. Plus one - the photos come out beautiful, you can decorate your instagram. And the story is terrible.

At the exit, souvenirs are sold at 4 times the real price. Feel free to bargain. And buy not at the first kiosks, but somewhere starting from the 10th.
Red magnets price 10 rupees, marble Taj figurines 100, balls with Taj from 20 rupees.
review_translated_text:
Mechtala posetit ochen davno. No ozhidaniya ne opravdalis. Perehvalennoe mesto. Oshchushchaetsya pustota i skorb vmesto schastya velikoy lyubvi. Ochen mnogo lyudey. Vo vnutr mavzoleya zahodyat kak po konveyeru. Tolpa po krugu idet i vyhodit. Vse ostalnoe prosto park. Plyus odin - fotki vyhodyat krasivye, mozhno ukrasit instu. A istoriya strashnaya.


Na vyhode suveniry prodayut v 4 raza dorozhe realnoy ceny. Smelo mozhno torgovatsya. I pokupayte ne v pervyh kioskah a gdeto nachinaya s 10go.

Magnitiki krasnaya cena 10 rupiy, figurki tadzha iz mramora 100, shary s tadzhem ot 20rupiy.

name: Hubert Bauer
review_text: Obsolete cultural monument swarmed by neppers and traffickers. Entrance fee of around 15 euros is quite hefty for a photo object with traditional content.
review_translated_text: Uberholtes Kulturdenkmal von Neppern und Schleppern umschwarmt. Eintritt mit ca. 15 Euro recht deftig fur ein Fotoobjekt mit uberkommenen Inhalt.

name: Aska Chao
review_text: It's just that it's famous, but there's rubbish everywhere around it.
review_translated_text: Zhi Shi Ming Qi Da Er Yi,Zhou Bian Dao Chu Shi La Ji

review_text:
- big queue
- hot

- many people

- they take away everything the guard wants at the entrance, including children's toys, cards
- they are in a hurry in every place, you can't stop and look at the graves
+ attraction

name: Jyotika
review_text: 14 Masses are being made on the day of bacchan, the dead body of an innocent girl is being kept.
review_translated_text: 14 bacchan pe maar ke bnwayo hai, masoom ladki ki laash rakkhi hai

name: VIKASH KUMAR PAL OFFICIAL
review_text: Good location at Agra Taj Mahal

name: Olga Kumar
review_text: It seems that they have somehow begun to treat this pearl carelessly - there are dried flowers in the flower beds, the cracked bottom of artificial reservoirs without water. Sadness!

name: PK
review_text:
When Shah Jahan saw the Taj Mahal for the first time, he said, This building will not only tell the story of love, but will also absolve all those people who will take human birth and step on this holy land of India and the testimony of this will be the moon. Will give stars.

It is said that Shahjahan had the hands of the workers who built the Taj Mahal cut off. But if we go back to the history, even after the Taj Mahal, the people who built the Taj Mahal contributed in building many buildings. Ustad Ahmed Lahauri was part of the team that built a grand building like the Taj Mahal and it was under the supervision of Ustad Ahmed that the construction of the Red Fort began.



If you pay attention to the minarets of the Taj Mahal, you will see that all four minarets are not standing straight but are inclined towards each other. This inclined construction of the buildings was done to prevent the main dome from collapsing during lightning and earthquakes. Some people say that the four minarets are bowing and saluting the dome, that is why they are tilted.

Do you know that Taj Mahal has been sold once? There is a popular story about Bihars famous swindler Natwarla that he once sold the Taj Mahal by calling it a temple.

name: Sunil Kumar Sanju
review_text:
Taj Mahal @SunilKmrSanju
A poem carved in marble. Charm and grandeur, unique, Taj Mahal is the only one of its kind in the whole world. This is a wonderful example of the love of a great ruler for his beloved queen. This monument fulfills the dreams of Emperor Shahjahan and was built in 1631 A.D. It is one of the wonders of the world built in D. It took 22 years to build it. About 20 thousand people worked together on the banks of Yamuna to complete this amazing tomb. The most fascinating and beautiful view of Taj Mahal is visible on the full moon night.
History
The credit for the construction of this amazing marble mausoleum goes to the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, who built this mausoleum in the memory of his beloved wife Arjumad Banu Begum, whom we know as Mumtaz Mahal and who died in AH 1040 (A.D. 1630). Her last wish to her husband was to build a mausoleum in her memory that the world had never seen before. Therefore, Emperor Shahjahan decided to build this marble building as told in fairy-tale stories. Construction of Taj Mahal by A. D. Started in 1632 and its construction work was completed in 1648 A.D. It is said that 20,000 people worked continuously for seventeen years to complete this building and to house them, Mumtazabad, named after the late queen, was built, which is now called Taj Ganj and was also built nearby. Was.

Amanat Khan Shirazi was the sculptor of the Taj Mahal, his name is carved on one of the sides of the Taj Mahal. Poet Ghiyasuddin has written the inscriptions on the stone of the tomb, while Ismail Khan Afridi came from Turkey and built its dome. Muhammad Hanif was the superintendent of masons. The name of the designer of Taj Mahal was Ustad Ahmed Lahauri. Its material was brought from all over India and Central Asia and the help of a fleet of 1000 elephants was taken to bring this material to the construction site. Its central dome is 187 feet high. Its red sand stone was brought from Fatehpur Sikri, jasper from Punjab, jade and crystal from China, turquoise i.e. blue stone from Tibet, lapis lazuli and sapphire from Sri Lanka, coal and cornelian from Arabia and diamonds from Panna. In total, 28 types of rare, precious and semi-precious stones were used in the carving of Taj Mahal. The main building material, white marble, was brought from the mines of Makrana in Nagaur district, Rajasthan.
entrance gate
The main entrance of Taj Mahal is from the south gate. This gateway is 151 feet long and 117 feet wide and its height is 100 feet. Here tourists enter the main complex through small gates next to the main entrance.
main gate
This main gate is 30 meters high made of red sand stone. Verses of the Quran are carved on it in Arabic script. The small dome shaped pavilion above it is of Hindu style and looks very grand. One of the main features of this entrance is that the alphabet appears to be of uniform size from here. The carvers have carved it so skillfully that the big and long letters create the illusion of being of one size.

There are well-maintained gardens of 300 x 300 meters in the form of four gardens spread on both sides of the walkway. There is a platform in the middle from where tourists can take photographs of the Taj.
Taj Museum
On the left side of the above mentioned platform is the Taj Museum. Here in the original drawings one can see the detail in how this monument was planned in architecture. The architect had also estimated that this building would take 22 years to be constructed. Diagrams of the interior show the location of the tombs in such detail that the foot of the tombs can be seen by the viewer from any angle.
On the left side of the Taj there is a mosque made of red sand stone. It is a common practice in Islam to build a mosque near a tomb, as this gives the area a sanctity policy and a place of worship. This mosque is still used for Shukra prayers.

An identical mosque has been built on the right side of the Taj and it is called Jawab. Namaz is not offered here because it faces west, i.e. opposite Mecca, the holy religious city of Muslims. It was built to maintain symmetry
The Taj Mahal itself is built on a raised platform. Four minarets rising from each corner of its foundation provide adequate balance to the mausoleum
review_translated_text:
taajmhl @SunilKmrSanju

sNgmrmr meN traashii gii ek kvitaa /  aakrssnn aur bhvytaa, anupm, taajmhl puurii duniyaa meN apnii prkaar kaa ek hii hai /  ek mhaan shaask kaa apnii priy raanii ke prti prem kaa yh adbhut shaahkaar hai /  baadshaah shaahjhaaN ke spnoN ko saakaar krtaa yh smaark 1631 e. ddii. meN nirmit duniyaa ke aashcryoN meN se ek hai /  ise bnaane meN 22 vrss kaa smy lgaa /  is adbhut mkbre ko puuraa krne meN ymunaa ke kinaare lgbhg 20 hjaar logoN ne jutt kr kaam kiyaa /  taajmhl kaa sbse mnmohkaur suNdr dRshy puurnnimaa kii raat ko dikhaaii detaa hai / 

itihaas

sNgmrmr ke is adbhut shaahkaar kaa nirmaann shrey mugl shaask shaahjhaaN ko jaataa hai, jinhoNne apnii priy ptnii arjumd baano begm kii yaad meN is mkbre ko khdd'aa kraayaa thaa, jinheN hm mumtaaj' mhl ke naam se jaante haiN aur inkii mRtyu e ec 1040 (e ddii 1630) meN huii /  apne pti se unhoNne aNtim icchaa vykt kii thii kii unkii yaad meN ek aisaa mkbraa bnaayaa jaae jaisaa duniyaa ne phle kbhii n dekhaa ho /  islie baadshaah shaahjhaaN ne prii lok jaisii khaaniyoN meN btaae ge sNgmrmr ke is bhvn kaa nirmaann kraane kaa nirnny liyaa /  taajmhl kaa nirmaann e. ddii. 1632 meN shuruu huaa aur use bnaane kaa kaam 1648 e ddii meN puuraa huaa /  aisaa khaa jaataa hai ki is bhvn ko puuraa krne ke lie strh vrss tk lgaataar 20,000 log kaam krte rheN aur unke rhne ke lie divNgt raanii ke naam pr mumtaaj'aa baad bnaayaa gyaa, jise ab taaj gNj khte haiN aur yh bhii iske njdiik nirmit kiyaa gyaa thaa / 


amaant khaan shiraajii taajmhl kaa kelii graaphr thaa, uskaa naam taaj ke dvaaraa meN se ek aNt meN traash kr likhaa gyaa hai /  kvi gyaasuddiin ne mkbre ke ptthr pr ibaarteN likhii haiN, jbki ismaail khaan aphriidii ne ttrkii se aakr iske gumbd kaa nirmaann kiyaa /  muhmmd hniiph mistriyoN kaa adhiikssk thaa /  taajmhl ke ddij'aainr kaa naam ustaad ahmd laahaurii thaa /  iskii saamgrii puure bhaart aur mdhy eshiyaa se laaii gii tthaa is saamgrii ko nirmaann sthl tk laane meN 1000 haathiyoN ke bedd'e kii shaaytaa lii gii /  iskaa kendriiy gumbd 187 phiitt uuNcaa hai /  iskaa laal seNdd stton phtehpur sikrii, pNjaab ke jsper, ciin se jedd aur kristtl, tibbt se ttrkoish yaanii niilaa ptthr, shriilNkaa se lepis ljulii aur sephaayr, arb se koylaa aur korneliyn tthaa pnnaa se hiire laae ge /  ismeN kul milaakr 28 prkaar ke durlbh, muulyvaan aur ardh muulyvaan ptthr taajmhl kii nkkaashii meN upyog kie ge the /  mukhy bhvn saamgrii, sphed sNgmrmr jilaa naagaur, raajsthaan ke mkraanaa kii khaanoN se laayaa gyaa thaa / 

prvesh dvaar

taajmhl kaa mukhy prvesh dkssinn dvaar se hai /  yh prvesh dvaar 151 phiitt lmbaa aur 117 phiitt caudd'aa hai tthaa iskii uuNcaaii 100 phiitt hai /  yhaaN pryttk mukhy prvesh dvaar ke bgl meN bne chotte dvaaroN se mukhy prisr meN prvesh krte haiN / 

mukhy dvaar

yh mukhy dvaar laal seNdd stton se bnaayaa huaa 30 miittr uuNcaaii kaa hai /  is pr arbii lipi meN kuraan kii aayte traashii gii haiN /  iske uupr chotte gumbd ke aakaar kaa mNddp hindu shailii kaa hai aur atyNt bhvy prtiit hotaa hai /  is prvesh dvaar kii ek mukhy vishesstaa yh hai ki akssr lekhn yhaaN se smaan aakaar kaa prtiit hotaa hai /  ise traashne vaaloN ne itnii kushltaa se traashaa hai ki bdd'e aur lmbe akssr ek aakaar kaa hone jaisaa bhrm utpnn krte haiN / 


yhaaN caar baag ke ruup meN bhlii bhaaNti taiyaar kie ge 300 x 300 miittr ke udyaan haiN jo paidl raaste ke donoN or phaile hue haiN /  iske mdhy meN ek mNc hai jhaaN se pryttk taaj kii tsviireN le skte haiN / 

taaj sNgrhaaly

uprokt ullikhit mNc kii baaNiiN or taaj sNgrhaaly hai /  muul citroN meN yhaaN us baariikii ko dekhaa jaa sktaa hai ki vaastuklaa meN is smaark kii yojnaa kis prkaar bnaaii /  vaastukaar ne yh bhii aNdaajaa lgaayaa thaa ki is imaart ko bnne meN 22 vrss kaa smy lgegaa /  aNdrunii hisse ke aarekh is baariikii se kbroN kii sthiti drshaate haiN ki kbroN ke pair kii or vaalaa hissaa drshkoN ko kisii bhii konn se dikhaaii de ske / 

taaj kii baaNiiN or laal seNdd stton se bnii huii ek msjid hai /  yh islaam dhrm kii ek aam baat hai ki ek mkbre ke paas ek msjid kaa nirmaann kiyaa jaataa hai, kyoNki isse us hisse ko ek pvitrtaa niiti hai aur puujaa kaa sthaan miltaa hai /  is msjid ko ab bhii shukraane kii nmaaj' ke lie upyog kiyaa jaataa hai / 


taaj kii daaNiiN or ek dm smaan msjid bnaaii gii hai aur ise jvaab khte haiN /  yhaaN nmaaj' adaa nhiiN kii jaatii kyoNki yh pshcim kii or hai arthaat mkkaa ke vipriit, jo muslimoN kaa pvitr dhaarmik shhr hai /  ise smmiti bnaae rkhne ke lie nirmit kraayaa gyaa th

taajmhl apne aap meN ek uuNce mNc pr bnaayaa gyaa hai /  iskii niiNv ke prtyek kone se utthne vaalii caar miinaare mkbre ko pryaapt sNtuln detii hai

name: Pooja
review_text:
It would be an understatement if I try to explain the beauty of the Taj Mahal!
It is a masterpiece which is difficult to re-create with the same intricacies and finesse.
Not only the Taj Mahal, but the entire area is well maintained with greenery all around and cleanliness is also fully maintained.
When we visited, all the water bodies were without water as there was some cleaning project happening, but still it did not impact the beauty of the giant marble structure.
It is recommended to visit in the first half of the day or early mornings are much better to avoid unwanted crowds and to appreciate the real magnificence.
If one wants to go inside the massive building, there are separate tickets of 200 and 250 and need to buy disposable shoe covers from the counter or lot of hawkers selling it outside for 10 for each pair. Though reusable ones are available too, but they are filthy and smelling. Entry tickets are for 40 each and children can visit for free.
If you get a chance to visit, do not miss the opportunity and show it to the younger generation too.

name: Vikash Rawat
review_text:
I recently visited the Taj Mahal, and it was a great experience. For a first-time visit, the beauty and size of the monument are really impressive. The design and structure are amazing, and its clear why its such a famous site.

Theres also a lot of interesting history to learn about the Taj Mahal, which makes the visit even more worthwhile. Its fascinating to see such an important piece of history in person.

However, I feel that one visit is enough for me. While the Taj Mahal is beautiful and worth seeing, I dont think I would go back a second time.

Overall, I would give my visit 4 out of 5 stars. Its definitely worth going once to see the stunning architecture and to learn about its history.

name: Ajay_ goswami
review_text:
Construction of the mausoleum was completed in 1648, but work continued on other phases of the project for another five years. The first ceremony held at the mausoleum was an observance by Shah Jahan, on 6 February 1643, of the 12th anniversary of the death of Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal complex is believed to have been completed in its entirety in 1653 at a cost estimated at the time to be around 5 million, which in 2023 would be approximately 35 billion (US$77.8 million) VB The Taj Mahal was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983 for being the jewel of Islamic art in India and one of the universally admired masterpieces of the worlds heritage. It is regarded as one of the best examples of Mughal architecture and a symbol of Indian history. The Taj Mahal is a major tourist attraction and attracts more than five million visitors a year. In 2007, it was declared a winner of the New 7 Wonders of the World initiative.

The Taj Mahal is truly a masterpiece of architecture and a symbol of love. Its stunning white marble structure, intricate details, and beautiful gardens are breathtaking. I highly recommend visiting 30 minutes before sunrise for the best experience. Youll get to see the Taj during sunrise, and the place will be nearly empty. The monuments historical significance and sheer beauty make it a must-visit. The site is well-maintained, and the experience is unforgettable. Highly recommended for all travelers!

name: Angus
review_text:
Absolutely beautiful. We arrived just before sunrise, spent 3 hours there (max. time allowed per ticket) and of course it was a highlight of our trip.

No queues at 5 am (on a weekday) to buy the tickets or entry. Staff were wide awake and helpful. A free bottle of water and shoe covers are given free.

You will be approached by guides and professional photographers, a polite refusal is fine.

Carry as little as possible in your bag to get through security smoothly.

Watch out for the monkeys in the outer compound.

Once inside the main area, amateur photographers will try to guide you to the best photo spots and take pictures for you with your phone.

We had a little old man do it for us (free at first, he never asked for money) at first we reluctantly accepted his help, and were SO glad we did. He knew all the best spots and angles. He took awesome pics and short videos so at the end we tipped him gladly.

Inside the mausoleum was worth the extra admission. The attendants inside will suck you in with rapid fire information, then ask for a tip.

There is a museum to the left of the main area but it only opens at 9am.

It was an effort to get up so early but well worth it to avoid the crowds and see the magnificent Taj Mahal in the early morning light.

Pity about the fountains and ponds being empty. Some renovation and getting them working would have made the main area even more magical and created a nice cooling effect.

But this was a small thing. We were so glad we came.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: JISHNU V S
review_text:
Construction of the mausoleum was completed in 1648, but work continued on other phases of the project for another five years. The first ceremony held at the mausoleum was an observance by Shah Jahan, on 6 February 1643, of the 12th anniversary of the death of Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal complex is believed to have been completed in its entirety in 1653 at a cost estimated at the time to be around 5 million, which in 2023 would be approximately 35 billion (US$77.8 million).

The building complex incorporates the design traditions of Indo-Islamic and Mughal architecture. It employs symmetrical constructions with the usage of various shapes and symbols. While the mausoleum is constructed of white marble inlaid with semi-precious stones, red sandstone was used for other buildings in the complex similar to the Mughal era buildings of the time. The construction project employed more than 20,000 workers and artisans under the guidance of a board of architects led by Ustad Ahmad Lahori, the emperors court architect.
