name: Rakesh Kumar
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is a majestic white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India. Here are the details, timing, and ways to reach:

*Details:*

- Location: Dharmapuri, Forest Colony, Tajganj, Agra, Uttar Pradesh 282001, India
- Built by: Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal

- Architecture: Mughal architecture, blending Indian, Persian, and Islamic styles
- Material: White Makrana marble

*Timing:*

- Opening hours: Sunrise to sunset (6:00 AM to 7:00 PM)
- Closed on: Fridays
- Best time to visit: Early morning or late evening to avoid crowds and heat

*Way to Reach:*

1. *By Air:* Nearest airport is Agra Airport (AGR), 7 km from the Taj Mahal. Delhi Airport (DEL) is 230 km away, with frequent flights and trains to Agra.
2. *By Train:* Agra Cantonment Railway Station (AGC) is the nearest, with trains from Delhi, Jaipur, and other cities.
3. *By Road:* Agra is connected to Delhi, Jaipur, and other cities via NH-2 and NH-3 highways. Buses and taxis are available.
4. *By Tour:* Book a guided tour or hire a taxi/auto-rickshaw from Agra city to reach the Taj Mahal.

*Additional Tips:*

- Buy tickets online or at the ticket counter
- Wear comfortable shoes and clothes
- Respect the monuments rules and regulations
- Hire a guide for a better understanding of the history and architecture
- Be prepared for security checks

*Ticket Prices:*

- Indians: 50 (daytime), 75 (sunrise/sunset)
- Foreigners: 1,100 (daytime), 1,300 (sunrise/sunset)

Note: Prices may vary, so check the official website or contact the Archaeological Survey of India for updates.

Weekend

name: Shashwat Karna
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is truly a wonder of the world! This iconic monument is a breathtaking masterpiece, with its stunning white marble and intricate carvings. Visiting at sunrise offers a mesmerizing view as the monument glows with a soft, golden hue. The gardens are beautifully maintained, providing a serene atmosphere. Its an emotional and unforgettable experience, reflecting the timeless love story behind its creation. A must-see for anyone traveling to India!
Ive visited twice, and it never fails to impress. Hiring a guide is worth it to fully understand the history and details. The architecture is almost perfect, with a minor imperfection that adds character. The grounds are immaculate, and the whole place feels magical. If youre in India, the Taj Mahal is a must-visit.
Must visit in the early hours in winter.
The monument looks different at various times of the day, offering unique views. The reflection pool in front adds to its beauty, creating stunning mirror images. The interior is just as impressive with intricate marble inlay work. Be prepared for crowds, especially during peak tourist seasons. Despite this, the experience remains peaceful and awe-inspiring. The nearby Yamuna River adds to the scenic beauty of the location. You can also explore the smaller, charming buildings surrounding the Taj. Don't forget to wear comfortable shoes, as theres a lot of walking involved. Visiting the Taj Mahal is not just about seeing a building; its about experiencing a piece of history and a symbol of enduring love. The local markets outside are great for picking up souvenirs to remember your visit.

Weekday

Tips for a pleasant visit:
1. Book entry tickets online, there are two separate tickets for main mausoleum.
2. Shoe covers are provided at the entrance, no need to buy them.

4. Bargain the guide about their service cost and please beware of the overpriced souvenir suggestions of the guides.
5. Souvenir shops and restaurants are available right outside the gate.
6. Eastern gate has better facilities.
7. Reach the entrance by 6 for best views and less crowds.

name: DILSHAD JAHAN
review_text:
Recently, I had the opportunity to visit the iconic Taj Mahal, which is considered one of the seven wonders of the world. It is located in Agra, India, and was built as a mausoleum for Queen Mumtaz Mahal by her husband, Emperor Shah Jahan. The monument is widely regarded as a masterpiece of Mughal architecture and is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Last month, I finally had the chance to see this magnificent structure up close, and I must say, it was breathtaking. The intricate details of the building, including the carvings, calligraphy, and symmetry of the design, were simply stunning. The ivory white marble used to construct the building glowed under the Indian sun, giving the structure an ethereal beauty.

As you enter through the main gate, you are met with a massive courtyard filled with lush green lawns, shaded trees, and colorful flowers. Inside, the tomb of Mumtaz Mahal is surrounded by four minarets, symbolizing the four corners of the earth, and is adorned with precious stones such as rubies, emeralds, and diamonds.

One of the most remarkable aspects of the Taj Mahal is the reflection pool that surrounds the tomb, creating a beautiful mirror image of the building. The sound of the water flowing in the reflective pool added a serene atmosphere to the already peaceful environment.

Visiting the Taj Mahal was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The attention to detail, the use of rare materials, and the sheer scale of the project make it clear why this monument has earned its place among the greatest architectural achievements in history. If you ever get the chance to visit, do not hesitate - it is a sight that will leave a lasting impression.

name: ASIF aSf bshyr
review_text: The Taj Mahal, an architectural marvel, stands as a testament to eternal love. Built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, its history is steeped in romance and tragedy. The secrets lie in the intricate details, the hidden chambers, and the precision of its construction. Today, it remains a symbol of enduring love and a UNESCO World Heritage site. The pristine white marble, intricate carvings, and the symmetry of its design create an awe-inspiring beauty that transcends time, drawing millions of visitors annually to witness the magnificence of this cultural masterpiece.

name: Muskaan Gaur
review_text:
Taj Mahal is a great touristy place one should visit.
Its good to know that there are different ticket options available for visitors. The 50 INR ticket allows you to access the Taj Mahal complex, which includes the gardens, different gates, and fountains. To enter the main Taj Mahal building, where you can see the iconic white marble structure up close, youll need to purchase an additional ticket worth 200 INR.
Visiting in the evening is a fantastic idea, especially during the summer months when the temperatures can be quite hot. The crowds also tend to be less during the evening, providing a more serene and peaceful experience. The soft golden light during sunset can add a magical touch to the Taj Mahals beauty.
Remember to check the visiting hours and any specific regulations or restrictions that may be in place at the time of your visit. Enjoy exploring the Taj Mahal and creating unforgettable memories!

name: Sriram Panda
review_text:
I had visited this place 44 years ago when I was a student. This place needs no narration. Many authors like Ravindra nath Tagore has said about it.
This monument built by Moghal king Shajahan on the banks of river Yamuna with marble stones procured from Rajasthan is perhaps the most advertised place of India. From the local guide it was learnt that architects from Iran n Turkey were engaged for construction of this structure, which contains the tomb of Mumtaz Mahal, the queen and Shahjahn.

name: Doreen Lkr
review_text:
I have visited Taj Mahal for about 4-5 times in the past. Earlier the entry ticket to see the entire Taj Mahal was for Rs. 50 for Indian citizens, however in my recent visit I came to know that we have to pay Rs. 200 extra to see the entire Mahal- Rs. 50 just to walk on the Mahal campus and 200 extra to see the main Mahal (total Rs.250). I think there are some pros and cons to it. Because of the hiked fee, we see 50% less crowd on the upper floor than before so, obviously less rush but, on the other hand, was it even necessary to hike the fee? That too from Rs.50 to Rs. 200! Taj Mahal no doubt is one of the Seven Wonders of the World but I still feel Rs. 250 per head is a bit too much. As an entry fee.

name: YOGI BOPPIDI (GOOD GOOGLE GUIDE)
review_text:
Title: A Journey Through Time and Love: The Taj Mahal

The Taj Mahal, a name that resonates with unparalleled beauty and timeless love, stands as a testament to human ingenuity and emotional depth. This UNESCO World Heritage site, situated on the banks of the Yamuna River in Agra, India, is often heralded as one of the most exquisite architectural marvels on Earth. However, my visit to the Taj Mahal left me with a unique perspective that transcends the typical superlatives associated with this iconic monument.

To truly appreciate the Taj Mahal, one must look beyond its picturesque facade. Its not just a monument; its a vessel of history, passion, and artistic mastery. The Tajs story is well-documented--a symbol of the undying love that Emperor Shah Jahan had for his wife Mumtaz Mahal, who died during childbirth. Yet, its upon visiting the site that one can grasp the profound emotional depth encapsulated within the shimmering white marble.

What struck me the most about the Taj Mahal was its remarkable ability to embody both grandeur and subtlety simultaneously. As you approach the main gate, you are instantly met with a sense of awe at the scale and intricacy of the structure. The white marble gleams in the sunlight, appearing to change color with the shifting days mood, as if it has a life of its own.

Inside, the Taj Mahal reveals an astonishing level of precision in its design. The complex geometric patterns, floral motifs, and calligraphy etched into the marble tell a story of artistry that goes far beyond mere architectural brilliance. The delicate interplay of light and shadow, the symmetrical reflections in the surrounding pools, and the echo of silence in the monuments vast inner chamber all combine to create an ethereal atmosphere.

But what sets my experience apart was the realization that the Taj Mahal is not just a mausoleum; its a living, breathing embodiment of love. The love story that inspired its creation is still palpable in the air. Standing in the presence of the Taj, I couldnt help but contemplate the depths of human emotions and the power of love to transcend time and death.

The Taj Mahals uniqueness lies in its ability to transcend the boundaries of a traditional tourist attraction. Its not just about admiring its beauty, marveling at its architecture, or clicking the perfect photograph. Its about connecting with the human experience, understanding the depth of devotion, and contemplating the endurance of love through the ages.

In conclusion, the Taj Mahal is more than just a beautiful building; its a profound representation of love, art, and history. A visit to the Taj Mahal is not merely a sightseeing experience; its a journey through time and emotions, an opportunity to connect with the eternal and universal theme of love. The Taj Mahal is a tribute to the enduring power of love, and it will continue to inspire and touch the hearts of generations to come.
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Philipp S.
review_text:
It's the Taj Mahal. The area is larger than I imagined it to be. I calculated 2-3 hours for the visit yet it became 5-6 hours. I bought my ticket online and the entry was rather quick. A bit chaotic yet quick. I lost my water bottle at the security check.

The is something very majestic and also something very sad about the Taj Mahal. I liked the perspective from the fake mosque on the Eastern side towards and from the central door from the real mosque.

It rained twice when I visited, once right after I came out of the mausoleum. My socks became wet and walking in shoes with wet socks became a feeling I associate with my visit. The Taj Mahal is not interesting to see from inside, it feels small, rather dark and does not reflect the clarity that the structure reflects from the outside. The building is sad inside.

name: Apoorv Jain
review_text:
Amazing beauty. Loved this. Irrespective of the various claims for this property by Hindus / Mughals I really admire the masterpiece. Whosoever was behind the plan/structure was just amazing. A must visit place if you are a human. :)
Yamuna river behind the monument need a lot of improvement. It was smelling like hell and making tourist to shut their nose.
Overall a must visit place and admire the beauty of this monument.

name: Sunny Minhas
review_text:
The entry ticket for the Taj Mahal is Rs. 50 for Indian citizens and around Rs. 1,100 for foreign visitors. If its your first time, its a must-see, but otherwise, I wouldnt make a special trip to visit again. It's one of the Seven Wonders of the World. Guides are advertised at Rs. 975, but you can often negotiate down to Rs. 500. However, if youre not particularly interested in history, you might prefer to explore on your own.

name: Veer Tiwari
review_text:
Note: Please read The full review as it has some more important points at the end which I experienced.
Now, Let me Give you an Overview and Guide you towards your Journey to Taj Mahal from Ghaziabad, India via Road.
Your Journey is of approx. 220 Kms
1- Start your Journey from Ghaziabad towards Noida
2- Take the Yamuna expressway route and while enjoying the route you will reach Agra in approx 2 hours and 45 Minutes.
3 - Park your Vehicle at the Parking which charges you 100 
4- After parking there will be Guided/Electric car drivers which offer you to sit and they will take you to the Taj. But (pighlnaa nhii hai), From Parking the main ticket counter Gate is approx 700-800 meters. So I prefer walking rather than giving them 20/per person for such a short ride.
5- Now you have arrived at the Ticket counter, and you have offline and online both options available from where you have two ticket options i.e General and the Premium one, General ticket costs 50 and Premium costs 200 ( For Indian Citizens ). Here I will prefer you to take 200 ticket if you are interested in Going inside the Taj Mahal.
6 - After getting Tickets done, You will head up towards the security check which includes a complete and tight security. Your bags are checked completely and then you will proceed towards the Entry to Taj Mahal.
7 - Now entry is done, Enjoy and Have Fun 
NOTES:
1- I am giving 4 stars to this Wonder of Nature because of its Hospitality.
2- Parking amount you will pay 100 but it seems like you have parked in Free parking space. I.e. No Proper space, No one to guide where you have to park, Jisko jaha jagah mile waha laga jata hai ek dusre k samne, peeche koi fark nahi padta
3- By general ticket you will think that you will visit the whole TAJ by inside aur outside, but but... Entry inside the Taj is only for Premium Ticket Customers. So choose your ticket wisely otherwise inside you will have to pay 200  more to get the same and that total costs you 250.
4- If possible come with as few items as you can carry i.e to easily pass security checks and save time.
5- Enjoy the Beauty and the one of the Seven Wonders of the World. 
Hope this review sort out many of the Questions among the first time Visitors.

name: Charvi Mathur
review_text: Taj Mahal. I really dont need to describe this place but Id say please dont waste your time and money to watch the inner tomb area. Its really not worth the long queues. But if youre visiting for the first time, you should have a visit coz it could be a once in a lifetime opportunity for you. But...uhm....yeah thats it. You already know everything else I guess.

name: Amy Styles
review_text:
Beautiful building and historic monument.

Best time to visit is at sunrise to avoid the crowds.

1000 rupees entry fee for foreigners which includes a small bottle of water and shoe covers.

No bags allowed so bring your camera and nothing else.

Only downside as with many of the attractions in India were the staff. When visiting the inside of the mausoleum, a group of guards sounded like they were having a party, completely disturbing the calm atmosphere.

The Taj Mahal itself is fairly well maintained, but the surrounding buildings seem to be pigeon houses and smell quite bad.

review_text: Beautiful monument. The security was rude.

To get access to the main Taj you need to pay extra, else the access is denied to get near to the monument, nevertheless you can view it from far as well. Allot sufficient time to visit the place, as theres too much to walk and explore and dont forget to take the best snaps.

name: Muhammad Asif
review_text:
A Timeless Wonder - Taj Mahal.

Rating: 5/5

I recently had the privilege of visiting the Taj Mahal, and I must say, its a truly breathtaking experience. This stunning white marble mausoleum in Agra, India, is a testament to love, beauty, and human ingenuity.

As I stepped through the gates, I was struck by the sheer scale and grandeur of the monument. The intricate inlays, ornate calligraphy, and perfect proportions all combine to create a sense of awe and wonder.

The story of Shah Jahans love for Mumtaz Mahal, which inspired the construction of the Taj, adds a poignant layer of depth to the experience. The monuments perfect blend of Indian, Persian, and Islamic architectural styles is a reflection of the regions rich cultural heritage.

The complex is immaculately maintained, with beautiful gardens and a tranquil atmosphere that belies the crowds. The sunset view, with the golden light casting a warm glow over the marble, is truly unforgettable.

Overall, the Taj Mahal is an absolute must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply experiencing one of the worlds most iconic wonders.

Pros:

- Breathtaking architecture and design
- Immaculately maintained complex and gardens
- Poignant love story and historical significance
- Perfect blend of Indian, Persian, and Islamic styles
- Unforgettable sunset views

Cons: None

Highlights:

- Intricate inlays and ornate calligraphy
- Perfect proportions and scale
- Tranquil atmosphere and beautiful gardens
- Rich cultural heritage and historical significance
- Unforgettable experience

Tips for visitors:

- Plan ahead and book tickets online to avoid crowds
- Hire a knowledgeable guide to appreciate the history and architecture
- Visit at sunset for the most breathtaking views
- Respect the monuments rules and regulations
- Take your time to absorb the beauty and atmosphere
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
No

name: Mohammed Shahim
review_text:
Words cannot describe the beauty of this place, unfortunately it merely gets ruined by so called government approved guides who try to scam every rupee from you. As soon as we got to the Taj Mahal, we were approached by a guide who instantly took us to book online tickets and used his phone number to get the online tickets. I advised home we dont need a guide and just want to enjoy the Taj Mahal by ourselves but we were constantly pressured. He then took us to the golf carts, who drive for like 10 meters then stopped and asked us all to pay, then when we got to the security check area they took our bags away from us and told us to go back to the male section and go through the body scanner. Then the police made remarks that other police in hindi that because we were foreigners we should be checked more thoroughly, i asked why as were from Australia and our security is more strict, then they put all my things back in my bags and let us go through. At the first point the guide spoke for about 5 minutes, I stopped him and said we dont need a guide and that he needs to stop pressuring us. I gave him 500 rupees and told him to leave us alone and he started hassling us and said we should have told him right at the beginning, I told I tried to tell you at the beginning but you did not want to listen. After he left us alone, we enjoyed a nice 1 hour walk admiring the majestic Taj Mahal and the surrounding grounds. We also paid the extra 200rupees to go inside the mausoleum but when you get to the entrance then to get the blue shoe cover its 50rupees each.

It is a shame that India has such fascinating monuments, culture and history but it all gets ruined by scammers. The government should get involved and make all these places a better place without allowing scammers to stay active.

Weekday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended

name: Amit Sharma
review_text:
Did you ever have a feeling that a place (or a person) isnt as good as you thought it would be, even after hearing about them a lot of times? I did. Its a phenomenal structure, no doubt about that! But, before actually seeing it myself, I have had seen this place in countless movies, numerous random advertisements and at a lot of other places, that the experience of actually seeing it in real wasnt as wonderful as I thought it would be. Well, thats an individuals perspective of perceiving a thing, I dont want to ruin anyone elses perception.

This place is remarkably similar to all the other mughal architectures that one can easily find in every corner of New Delhi. But there are a lot of things that make Taj Mahal different from all the other mughal-built buildings and architectures. Being a naive traveller and an inexperienced tourist, I could grasp and understand only a few of the things that make Tak Mahal a worlds wonder but I am sure, there must be a lot of other things that make Taj, Taj!

The white marble is the prominent piece of building block used (obviously) and to protect it from getting polluted, which surely is a concern against its preservation, people are required to cover their foot-wears with a covering, which is offered for free at the ticket counter. We were dumb enough to buy it from a local outside the Eastern gate entrance, without knowing that it was given free of cost at the counter.

A tourist guide would be a great company to know about this extraordinary monument in depth. Without an in-depth knowledge of why the monument is considered a wonder, its just a piece of beautifully carved bathroom floor marble. For example, if you dont get yourself a guide, you wouldnt know that the carvings on a relatively thin piece of marble was made possible only when the builders carved each and every design with a chisel like instrument and not with a more convenient tool such as a hammer, because the marble was so brittle that its thinness wouldnt withstand the strong strokes of hammering.

The point is, just get yourself a guide. Bargain hard on the price which they have to offer for their service.

name: Ramesh Hariharan
review_text: No without visiting Tajmahal, Delhi trip is zero. They maintain the premises well, irrespective of n number of people visiting, infamous Delhi pollution etc... Do remember to click from the abundance of options, one will cherish them for ever

review_text:

The place is nice, worth visiting once in a life time.!
But please visit early morning on weekdays to avoid crowd. Take shoe covers from local vendor outside the west gate.

name: Bojula Enrique Torao Garcia
review_text:
The actual monument is stunning, but the management of the entrance is a bit of a joke. They say they open at 6:30 AM but they didn't let people in until 7 AM, so you miss the sunrise no matter how early you go. Most tourist go through the west gate as it is closer to access although many guides recommend to use the South Gate (we didn't see anyone getting through that gate, though so be careful and double you can actually get in through that one).
You CANNOT enter with torches, drinks/food or tripods of ANY size. Any type of flashlights are not allowed despite what it is said in some guides, so don't bring one (you have your phone light anyway!) and you don't need it inside.

name: Prakhar Goel
review_text:
This monument holds a special place because of the token of the love expressed by Shah Jahan for her beloved queen Mumtaz Mahal. If we put this fact aside for a few moments you will not find anything extraordinary in it. The huge queues in which you have to wait for hours just kills the excitement and curiosity!! Also this place is overly crowded with people all the time and is also losing its charm with the time due to the extreme pollution problems !!

So if you are planning a visit there are certain things that you must know !!
1.) Try to make it at sunrise as it is less crowded at that time.
2.) Book your tickets online from the official website of the taj mahal as it will save a considerable amount of time that would be wasted in waiting the queues of booking centre. Also dont forget to carry a print out of the booked tickets with you.
3.) If you dont want to wait in the long queues you may purchase high prices tickets(even indians can buy it if they want to), as there is a special queue for high priced tickets and it is relatively very small when compared to normal queues.
4.) Also, confirm the dates on which the taj mahal is opened at night(only 5-8 times in a year) on the official website, as it looks very beautiful on the night of full moon. It will be worth to watch !!

review_text:
The one that fulfill your eyes when you first see it. This place is so beautiful that makes to stay here.
But still giving it 4 stars cause area outside this place is not clean. Just 5 minutes away, you will find dirty roads and flooded gutters. Also, the security check is not that much of strong at entrance. Since it is one of the wonder is the world, this place is always crowded; specially on weekends. Also, due to its location, it is difficult to see this place in summer; especially at noon.
On the other hand, you can get view Lal Kila (Red fort), Yamuna river from taj mahal. When I went there it was not allowed enter inside Taj mahal but you get satisfied only when you see it from outside only.
This place is historical and amazing.
Keep clean and follow rules.

name: Joe
review_text: 10/12/24, I came to India this time just for the Taj Mahal. I left the hotel at 5:30 in the morning and arrived at the Taj Mahal quickly. There will be fewer people entering from the other side door, so you can enter earlier. At sunrise, the white marble will have different reflections of light, because there is a tour guide who knows what special photos to take at which points. It takes about two hours to take pictures and browse. You need to go through security before entering, and you cant bring a lot of things. Remember to ask the tour guide. Food or other electronic items are not allowed to be brought in. The ticket is 1,300 rupees. I asked the travel agency to buy it for me first. He sent a file with a QR Code in it. Use the QR Code to scan it. can enter

name: Madhusudhan Katariya
review_text:
the Taj is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India,Taj Mahal was built in the memory of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan (from reign 1628 to 1658) in the memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, the construction work of the Taj Mahal began in 1632. Shah Jahan wanted the world to remember Mumtaz and his love story, that is why he wanted to make some historical heritage in his memory. but still to enhance its beauty and work up to 10 years.
The construction of the Taj Mahal was completed in about 1653 and at that time the cost was approximately 32 million rupees, the construction of the Taj Mahal was done by 25,000+ craftsmen. Ustad Ahmad Lahauri is often regarded as its chief architect.

The Taj is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. The Taj Mahal was built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (reigned 1628 to 1658) in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Construction of the Taj Mahal began in 1632. Shahjahan wanted the world to remember Mumtaz and her love story, that is why he wanted to create some historical heritage in her memory. In which Taj Mahal was built. The construction of Taj Mahal was completed around 1643 but still it took up to 10 years to enhance its beauty and work. The construction of Taj Mahal was completed around 1653 and its cost at that time was around Rs 32 crores, Taj Mahal was constructed by more than 25,000 artisans. Ustad Ahmed Lahauri is often considered its chief architect.

name: Gaurav Sharma
review_text:
Well, no need to say anything. Everyone knows Taj Mahal. But I saw it for the first time. It is very beautiful. The one who has kept it like this even after so many years should be praised the most.
Such a view as soon as you enter. Truly a wonder.
You may face some difficulty in reaching Taj Mahal. Like traffic, route divert and parking. Car parking goes up to 20/hr.
To book tickets, I would say that you should book online only so that you will avoid standing in the queue. I would like to tell you one more thing in this, the normal ticket is 40-30, in which you can only go around the Taj Mahal but not inside the Taj Mahal. For this you will have to pay 200 extra and children up to 15 years of age are free to take them anywhere in Taj Mahal. Means no ticket. If you want to go to Taj Mahal, you will get shoe covers for which you do not have to pay anything extra. If you do not want to go to the Taj Mahal and just want to roam around the Taj Mahal, then you do not have to cover your shoes.
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Eon Mirmo
review_text:
One of the 7 wonders of the world. It already says it all. A dream building. They should improve the directions and signs to get there and make improvements in the surroundings so that it would be pleasant to walk. The service in the tourist shops in the area should also be improved, their shapes are very invasive and can be uncomfortable and tourists can feel intimidated or harassed. I dont recommend going without a local companion or you will have a bad experience.
Visited on
Weekday
review_translated_text: Una de las 7 maravillas del mundo. Ya lo dice todo. Un edificio de ensueno. Deberian mejorar las indicaciones y senales para llegar y hacer mejoras en los alrededores para que fuera agradable pasear. Tambien habria que mejorar la atencion en las tiendas turisticas de la zona, sus formas son muy invasivas y pueden resultar incomodas y los turistas pueden sentirse intimidados o acosados. No recomiendo ir sin un acompanante local o tendra una mala experiencia.

name: aki
review_text:
When you arrive at Agra by train, an autorickshaw driver will come to you for business.
The amount you are initially told may be different (increase) when you actually pay, so be careful of drivers who insist on paying.
You may have to wait in long lines to purchase tickets locally, so we recommend purchasing them in advance at a travel agency.
Also, autorickshaw drivers may be taken to souvenir shops for their own kickbacks, but please do not buy things you dont need.
Finally, I felt it was important to convert rupees into Japanese yen and have an idea of   how much you would be willing to pay.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Masashi
review_text:
OBe careful of the guide-like person at the entrance of the Taj Mahal
For Japanese people, when they think of India, they think of curry, Dhalsim from Street Fighter, and one of the most famous things: the Taj Mahal.
Since I went on a tour, I left the purchasing of admission tickets and procedures to the guide.
A guide will accompany you to the viewpoint where you can see the Taj Mahal, but you will have to enter the Taj Mahal alone.
Once inside, a guide-like Indian man will give you a brief explanation in English and then ask for a tip, but there is no need to pay.
The guide had warned me about this beforehand, and I was able to understand it by actually facing it.
You can request a photographer outside to take pictures through the guide, but the guide will take the pictures with his own camera (smartphone), so unless you want to use a good camera, there is no need to ask for one. I thought.

name: Zulfikar CEKIC
review_text: The Taj Mahal is an architectural masterpiece. His beauty transcends photos - in person he is even more spectacular. Arrive early to avoid the crowds and fully enjoy the serenity of this site. The love story behind its construction adds a poignant dimension to the visit. A truly magical place.
review_translated_text: Le Taj Mahal est un chef-doeuvre darchitecture. Sa beaute transcende les photos - en personne, il est encore plus spectaculaire. Arrivez tot pour eviter les foules et profiter pleinement de la serenite de ce site. Lhistoire damour derriere sa construction ajoute une dimension poignante a la visite. Un lieu vraiment magique.

name: Krzysztof Obral
review_text: A beautiful Indian midwifery mausoleum in the city of Agra. It makes a great impression, especially from the outside. Theres nothing special inside. Its very crowded. Large queues at ticket counters. You have to be especially careful with the pseudo-advertisers in front of the entrance. There is no need to use the services of a guide.

Duze kolejki do kas z biletami. Trzeba uwazac szczegolnie na pseudo przedownikow przed wejsciem. Nie ma potrzeby aby korzystac z uslug przewodnika.

name: Francoise Boichot
review_text: Beautiful but so crowded. It spoils the fun, like everywhere in India. And all the people, especially women and children who beg, it bothers... The lack of cleanliness too... watch out for the visits offered in so-called family cashmere businesses! Bad quality and price not as good as in your own hotel; jewelry that you cannot wear once in the West and finally, be vigilant about the condition of your bank notes: because the merchant takes it from you at first, then comes back in anger arguing that it is a fake (while you are a tourist and it was the stockbroker who provided it to you!), and demands a new payment otherwise he calls the police! Double the collection! Its so simple so be careful... Have a good trip but I wont go back. Their castes and their resignation stunned me!
review_translated_text: Magnifique mais que de monde. Ca gache le plaisir, comme partout en Inde. Et tous gens , notamment femmes et enfants qui quemandent, ca derange... Le manque de proprete aussi... attention aux visites proposees dans soit disant entreprises familiales de cashmere ! Mauvaise qualite et prix pas si interessant que dans votre propre hotel; les bijoux qu on ne peut porter une fois en occident et enfin, soyez vigilants sur l etat de vos billets de banque : car le commercant vous le prend dans un premier temps, puis revient en colere arguant que c est un faux (alors que vous etes touriste et que c est l agent de change qui vous l a fourni!), et exige un nouveau paiement faute de quoi il appelle la police ! Double l encaissement ! C est si simple alors soyez attentifs... Bon voyage mais je n y retournerai pas. Leurs castes et leur resignation m ont abasourdie !

name: takukin takukin
review_text: The entrance fee was a bit too high and I wasnt sure if you could get water if you bought a ticket, but the Taj Mahal itself was so grand that it was worth seeing. I can leave my luggage in a locker, but its a bit far and expensive.

name: Jc b23
review_text:
Great experience of discovering the Taj Mahal in the early morning mist!

You are entitled to a small bottle of water and blue slippers free of charge to visit the mausoleum and go to the small office next to the east door.
For guides = price offered in front of the door 3000 rupees. After negotiation = 2200 rupees. Once past the entrance, the price drops to 400 rupees!
We arrived 30 minutes before opening. There arent too many people. At the end of the visit (about 1h30), a lot more people.
review_translated_text:
Formidable experience de decouvrir le taj mahal dans la brume du petit matin !


Vous avez droit gratuitement a une petite bouteille d eau et aux sur chaussons bleus pour visiter le mausolee, aller au petit bureau a cote de la porte est.

Pour les guides = prix propose devant la porte 3000 roupies. Apres negociation = 2200 roupies. Une fois passe l entree, le prix descend a 400 roupies !

Nous sommes arrives 30 mn avant l ouverture. Il y a pas trop de monde. A la fin de la visite (a peu pres 1h30), beaucoup plus de monde.

name: Sanday "happySunday" Happy
review_text:
From the gate! Ill go by electric car. There was also an Indian person walking. There are so many peopleEveryone has heard, seen, and seen the famous pure white Taj Mahal, a world heritage site.
To approach (climb) the Taj Mahal, put on the shoe covers given to you at the time of entry for protection (apparently you can go barefoot) and go up the stairs. It feels like a foot version of a shower cap (lol). On the way home, I went to the collection box.
There were some Indian people cooling off in the shade, giving it a relaxing atmosphere.
Even if you want to take a photo from a good position, there are a lot of people so you have to wait in line. And I walked more than I expected. It takes time to take the photos you want, so I felt it was a good idea to plan well in advance.

name: C Diaz
review_text:
A must visit on your trip to North India. Impressive on the outside but dont expect the same on the inside. It is a mausoleum and the visit inside is to go around it and leave: nothing more. Few minutes and dragged by the crowd of visitors, which prevents you from contemplating it at your own pace and stopping if you need to even if there is not much to see.
Beautiful views from the outside, where you can get more out of your camera.
review_translated_text:
Visita obligada en tu viaje a India del Norte. Impresionante por fuera pero no esperes lo mismo por dentro. Es un mausoleo y la visita al interior es rodear al mismo y salir: nada mas. Escasos minutos y arrastrado por la multitud de visitantes, que te impide contemplarlo a tu ritmo y deternete si lo necesitas aunque no haya mucho que ver.

Bonitas vistas desde el exterior, donde si podras exprimir mas tu camara de fotos.

name: Karlo Grados (KarloGStyle)
review_text:
#LetsGuide The Taj Mahal is a must-see wonder of the world. Especially when traveling in India. The story in the background is incredibly interesting. The building complex is breathtaking!
You can book a private tour inexpensively. This way you have more peace and quiet and have the tour guide for yourself. I had a chauffeur for the whole day from Delhi to Agra, in the state of Uttar Pradesh, where the Taj Mahal is located in the north of the country. Unfortunately, the chauffeur could hardly speak English, so it was a bit difficult to have a conversation. But he was very nice and took care of everything. I met the tour guide on site, with whom we walked past the long queue. This saved us a lot of time. The guide was very knowledgeable and told many interesting stories about the time when the wonder of the world was created. Meals were also included. We had lunch in a typical Indian restaurant with very good food. Towards the end I felt uncomfortable because I had a very strong feeling that the guide expected a lot more "tips" from me. I had already paid for the trip in full and I gave a tip, about 20 euros, but it wasnt enough.
What you MUST AVOID is being taken to a marble factory! Because you only get a short tour of working with marble and then they persistently try to sell you something. This creates a very unpleasant situation from which it is very difficult to escape. The sellers are stubborn and wont let go. That gave the whole trip a bitter aftertaste at the end. Still, it was a wonderful day! I can only recommend it! #enjoylife #veganlifestyle
review_translated_text:
#LetsGuide Der Taj Mahal ist ein Weltwunder, das man unbedingt gesehen haben muss. Vor allem, wenn man in Indien unterwegs ist. Die Geschichte im Hintergrund ist unheimlich interessant. Das Gebaudekomplex ist atemberaubend!

Man kann sich kostengunstig eine private Fuhrung buchen. So hat man mehr Ruhe und hat den Reiseleiter fur sich selbst. Ich hatte einen Chauffeur fur den ganzen Tag von Delhi bis Agra, im Bundesstaat Uttar Pradesh, wo sich der Taj Mahal befindet im Norden des Landes. Der Chauffeur konnte leider kaum english, deshalb war eine Unterhaltung etwas schwer. Er war aber sehr nett und hat sich um alles gekummert. Vorort traf ich den Reisefuhrer, mit dem wir an der langen Schlange vorbei gingen. Das hat uns sehr viel Zeit gespart. Der Guide war sehr gut informiert und erzahlte viele interessante Geschichten uber die Zeit der Entstehung des Weltwunders. Auch die Verpflegung war Inklusive. Mittagessen gab es in einem typischen indischen Lokal mit sehr gutem Essen. Gegen Ende fuhlte ich mich aber unwohl, weil ich ein sehr starkes Gefuhl hatte, dass der Reisefuhrer viel mehr ,,Trinkgeld" von mir erwartet hat. Den Ausflug hatte ich aber schon komplett bezahlt und ich gab Trinkgeld, ca. 20 Euro, aber es war nicht genug.

Was man UNBEDINGT VERMEIDEN muss ist in eine Marmorfabrik mitgenommen zu werden! Denn man bekommt da nur eine kurze Fuhrung in die Arbeiten mit Marmor und dann wird beharrlich versucht einem etwas zu verkaufen. Dadurch entsteht eine sehr unangenehme Situation, aus der man sich sehr schwer heraus retten kann. Die Verkaufer sind hartnackig und lassen nicht los. Das gab dem ganzen Ausflug einen bitteren Nachgeschmack am Ende. Dennoch war ein wunderschoner Tag! Ich kann das nur empfehlen! #enjoylife #veganlifestyle

name: Asta
review_text: A historical place, which according to people is a symbol of love. The building is nice, the toilets are quite clean (maybe the cleaning service is tired because the number of visitors every day is almost 16,000 people) The entry price is a bit painful for the pocket, Rs 1000 or 200K Idr. There are no discounts for students even if they are students in India. There are discounts for those who carry diplomat cards. Access to this location is quite good. Unfortunately, there are no restaurants that suit your tastebuds other than KFC. They say that going to India isnt complete if you dont come here.

Bangunan bagus, toilet agak bersih (mungkin cleaning service lelah karena jumlah pengunjung setiap hari hampir 16000 orang) Harga masuk agak menyiksa kantong Rs 1000 atau 200K Idr. Gag ada diskon untuk pelajar meski dia pelajar di India. Ada diskon untuk mereka yang bawa kartu diplomat. Akses menuju lokasi ini cukup bagus. Sayangnya gg ada resto yang cocok di lidah selain kfc. Katanya kalau ke India belum lengkap kalau gag kesini.

name: Satpal Singh
review_text:
The Taj Mahal of Agra is one of the Seven Wonders of the World, because more than just looking spectacular, it is the history of the Taj Mahal that adds to its grandeur a soul: a soul that is filled with love, loss, repentance and love again. Because if it were not for love, the world would have been robbed of a good example on which people base their relationships. It is an example of how deeply a man loves his wife, that even when she remained but a memory he made sure that this memory would never fade away. This man was the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, who was head-over-heels in love with his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. He was a Muslim Persian princess (her name before marriage was Arjumand Banu Begum) and was the son of the Mughal emperor Jahangir and grandson of Akbar the Great. It was at the age of 14 that he met Mumtaz and fell in love with her. Five years later in 1612, they married.
Mumtaz Mahal, Shah Jahans inseparable companion, died in 1631 while giving birth to their 14th child. It was to the memory of his beloved wife that Shah Jahan built a magnificent monument as a tribute, which we know today as the Taj Mahal. The construction of Taj Mahal started in the year 1631. Highwaymen, stone bowls, inlayers, carvers, painters, calligraphers, dome makers and other artisans were sought after from all over the empire and also from Central Asia and Iran, and it took almost 22 years of love to create what we see today. , it used the services of 22,000 laborers and 1,000 elephants. The monument was built entirely of white marble, which was brought from across India and Central Asia. After an expenditure of approximately 32 million rupees, the Taj Mahal was finally completed in 1653.

name: aa shafi
review_text:
The Taj Mahal (Hindi: ttaaj mhaal, Urdu: ttaaj mhl) is a royal mausoleum located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. Mughal emperor Shah Jahan built this magnificent monument in memory of his wife Arjumand Banu Begum known as Mumtaz Mahal. The construction of the monument started in 1632 AD and was completed around 1653 AD. While there is much debate as to who designed the monument, it is clear that the monument was built by a group of skilled designers and craftsmen who were accompanied by Ustad Ahmed Lahuri, who is the leading candidate to be the original designer of the Taj Mahal.
The Taj Mahal (sometimes simply referred to as the Taj) is considered a striking example of Mughal architecture, combining Persian, Turkish, Indian and Islamic architecture. Although the white marble domed royal mausoleum is the most admired, the Taj Mahal is actually a complex monolithic structure as a whole. It was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983. The Taj Mahal is one of the Seventh Wonders of the World.[3] It was then called a universally acclaimed masterpiece of world heritage.[2]

All in all, its hot, humid, its dripping and its all September, its full of people, inside the tag, people are pushing and you have to be careful of wrong contact.

name: Udan Wadiman
review_text: Taj Mahal, located in Agra, Ultar Pradesh, India. The Taj Mahal is about 73 meters high, architected by Ustad Ahmad Lahauri, a type of Mughai architecture. It was built on the wishes of the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, Jahangirs son, as a mausoleum for his Persian wife, Arjumand Banu Begum, also known as Mumtaz-ul-Zamani or Mumtaz Mahal. Shah Jahan, emperor of the Mughal Empire had great wealth during his heyday. In 1631 his third and most beloved wife died while giving birth to his daughter Gauhara Begum, their 14th child. At first glance, the Taj Mahal building looks like a large mosque complete with a large white dome. In fact, the Taj Mahal is a burial site. It cannot be denied that Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal with all his heart. The building, which covers an area of   42 hectares, is equipped with a large dome 73 meters high surrounded by 4 smaller domes around it. Meanwhile, the tomb is covered with white marble, Arabic calligraphy writing, as well as 28 types of semi-precious stones such as lapis lazuli, marble, jade and crystals combined in a beautiful floral design. With all its luxurious details and designs, it is not surprising that the construction of the Taj Mahal took so long. Construction of the Taj Mahal began in 1631 and was only completed in 1653. Unfortunately, this emperor had a sad end to his life. The reason is that nine years before he died, Shah Jahan fell ill. Instead of being sad, Shah Jahans children were busy fighting for power. When the emperor recovered, his two sons from Mumtaz Mahal, namely Dara Shikoh and Aurangzeb, quarreled over the throne. Shah Jahan sided with Dara Shikoh even though his son ultimately died at the hands of Aurangzeb. It didnt stop there, after killing his brother, Aurangzeb also overthrew Shah Jahans power in 1658 and imprisoned his father in Agra Fort for life. In the last years of his life, Shah Jahan could no longer visit the Taj Mahal, which was also the final resting place of his beloved wife. The only thing he could do was look at the Taj Mahal from a distance through the small gap in his prison. The Taj Mahal is a silent witness to the love between the emperor and his faithful wife, who he loved the most. Later the Emperor was buried next to his most beloved wife. (Sorry if there is any wrong narration)
review_translated_text: Taj Mahal, berlokasi di Agra, Ultar Pradesh, India. Taj Mahal tingginya sekitar 73 meter, diarsiteki oleh Ustad Ahmad Lahauri, berjenis arsitektur Mughai. Dibangun atas keinginan Kaisar Mughal Shah Jahan, anak Jahangir, sebagai sebuah musoleum untuk istri Persianya, Arjumand Banu Begum, juga dikenal sebagai Mumtaz-ul-Zamani atau Mumtaz Mahal. Shah Jahan, kaisar dari Kekaisaran Mughal memiliki kekayaan yang besar selama masa kejayaannya. Pada 1631 istri ketiganya dan merupakan istri yang paling dicintainya wafat sewaktu melahirkan putrinya Gauhara Begum, anak ke-14 mereka. Sekilas bangunan Taj Mahal tampak seperti sebuah masjid besar lengkap dengan sebuah kubah putih besar. Nyatanya Taj Mahal adalah sebuah tempat pemakaman. Tidak bisa dipungkiri, Shah Jahan membangun Taj Mahal dengan sepenuh hatinya. Bangunan dengan luas mencapai 42 hektar itu dilengkapi dengan kubah besar setinggi 73 meter dikelilingi oleh 4 kubah yang lebih kecil disekitarnya. Sedangkan bagian makam dilapisi dengan marmer putih, tulisan kaligrafi Arab, juga 28 jenis batu semi mulia seperti batu lapis lazuli, marmer, giok, hingga kristal yang disatukan dalam desain bunga yang indah. Dengan semua detail dan desainnya yang mewah, tidak heran jika pembangunan Taj Mahal memakan waktu lama. Pembangunan Taj Mahal dimulai pada tahun 1631 dan baru selesai di tahun 1653. Sayangnya kaisar ini memiliki akhir hidup yang menyedihkan. Pasalnya sembilan tahun sebelum meninggal, Shah Jahan jatuh sakit. Bukannya bersedih, anak-anak Shah Jahan justru sibuk memperebutkan kekuasaan. Ketika sang kaisar sembuh, dua anaknya dari Mumtaz Mahal yaitu Dara Shikoh dan Aurangzeb, bertengkar karena tahta. Shah Jahan memihak Dara Shikoh meski akhirnya putranya itu tewas di tangan Aurangzeb. Tidak sampai di situ, usai membunuh saudaranya, Aurangzeb juga menggulingkan kekuasaan Shah Jahan pada tahun 1658 dan memenjarakan ayahnya tersebut di Benteng Agra seumur hidup. Di tahun-tahun terakhir hidupnya, Shah Jahan tidak bisa lagi mengunjungi Taj Mahal yang juga menjadi tempat peristirahatan terakhir sang istri tercinta. Satu-satunya yang dia bisa lakukan adalah memandang Taj Mahal dari kejauhan melalui celah kecil yang ada di penjaranya. Taj Mahal adalah saksi bisu cinta kasih antara sang kaisar dengan istrinya yang setia, yang paling dikasihi. Belakangan Sang Kaisar dimakamkan bersebelahan dengan istri yang paling dicintainya. (Mohon maaf bila ada penuturan yang keliru)

name: gimyeonghun
review_text: For me, it is a place filled with a bit of joy and sorrow. I coordinated all my travel itineraries to make sure I went to the Taj Mahal, but in reality, I had to change my water due to the water I drank on the train to Agra, and I was tired of waiting in line and repeated security checks, so I couldnt see it properly. The intimidating feeling given by the large white building was incredible.

At the ticket purchase office, a public sector commentator came forward and offered a price of Rs600.-, which was negotiable. When we walked to the entrance of the main square, we met a public sector commentator who looked very sincere and offered a price of only Rs200.-, but the actual price was only Rs200.-. The attitude during the explanation process was good.

The tuk tuk driver told me that it would be crowded later in the day, so it was recommended to go at 6:30 in the morning, so I went there at that time, but it was so foggy that I couldnt see anything. Gradually I started to see it, and by around 9am I could see it clearly.

There are about 400 photographers on site, and they are familiar with many of the best spots, so they can take great photos.
Please be careful as they will take a large number of photos and then give you all the data.

Taj Mahal is very beautiful and is a place you should visit at least once in your life.

name: DK Editor Official
review_text:
This happened at Taj Mahal during Corona period
#corona
-During the first wave of Corona virus infection, the Taj Mahal remained closed from 17 March to 20 September.

-Taj Mahal was open from 21st September, but the ticket windows remained closed.

-The ticket window was opened at the memorial on January 2, 2021. The ticket window was being opened after 15 thousand online tickets were booked.

-The monuments remained closed from 16 April to 15 June during the Corona virus infection period. When the memorial opened, the ticket window was kept closed.

-The ticket window was opened at Taj Mahal on 27th November.

-Ticket windows were closed on January 3.

-On April 9, one ticket window each at the eastern and western gates of the Taj Mahal was opened for Indian tourists.

-The ticket window was also opened for foreign tourists from May 14.
#Tajmahal
#viralpost
#google
#map #india
@map @google
Thanks for reading

review_text:
Nice place within everything...there is nothing more than the Taj Majal. And you visit quickly because inside there is only the timba and thats it, there is nothing else.
The guide we had was more or less, it wasnt a big deal.
Many unbearable and rude tourists
I remember that some Spanish women were fighting over who was going to take photos first, hahahaha I didnt even wait 5 minutes, but she was very offended by the others, I feel sorry for them, its funny how people who think they are spiritual go to India and behave like shit, they ruin with their ridiculous behavior
Honestly, I dont recommend going at dawn, there is so much pollution and fog that you cant see anything, I went at 9 AM and it was fine
I think it is one of the few famous places in India that is worth visiting.

name: Alberto chioetto
review_text:
The monument and the garden surrounding it are worthy of its fame. An experience worth having even if it is not the only quality monument to visit.
I suggest going to India in winter to be able to enjoy the visit as best as possible, as the temperature is still mild.
We Italians, accustomed to the magnificence of Pisa, Florence, Siena, Orvieto, Venice, Palermo and all the rest that we can boast, perhaps are not so enraptured, but neither are we indifferent to such beauty.
I suggest a visit at sunset. Beware of guides who have an interest in having their friends make the photo album for you.

Noi italiani, abituati alle magnificenze di Pisa, Firenze, Siena, Orvieto, Venezia, Palermo e tutto il resto che possiamo vantare, forse non rimaniamo cosi estasiati, ma nemmeno indifferenti a tanta bellezza.

This is the reason why this building has been included among the seven wonders of the world.

name: bilma minj
review_text:
This wonder of the world, Taj Mahal, considered an example of love, is the pride of India. This amazing monument was built in white marble by Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz, who died while giving birth to her fourteenth child. Tourists from far away countries come here to see this symbol of love.
Taj Mahal, one of the seven wonders, known for the prime of love, is the pride of India. This stunning monument is completely made up of white marble by Shah Jahan, in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal, who died while giving birth to her 14th child. Tourists from far countries come to witness this relic and token of love.

name: Olivier Perbet
review_text: Like the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the Taj Mahal is more impressive from afar than from the inside. Seeing it in the mist from the top of your hotel is magical. Up close, many viewpoints enhance it (between the trees, on a reflection). The colors of its white marble vary according to the light of the day: scarlet at zenith, pink in the early morning, orange at dusk. The interior is a sober mausoleum: beautiful Arabic inscriptions, a tomb, but a lot of emptiness (well occupied by the many visitors).
review_translated_text: Comme la Tour Eiffel a Paris, le Taj Mahal est davantage impressionnant de loin que de linterieur. Lapercevoir dans la brume du haut de son hotel est magique. De plus pres, de nombreux points de vue le valorisent (entre les arbres, sur un reflet). Les couleurs de son marbre blanc varient selon la lumiere du jour : ecarlate au zenith, rose au petit matin, orange au crepuscule. Linterieur est un mausolee sobre : de belles inscriptions arabes, un tombeau, mais beaucoup de vide (bien occupe par les nombreux visiteurs).

They made me a little nervous at the beginning because you cant pay by card and its not cheap. It is best to enter at dawn, although the crowds were not as large as the guidebooks warn. name: Anastasiya Zayrullina
review_text: We arrived in Agra in the evening near the Taj Mahal and rented a hotel just 100 meters from the main entrance. It is better to visit the mausoleum early in the morning, around 6.00. Then there are fewer people and you don't have to wait in a kilometer-long line in the heat. An entrance ticket must be purchased 1 km away. from the main entrance, where you can get shoe covers and water with a ticket. The ticket costs 1000 rupees. With the same ticket you can get a discount of 50 rupees at the red fort. Ticket 550 rupees. You can get to the red fort by rickshaw for 50 rupees. or take a 3 km walk through the park. In the evening you can go down to the Yamuna and look at the Mausoleum at sunset. There are also boatmen there who offer to take you to the other side of the river.
review_translated_text: Priehali my v agru vecherom vozle Tadzh-mahala snyali gostinicu vsego v 100 m. Ot centralnogo vhoda. Poseshchat mavzoley luchshe rano utrom, chasov v 6.00. Togda menshe lyudey i ne nuzhno otstaivat kilometrovuyu ochered na zhare. Vhodnoy bilet nuzhno priobresti v 1 km. ot centralnogo vhoda, tam zhe po biletu vydayut bahily i vodu. Bilet stoit 1000 rup. Po etomu zhe biletu mozhno poluchit skidku v krasnom forte v 50 rup. Bilet 550 rup. Do krasnogo forta mozhno doehat na rikshe za 50 rup. ili progulyatsya po parku 3 km. Vecherom mozhno spustitsya k Yamune i posmotret na Mavzoley na zakate tam zhe nahodyatsya lodochniki kotorye predlagayut otvezti na drugoy bereg reki.

review_text:
Fantastic building. The truth is that it is very very beautiful, even with some scaffolding on one of its towers it is still magnificent.

I really like to travel and many times what is thought about monuments before and after usually changes, everyone had told me true wonders about one of the wonders of the world, excuse the redundancy and the truth is that I thought it was very beautiful, we It was sunny, and we took some great photos, but hey, it would still be another level lower than places like Machu Picchu or Pamukkale or Cappadocia in Turkey.

I completely recommend it and you have to pay attention that you have to take the tickets in the other direction than the main entrance, in a kind of school, it is curious but good. There isnt much of a line, but be careful because they dont let almost anything in. You have to leave bags and everything at the entrance. What I recommend is to bring only your cell phone and a camera to take photos.

Its quite crowded but you get seconds of privacy sometimes.

What upset me is that it is very well maintained but the surroundings are very poor, very dirty and extremely poorly maintained, without going any further to the other side of the river (disgusting by the way) everything looks horrible.

As people say, the worst thing you have is that entry is not controlled and being told that you cannot pay with a credit card is the most unfortunate thing you can hear and gives a very bad image of the country.
review_translated_text:
Fantastico edificio. La verdad es muy muy bonito, incluso con unos andamios en una de sus torres es magnifico todavia.


Me gusta mucho viajar y muchas veces lo que se piensa antes de los monumentos y despues suele cambiar, todo el mundo me habia hablado verdaderas maravillas de una de las maravillas del mundo, valga la redundancia y la verdad es que me parecio muy bonito, nos hizo sol, y tomamos unas fotos geniales, pero bueno todavia se me quedaria a otro nivel inferior a sitios como el Machu Picchu o a Pamukkale o Capadocia en Turquia.


Lo recomiendo completamente y hay que fijarse que hay que sacar los tickets hacia la otra direccion que la entrada principal, en una especie de colegio, es curioso pero bueno. No hay demasiada fila, pero tened cuidado porque no dejan entrar casi nada hay que dejar bolsos y de todo en la entrada, lo que recomienso es llevar el movil solamente y la camara para hacer fotos.


Esta bastante lleno de gente pero se logran segundos de intimidad a veces.


Lo que me disgusto es que esta muy cuidado pero los alrededores son pobrisimos, sucisimos y super mal cuidados, sin ir mas lejos al otro lado del rio (asqueroso por cierto) se ve todo horrible.


Como dice la gente, lo que peor sabor te queda, es que no se controla la entrada y que te digan que no se puede pagar con tarjeta de credito es lo mas lamentable que se puede oir y da una imagen malisima del pais.

name: R Bo
review_text: Theres pretty decent food. The portions are sufficient and inexpensive. The service could be better and for complete newbies to Indian cuisine a few explanations in the menu or from the staff would be useful.
review_translated_text: Es gibt recht ordentliches Essen. Die Portionen sind ausreichend und preiswert. Der Service konnte besser sein und fur komplette Neulinge der indischen Kuche waren ein paar Erklarungen in der Speisekarte oder durch das Personal sinnvoll.

name: haphe zaelani
review_text:
Taj Mahal is a monument located in Agra, India. It was built on the wishes of the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, Jahangirs son, as a mausoleum for his Persian wife, Arjumand Banu Begum, also known as Mumtaz-ul-Zamani or Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal is a masterpiece of Mughal architecture.

In 1983 the Taj Mahal was accepted as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
review_translated_text:
Taj Mahal adalah sebuah monumen yang terletak di Agra, India. Dibangun atas keinginan Kaisar Mughal Shah Jahan, anak Jahangir, sebagai sebuah musoleum untuk istri Persianya, Arjumand Banu Begum, juga dikenal sebagai Mumtaz-ul-Zamani atau Mumtaz Mahal. Taj Mahal merupakan sebuah adi karya dari arsitektur Mughal.


Pada tahun 1983 Taj Mahal diterima sebagai Situs Warisan Dunia UNESCO.

name: Piotr Suchorab
review_text: A beautiful, large building with an interesting history. If you are in India, you must see them. It is worth taking a bus to Agra and returning on the same day. The town offers nothing interesting.
review_translated_text: Piekna, wielka budowla z ciekawa historia. Bedac w Indiach nalezy je zobaczyc. Warto pojechac busem do Agry i wrocic tego samego dnia. Miejscowosc nie oferuje nic ciekawego.

name: Edeltraud Keromosemito
review_text: Totally overcrowded place. There is no trace of the original magic of 10 years ago. The complex is still worth seeing because of the architecture.
review_translated_text: Total uberlaufener Ort. Von dem ursprunglichen Zauber, wie noch vor 10 Jahren , ist nichts mehr zu spuren. Die Anlage ist trotzdem sehenswert wegen der Architektur.

name: Anne Gendrault
review_text: THE monument to visit in India... entry a little expensive (1100 Rupees)... and to photograph it at sunset, you have to pay again (300 Rupees). What a disappointment that it is not lit at night!

beautiful! !

review_text: It is an impressive mortuary mausoleum dedicated to love. A must visit if you go to India. The entrance is much more expensive for foreigners.

name: Eyal Teller
review_text:
A stunning place, one of the wonders of the world.
The complex is closed to free entry, the cost for tourists is high. There is no usual India hustle and bustle.
Very quiet in the area, very clean. There are no animals walking around and no disturbing things of any kind.
The city of Agra is very large and not very attractive to tourists except for the massive mausoleum whose beauty cannot be described in words...

name: Angelica Bojorquez
review_text:
Taj Mahal is a mausoleum built between 1632 and 1653 in the city of Agra, state of Uttar Pradesh, India, on the banks of the Yamuna River, by the Muslim emperor Shah Jahan of the Mughal dynasty. The imposing complex of buildings was erected in honor of his favorite wife, Arjumand Bano Begum - better known as Mumtaz Mahal - who died giving birth to their fourteenth daughter. It is estimated that its construction required the efforts of some 20,000 workers under the direction of a group of architects led by the court architect, Ustad Ahmad Lahori.
It is like an oasis in a desert. Agra is horrible and terribly dirty. Salespeople harass you all the time. The dirt is everywhere and you arrive at the Taj Mahal and it seems like you are entering another dimension. The difference is impressive. I wouldnt give it my vote for modern wonders.
review_translated_text:
Taj Mahal, es un mausoleo construido entre 1632 y 1653 en la ciudad de Agra, estado de Uttar Pradesh (India), a orillas del rio Yamuna, por el emperador musulmanShah Jahan de la dinastia mogol. El imponente conjunto de edificios se erigio en honor de su esposa favorita, Arjumand Bano Begum --mas conocida como Mumtaz Mahal-- que murio en el parto de su decimocuarta hija. Se estima que su construccion necesito el esfuerzo de unos 20 000 obreros bajo direccion de un conjunto de arquitectos liderados por el arquitecto de la corte, Ustad Ahmad Lahori.

Es como un oasis en un desierto. Agra es horrible y terriblemente sucia. Los vendedores te hostigan todo el tiempo. La suciedad esta por todoaa partes y llegas al Taj Mahal y parece que entras a otra dimension. Es impresionante la diferencia. Yo no le daria mi voto de las maravillas modernas.

name: Subrata Debnath
review_text:
A large charbagh (the Mughal garden was formerly divided into four parts) was laid out in the forecourt of the Taj Mahal. Each quarter of the 300m x 300m garden is divided into 16 flower gardens using raised walkways. A tall marble stone water tank is placed between the shrine and the doorway and the garden, and a north-south rectilinear tank that reflects the Taj Mahal. Apart from this, the garden has several tree-lined avenues and fountains.

Charbagh gardens were first built in India by the first Mughal emperor Babur, which was designed in the style of Persian gardens. Charbag means that the garden of heaven will be reflected. A Persian mystic in writings of the Mughal period described the Garden of Heaven as an ideal garden, filled with abundance. Water or water plays a major role in this narrative. In that text, four rivers arose from a mountain in the middle of the garden of heaven, and they flowed separately to the north, south, east and west of the garden.

Walking path along the linear chowbachar

Almost all Mughal charbaghs are quadrangular in shape, with a shrine or camp in the center of the garden. But the Taj Mahal is different from the others in this respect because its mausoleum is located at one end of the garden instead of being in the middle of the garden. The newly discovered Mahtab Bagh on the other side of the Yamuna River offers a glimpse of a different story, the Yamuna River was incorporated into the design of the garden to make it meaningful as a river of heaven.

The layout of the garden and its architectural features such as its fountains, brick or marble paths and flower beds with geometric brick lines are very similar to Salimar and the sequence was designed by the same engineer, Ali Mardan.

Later on garden roses, daffodils, various fruit trees and other plants are known to be abundant. With the subsequent decline of the Mughal emperors, the gardens also declined. During the British rule, the British took over the maintenance of the Taj Mahal. They transformed this natural landscape to give it the appearance of a new London formal garden.

other buildings

The main gate of the Taj Mahal

The Taj Mahal grounds are surrounded on three sides by sandstone fort-like walls. There is no wall on the river side. Outside these walls are other tombs, including the tombs of Shah Jahans other wives and a large tomb of Mumtazs favorite attendants. These structures, mainly made of red sandstone, look like typical small Mughal tombs of the time.

The inner (garden) walls are pillared and roofed. which was commonly seen in Hindu temples and later carried over to Mughal mosque designs. The walls are connected by peculiar domed buildings overlooking several places, which were used as observation posts. which is currently being used as a museum. The main entrance to the Taj Mahal is also made of marble. The design and style of the door is reminiscent of the architecture of the Mughal emperors. Its arches are shaped exactly like tomb arches and its pistachio arches are matched with calligraphy designs of tombs. Its roof is designed like other sandstone buildings, with beautiful geometric shapes.

Design inside the answer

At the far end of the square are two large sandstone buildings with open sides towards the tomb. Their backs are parallel to the east and west walls.

Taj Mahal Mosque

The two buildings look like exact mirror images of each other. The building on the eastern side is the mosque, the other is the Jawab (North), whose main purpose was to keep the balance (used to house guests during the Mughal period). The answer is different not only in its mehram and its floor design where the floor of the mosque is marked with black stone for 569 worshipers to pray.

The basic design of the mosque is similar to other buildings built by Shah Jahan. Especially his Masjid-e-Jahannuma or Delhi Jama Masjid--a large house topped by three domes. The mosques of the Mughal period used to divide the prayer area into three parts. On either side of the big prayer area is a small prayer area. Each prayer area in the Taj Mahal has a huge dome over it but the area is open.

The construction of the building was completed in 1643 AD.

name: Karthik Kumar Gajam
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is truly a magnificent sight, living up to its reputation as one of the wonders of the world. The intricate marble work, the symmetrical gardens, and the reflection in the pool are mesmerizing.

However, be prepared for high humidity, especially if you're visiting during the warmer months. It can get quite uncomfortable, so I recommend carrying water, wearing light clothing, and taking breaks in the shaded areas.

Despite the weather, the beauty of this iconic monument makes it worth the visit..

name: Marinda Coetzee
review_text: Very beautiful gardens and amazing marble design skills! Loved doing this with friends! We had a great day experiencing Agra, seeing how they make marble crafts, jewelry from India stone, and beaitiful fabrics. Loved the Indian food also!

name: David Delgado
review_text:
The Taj is everything you expect it to be, if you go at the right time. You HAVE to BE there at 05:00 a.m. (gates open at 05:45 a.m.) if you want to have gorgeous views and pics but most importantly, if you want to explore the place calmly without crowds. It's well organized. Buy the tickets online before hand, and you will be ok. Beware of all the "photographers" and tour guides trying to sell you their services. Beware also that the museum that comes with the ticket price, only open at 09:00 so if you are there at 05:00 it will be a long wait (and you cannot get in food or beverages other than water).
Visited on
Weekend

name: SAMIR PRAMANIK (Sam)
review_text:
A Masterpiece of Love and Architecture

Review:

The Taj Mahal is a breathtaking testament to the power of love and human ingenuity. Its intricate marble facade, adorned with delicate floral carvings and calligraphy, is a sight to behold. The symmetrical design and the play of light and shadow create a mesmerizing atmosphere.
While the crowds can be significant, especially during peak tourist seasons, the experience is still unforgettable. The early morning hours offer a more serene and less crowded visit, allowing you to truly appreciate the monuments beauty.
A guided tour can provide valuable insights into the history and architecture of the Taj Mahal. Dont miss the opportunity to explore the surrounding gardens, which are equally stunning and offer a peaceful respite from the bustling city.

Tips for visitors:
* Plan your visit: Consider visiting during the off-peak seasons (November to February or July to August) to avoid large crowds.
* Dress appropriately: Modest clothing is required, and avoid wearing shorts or sleeveless tops.
* Carry necessary items: Bring sunscreen, water, and comfortable shoes.
* Respect the monument: Adhere to the rules and regulations, and refrain from touching the marble surfaces.

Overall, the Taj Mahal is a must-see destination for anyone visiting India. Its timeless beauty and historical significance make it a truly unforgettable experience.

name: Imtiyaz Ahmed
review_text:
Since childhood, I have seen the Taj Mahal in books, movies, and, of course, toys as well. When I saw the dome of the Taj Mahal from outside before entering the main gate, it was a once-in-a-lifetime moment that was truly unforgettable. Words cannot express the beauty of that sight.

It is surreal when you enter from the main gate and see the Taj Mahal receding from your sight, The view was truly magnificent. Once inside, I sat on the floor and gazed at the Taj Mahal for over an hour without moving.

However, the place was overcrowded with many .People were striking funny poses for photographers. One funny example is trying to imitate the famous pose of raising one hand and touching the tip of the Taj Mahal .

Despite this, the Taj Mahal offers a variety of experiences - from a sense of peace when ignoring the chaos around you, to moments of joy when observing the surroundings, and even situations that could potentially make you angry. It is a place where you can never feel bored.

Although I am not sharing my experience with scammers around the Taj Mahal because everyone might be aware of that issue.

name: Mohammed Raees Babu Vk
review_text:
Taj Mahal - A Timeless Wonder

The Taj Mahal, an iconic symbol of love, is a must-visit marvel located in Agra, India. Built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, this UNESCO World Heritage site is renowned for its stunning white marble architecture and intricate craftsmanship.

Visiting Hours:

* Open from 6:00 AM to 6:30 PM (except Fridays).
* Night viewing is available on full moon nights and two days before and after.

Ticket Prices (as of 2024):

* Indian visitors: 50
* Foreign tourists: 1100
* SAARC/BIMSTEC visitors: 540
* Children under 15: Free

Best Time to Visit:

* Early morning or during sunset for mesmerizing views. Winter months (October to March) offer pleasant weather.

Facilities:

* Wheelchair access is available.
* No food or large bags are allowed inside, but locker facilities are available.

name: Adrian Yeong
review_text:
While driving in toward the parking , I got stopped by a guide on a motorbike.
Telling me that the waiting time to go in might take 45 - 60 mins.
If I use him, no waiting time and everything will be express. He quoted me 1800 rupee and it was raining at that time. Wanted to use him but in the end , he bought me to a parking place that need to pay 100 rupee and after that I decided not to because before he told me that parking is free.

After that , I managed to park at the area where the electric bungee were and paid 20 rupee for the bungee to get in to the ticket counter. Upon arriving at the parking , there are a lot more guides knocking at my door.
Some charges 200 rupee to get tickets for me.
Some asking for 500 rupee as a guide. But I had rejected all and took the bungee in.
There was no Q at all at the counter and the process was fast.
A lot of people there trying to be nice to help me guide the way , sell umbrella , rent , or even pass me the umbrella but after that wanted me to go to their shops.
But I had rejected all and decided to just walk in the rain.
Process for checking the bags and body checks was chaotic. No food allowed , I had sweets in my bag and was asked to throw. I had a talisman that I bought at leh which was forbidden to bring in and I threw it away during the check too.
After that , it's the walk and the majestic view.
Its was raining and windy.
And I think that there would be more people if there was no rain.
When everything is finish , going back out , I got to face the shops owners asking me to go in their shops and the waiting for the bungee ride are in a mess.
But somehow I managed to get up 1 and this time I didn't pay anything. I don't know why.
But I am grateful that I am able to witness everything and was safe.
Hope I can help people who want to come here to understand more of how the process is like.
And the ticket is 1300 rupee including the walk in the museum. I advise to get them too rather then just paying 1100 rupee to go in.

Weekday

As a group, we got a photographer who took all of our group photos. Cost is IDR$100 per photo or in bulk deal and you get paper photo and electronic copy as well.

We chose to go barefoot on the marble instead of wearing the shoe covers. It felt so good to be walking on such hallowed grounds in bare feet.
Awesome and truly amazing place.
Highly recommend to everyone.

Nice to walk around the whole grounds and enjoy the experience.

name: Kc Jeh
review_text:
A Timeless Marvel of Love and Beauty*

The Taj Mahal is an awe-inspiring monument that transcends time and leaves visitors spellbound. This stunning white marble mausoleum, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal, is a testament to eternal love and architectural excellence.

*Architectural Splendor*

The Taj Mahals perfect proportions, intricate inlays, and calligraphic inscriptions create a sense of harmony and balance. The reflecting pools, gardens, and fountains add to the serene ambiance, making it a haven for peace and contemplation.

*Emotional Connection*

As you step inside, the Taj Mahals emotional resonance is palpable. The story of Shah Jahans love and loss is etched in every stone, making this monument a poignant reminder of the power of love.

A Must-Visit Experience

The Taj Mahal is an absolute must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply experiencing the beauty of human creation. Be prepared to be mesmerized by its grandeur and left with memories to cherish forever.

My Rating: 5/5 stars

name: Abhijeet Mishra
review_text: Visiting the Taj Mahal was a breathtaking experience! The beauty of the white marble structure is beyond words, especially at sunrise when the monument glows softly. The intricate details of the carvings and the symmetry of the gardens make it a photographer's paradise. As you walk closer, the craftsmanship becomes even more mesmerizing.
