name: Ankita Singh
review_text:
Magnificent beauty it is. Tajmahal has its own beauty which is really pleasant to see. We went there on weekends early in the morning and was surprised to see the crowd at that time. It was very crowded. So I guess there is no day when we see less crowd. People from all over the place came to adore its beauty. Weather was pleasant as it was monsoon when we went there. For tickets we purchased online but make sure to buy from ASI website as it will be easier to get in. For night view of tajmahal.. tickets are only available when there is full moon chances. Otherwise it is not available. Must visit place with family and friends. Make sure not to take any food items or plastic water bottles. Can carry Personal water bottles. Keep hats,cap handy in summers. For luggage cloak room facilities are available. To reach to taj mahal any of the gate, one can walk or can take golf cart with 20rs pp charge.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: SANKET HANKARE
review_text:
1. Its very beautiful. Advisable to get tickets online or from the QR scanner for payment available approximately 100m before the turnstile entry gate.

2. Best time is to visit early in the morning. Reach here at 6am and you will find less crowd and low temperature. There are few small shops inside providing water bottles and snacks.

3. For Indian tourists, seeing Taj Mahal from outside costs 50 INR and to get inside it costs 200 INR extra. So in total its 250/-. However there is a small discount for online tickets. You can get the above tickets in two parts of 50 and 200 from the counter or also directly 250. So if one takes only INR 50 ticket to just watch the Taj Mahal but later wishes to also get inside it, he can take 200/- ticket from the counter just outside the main Taj Mahal monument.

4. Inside the Taj Mahal you can go barefoot or with shoe cover. The reusable cloth shoe cover is available free of cost at the counter which is just outside the main Taj Mahal monument entrance. The shoe cover then needs to be deposited in the big containers at the exit.

5. Overall it will take 2-4 hours to complete the tour. The entry starts at approximately 5:30am in the morning till approximately 5 or 5:30 pm in the evening. However the selling of tickets both online and offline may stop early at around 5pm approximately. So at least by 4:30 pm one should reach the place.

6. The outermost entry gate is just at one minute walking distance from the Taj Mahal Metro Station. From this outermost entry gate, it will take 10-45min to reach the actual Taj Mahal by walking. All depending on the crowd and timing of the visit. It took us around 30 min overall including the time spent in the entry line, and also it was our first visit so that also adds to the time. Also we went on Saturday.

7. There are some 11-seater (approx) golf carts that are available just inside the outermost entrance gate for those who dont want to walk. They help you save only five to ten minutes of walking time. So we didnt opt for it.

8. Best time to reach is before 7am or after 4pm.

9. Its closed on Friday.

10. Taking photos is allowed almost everywhere with few exceptions.

11. Food items are not allowed to be carried inside. Water bottles are allowed. Checking of bags is properly done at the turnstile entry gate. However it may be possible to sneak in a toffee or two.

name: aditya salvi
review_text:
Visiting the Taj Mahal for the first time is nothing short of a surreal experience. As you approach this iconic monument, the anticipation builds, and the moment you catch your first glimpse of the gleaming white marble, it feels as though youve stepped into a dream. The Taj Mahals ethereal beauty defies words; its sheer size, the intricate details of the carvings, and the symmetry of the entire structure make it a sight to behold.

Upon arrival, you are greeted by helpful local guides, who share fascinating insights into the history and craftsmanship behind the Taj. Their stories bring the monument to life, weaving a narrative of love, loss, and architectural brilliance. They also know the best spots for photographs, helping you capture the magic of the moment.

One of the most thoughtful aspects of the visit is the battery-operated cabs that ferry visitors to and from the parking area. These eco-friendly vehicles ensure that the serene ambiance around the Taj Mahal remains undisturbed by pollution or noise. The short ride through the well-maintained approach road allows you to gather your thoughts and prepare yourself for the awe-inspiring sight that awaits.

As you walk through the grand entrance and the Taj Mahal comes into full view, you cant help but feel a sense of wonder and reverence. The shimmering reflection in the long pool, the peacefulness of the surroundings, and the sheer majesty of the monument create an experience that feels almost otherworldly.

The visit to the Taj Mahal is a journey not just through space, but through time and emotion--a truly surreal experience that stays with you long after youve left.

name: Vellesya
review_text:
My husband and i visited the Taj Mahal for our honeymoon in April and it was such a surreal experience

Pro:
April/May is summer, so there weren't too many people!  We could soak in the beauty without the usual massive crowds

Con:
It's HOT. Like, seriously HOT!  Be ready for the sun and heat, especially if you're there later in the day. Bring a hat or sunscreen 

We got our tickets on the spot --1,100 rupees for Southeast Asian tourists like us  It includes a super helpful tour guide & bottled water 

We got there bright and early at 5 AM to catch the sunrise & it was magical! 

Since it was so early, the place was practically less crowded. As the day went on, it did get busier, so the early bird definitely gets the best views 

Our tour guide gave us all the details about the Taj Mahal's history --from how it was built to all the little stories that made it so special

Seeing the Taj Mahal in person is a whole other level. It's so much bigger and more beautiful than we ever imagined . The surrounding gardens are gorgeous too --perfect for taking a little break in the shade

Afterward, our guide took us to a souvenir shop . It was a bit pricey , and they claimed the items were made with stones used in the Taj Mahal itself. We couldn't resist and bought something, but by the time we got back to home, it had cracked 

Overall, it was such an unforgettable experience

The white appearance of the marble turns yellow, brown or green. This is caused by air pollution, insect droppings and construction work in the area.

The water quality of the nearby Yamuna River is severely polluted, leading to a massive infestation of insects, which in turn contaminate the buildings.

The low water level of the Yamuna River has caused the foundations of the Taj Mahal to dry out and become brittle.

# India

name: Sarath Babu Engoor
review_text:
Visiting the Taj Mahal is a breathtaking experience, but there are a few things to be aware of to ensure a smooth visit. The entry process has two main fees: 50 to enter the first gate and an additional 200 to go inside the Taj Mahal itself. Its essential to be cautious when dealing with guides. Many can be pushy, and some might try to overcharge or pressure you into additional services. If you plan on hiring a guide, make sure to confirm the price upfront and clarify what it includes. After your tour of the Taj Mahal, be sure to pay and settle the deal immediately.

Some guides might try to control your shopping experience by taking you to specific shops where they receive commissions, often leading you to a place falsely advertised as a mini Taj Mahal. These shops typically sell overpriced items. To avoid this, be firm in your choices and opt for exploring local markets on your own if possible.

The Taj Mahal is undoubtedly worth the visit, but a little caution can go a long way in ensuring a memorable experience.

name: Md. Johirul Islam
review_text:
The Taj Mahal, a symbol of eternal love, takes on a magical glow in the early morning hours that is truly indescribable. As the first rays of the sun gently kiss the pristine white marble, the entire monument seems to radiate with a soft, golden light. This moment, fleeting and delicate, gives the Taj an ethereal beauty, as if its floating in a dreamlike world. The cool morning air adds to the serenity, allowing visitors to absorb the grandeur of this architectural masterpiece in peace and reflection.

The symmetry of the Taj Mahal, with its majestic domes and minarets, stands in stark contrast to the quiet of the early hours. There's a stillness, broken only by the songs of birds and the soft murmur of the Yamuna River in the distance. The marble's intricate carvings and inlaid gemstones sparkle subtly, enhanced by the soft sunlight, and every detail comes alive under this natural glow.

Seeing the Taj Mahal at dawn is more than just a visual experience; it's deeply emotional. The monument, built as a testament to Shah Jahan's undying love for his wife Mumtaz Mahal, evokes feelings of timelessness, loss, and beauty. As the sun continues to rise, the colors of the sky shift from pale blues to warm oranges, wrapping the Taj in a soft embrace that seems almost heavenly.

To truly understand the allure of the Taj Mahal, one must experience this sacred moment. It's not just a wonder of architecture but a place where nature and artistry come together, leaving you with a sense of awe and peace that lingers long after the sun has fully risen.

name: piyush yadav
review_text:
The Taj Mahal!

One of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Taj Mahal is an iconic white marble mausoleum in Agra, India.

*History:*

Built between 1632 and 1653 by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan as a tribute to his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal, who died during childbirth.

*Architecture:*

- Blends Indian, Persian, and Islamic styles
- Symmetrical design with intricate inlays of precious stones
- Reflecting pools and gardens add to its beauty

*Interesting Facts:*

1. Took 22,000 workers and 1,000 elephants to build
2. Cost: approximately 32 million rupees (about $450 million today)
3. Changes color with the light: pinkish in sunrise, white in daytime, and golden in sunset
4. Made from Makrana white marble
5. Surrounding complex includes mosques, gardens, and fountains

*Visiting Information:*

1. Location: Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India
2. Open: Sunrise to sunset (closed on Fridays)
3. Best time to visit: October to February
4. Ticket prices: vary depending on nationality and time of day

*Symbolism:*

The Taj Mahal represents eternal love, beauty, and romance, attracting millions of visitors worldwide.

Weekend

name: dinesh Jangra
review_text: The Taj Mahal is an extraordinary monument that symbolizes love and architectural brilliance. Nestled in Agra, India, it was commissioned by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal.This breathtaking structure is crafted from white marble, which gleams under the sun and changes hues with the time of day. The intricate inlay work and delicate carvings showcase the artistry of Mughal architecture.Visitors are often awed by the symmetry and grandeur of the gardens leading to the mausoleum. As you walk through the serene pathways, the ethereal beauty of the Taj captures your heart.The experience is not just visual; its an emotional journey that speaks of eternal love.Overall, the Taj Mahal is a must-visit for anyone exploring India, offering a perfect blend of history, beauty, and romance that leaves a lasting impression.

name: sunil Jakhar
review_text:
My Review of the Taj Mahal

Visiting the Taj Mahal was an unforgettable experience. This iconic monument lives up to its reputation as one of the most beautiful and awe-inspiring places in the world. Here are my thoughts:

1. Architectural Beauty:
The Taj Mahal's architecture is simply breathtaking. The white marble seems to glow, especially at sunrise and sunset. The intricate carvings and the perfect symmetry make it feel like a work of art. The dome and the four surrounding minarets are an impressive sight up close.

2. Emotional Connection:
Knowing the history behind the Taj Mahal, built as a symbol of love by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife, added a deeply emotional layer to my visit. It feels more than just a building--it's a tribute to eternal love and devotion, which made the experience even more meaningful.

3. Serene Surroundings:
The gardens and the reflection pool surrounding the monument create a peaceful atmosphere. Despite the crowds, I found moments of quiet where I could simply appreciate the beauty and calmness of the environment.

4. Crowds and Experience:
The Taj Mahal can get quite crowded, especially during peak times. However, even with the number of people, the beauty of the place shines through. I would recommend visiting early in the morning to avoid large crowds and enjoy a more peaceful experience.

5. Overall Impressions:
Whether you're interested in history, architecture, or simply want to witness one of the wonders of the world, the Taj Mahal is a must-see. It's a timeless monument that captivates you from the moment you step inside the gates. I left feeling inspired and moved by both its beauty and the story behind it.

name: Anastasiya Episheva
review_text:
ALL WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW BEFORE GOING THERE

#buy ticket online (full one so no need to be in line)
#rent a saree (7 min away from taj they have a shop for it 1000/2000)
#best time to go evening around 4pm
#museum working only 9-5pm
#you can get your shoes cover near taj main building
#plenty of drinking water spots
#toilets are in the end near the gate
#do your pics first and then go explore
#opening time 5am (!) be there early!!! Closing time 7.30pm
#you have only 3 hours to explore or you will pay extra fee
#it's not allowed to take videos on camera after arch
#no sticks, no suggests etc
#inside there are a lot of photographers you can buy pics from them, try it, they are really cool and know the spots

Life hacks:
# in the morning go at 5am with online ticket (just entrance) and take pics
#in the morning park is empty especially if you go close to white building and walk around, they have the best spots there for pics from the sides (no need a ticket)
#in the being go around 4pm and you can explore museum and main building, also have your pics with a best light (you will need a full ticket)
#pay for the guys and got your shots and videos quickly (1000-1500)
#morning time you can go for free to the river side it's the same view from there
#sunset time you can go also to the park in the cross river side (!) 300 and enjoy the view

name: Yogesh Ram
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra. It was commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor, Shah Jahan (reigned from 1628 to 1658), to house the tomb of his favourite wife, Mumtaz Mahal. Taj Mahal is a beautiful and most attractive historical place in India. It is a cultural monument of India which was built by the King Shah Jahan in the memory of his wife (Mumtaz Mahal) after her death. It is situated in a big area having lots of greenery in front and side, a river in back side, and lake and lawn.

name: Heera Rawani
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is an iconic white marble mausoleum located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. It was commissioned by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in 1631 to house the tomb of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal. The Taj Mahal stands as a testament to love and is recognized as the jewel of Muslim art in India and one of the universally admired masterpieces of the worlds heritage.

Here are some key facts about the Taj Mahal:
Location It is situated on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra
Construction The construction of the mausoleum was completed in 1648, but the entire complex was completed in 1653
Architecture The Taj Mahal is a prime example of Mughal architecture, combining elements from Indian, Persian, and Islamic influences3.
Complex The 17-hectare complex includes a mosque, a guest house, and is set in formal gardens bounded on three sides by a crenellated wall.
It attracts more than five million visitors a year and was declared a winner of the New 7 Wonders of the World initiative in 2007

The Taj Mahal is not just a historical monument but also a symbol of the rich cultural heritage of India. Its open for visitors except on Fridays, and the visiting hours are 30 minutes before sunrise up to 30 minutes before sunset2. If youre planning a visit, its truly a sight to behold and a marvel of architectural beauty.

Sundays at the Taj Mahal tend to be busier, especially during weekends. However, the crowd situation has improved recently, and it's not as crowded as it used to be. If you prefer a quieter experience, consider visiting between 9 am and 12 pm when it's less crowded.
I recommend buying tickets online in advance. This will save you time and ensure a smoother entry.
There are two value tickets for Indians: one for appreciating the view from the garden area (Rs 50) and another for exploring the tombs from upstairs and inside (Rs 250).
Additionally, there's a higher value ticket (Rs 1300) that allows you to avoid the crowd at the main entry.

name: Roopesh Krishnan
review_text:
The Taj Mahal in Agra is an iconic symbol of love and one of the most magnificent architectural marvels in the world. Built in the 17th century by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal, this UNESCO World Heritage site is often regarded as the epitome of Mughal architecture, blending Persian, Islamic, and Indian styles seamlessly.

The first sight of the Taj Mahal is breathtaking. Its pristine white marble facade glistens under the sun, reflecting in the pool that runs along the front gardens, creating a picture-perfect view.
The symmetry, intricate carvings, and inlay work of semi-precious stones make it a masterpiece of art and craftsmanship. The central dome, flanked by four smaller domes and four slender minarets, creates an awe-inspiring silhouette against the sky.
Inside the mausoleum, the artistry continues with delicate marble lattice screens and intricate pietra dura (stone inlay) work. The serene interior houses the cenotaphs of Mumtaz Mahal and Shah Jahan, surrounded by a peaceful ambiance that invites quiet reflection.
The surrounding gardens, known as the Charbagh, are beautifully landscaped and provide a serene setting to enjoy the beauty of the monument from different angles.

The Yamuna River flowing behind the Taj Mahal adds to its tranquility, especially at sunrise and sunset when the monument takes on different hues, from soft pink to golden and pearly white.The experience of visiting the Taj Mahal is further enriched by knowledgeable guides who provide insights into its history, architecture, and the poignant love story behind its creation. Despite the crowds, the monuments beauty and historical significance make it worth the visit.
Overall, the Taj Mahal is not just a monument but an experience that leaves visitors spellbound by its beauty, historical significance, and the timeless love story it represents. A visit to India would be incomplete without witnessing this wonder of the world.

name: Devesh Gautam
review_text:
Taj Mahal, a symbol of love and beauty! As a local guide, I can tell you:

- Its a stunning white marble mausoleum built by Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
- Changes colors with the day and season.
- Features intricate inlays of precious stones.
- Surrounded by the serene Charbagh garden.
- Best visited early morning or late evening to avoid crowds.

Come, let me show you the Tajs secrets and stories! The Taj Mahal is surrounded by several attractions and landmarks in Agra, India. Here are some nearby places to explore:

1. _Agra Fort_: A majestic red sandstone fort and palace, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

2. _Fatehpur Sikri_: A abandoned city and former Mughal capital, known for its well-preserved architecture.

3. _Itmad-Ud-Daulahs Tomb_: A beautiful marble mausoleum, often called the Baby Taj.

4. _Mehtab Bagh_: A charming garden offering stunning views of the Taj Mahal.

5. _Kinari Bazaar_: A bustling marketplace for shopping and trying local street food.

6. _Akbars Tomb_: The final resting place of Mughal Emperor Akbar.

7. _Mariam-uz-Zamanis Tomb_: The tomb of Akbars wife, Mariam-uz-Zamani.

8. _Chini Ka Rauza_: A beautiful mausoleum decorated with glazed tiles.

9. _Taj Museum_: A museum showcasing artifacts and exhibits related to the Taj Mahal.

10. _Yamuna River_: Take a boat ride or stroll along the riverbank for scenic views.

Explore these nearby attractions to get a deeper understanding of Agras rich history and culture!

How do you even put into words how incredible this monument is in real. No pictures do justice to it at all. A true wonder of the world. Hope the government invests some money to clean the marble facade like it did during the pandemic lockdown.

Some tips for the visit:

a. Indian or not, definitely take a guide, each and every story is worth listening to and you will find a guide at Rs. 400-500

b. For some reason they do not allow mobile phone chargers. They dont allow power banks too. Cell phones are allowed.

c. Buy a foot cover if you are planning to enter the mausoleum. Definitely suggest buying tickets online to avoid the queues.

d. Take your time and dont fall for hawkers around the monument. 99% of the stores around the monument are frauds, they sell fake marble, leather etc. If you need a souvenir, ask for the UP Govt Handloom and gift stores

name: Mohit Chopra
review_text:
What can I say about the Taj which hasnt already been said. Taj is breathtaking. It is cleverly hidden from the view when you approach it either from the West gate or the east gate. It is only when you cross the red stone entry gate (which is beautiful on its own) that it suddenly appears in its full grandeur. One cannot help but take out a camera and click a few dozen pictures.

A couple of tips for first time visitors

1. Try to take the early morning ticket. The morning entry begins 30 minutes before sunrise and it is wonderful to watch the Taj at sunrise

2. Book tickets online. It will save you a lot of time. The tickets cost Rs 45/- for Indians and Rs 1,050/- for a foreigner.

3. If you want to enter the mausoleum its Rs 200/- more per person. Its worth it .

4. The line for foreigners is really really long so try and queue up early.

5. Kids below 15 years both Indian and Foreign, get in free

Weekend

Reservation recommended

name: Shatadeep Banerjee
review_text:
As one of the seven wonders of the world, it receives a lot of tourists even in the off season. Your best bet is to go at sunrise when there are few tourists and you will have ample time to walk all over the grounds and take photos. I went there around 8:30 AM in early October, and it was already crowded.
Enter from the east gate. Thats where most of the hotels, restaurants, shops and guides are.
Do get a registered tour guide, but only outside the ticket counter, not from anywhere else. You can negotiate with them.
If you want to get professional photos inside, each hard copy would cost you INR 100, while each soft copy would cost you INR 80. However, the number of pictures you get taken could easily reach 100, so keep that in mind.
Get the ticket for the mausoleum as well, the design inside is stunning.

name: Dheeraj Kumar Verma
review_text:
A large artisan team was mainly involved in building the Taj Mahal, which included many great artisans. The principal architect and builder was Ustad Ahmed Lahauri, an exemplary Mughal architect who managed the carving and construction structure of the Taj Mahal. He created the unique architectural style of the Taj Mahal and incorporated Mughal culture and architecture as well as traditional Indian styles. Additionally, other artisans were also involved in this work, who were his distinguished assistants and helped in various aspects of the construction. This included a team of residential and non-residential artisans, marble cutting artisans, marble artisans, colorful stitching artisans, carving artisans, lighting artists and jewelers. They worked on marble and stone carving, luminous art, tunneling architecture, silver work, colorful stitching and gold work. The beauty, carvings and intricate craftsmanship of the Taj Mahal symbolize the hard work and skill of the artisans who built this great grandeur.

The full name of Taj Mahal is "Diwan-i-Khas-i-Khusro". This mausoleum was built in memory of Mumtaz Mahal, wife of Mughal emperor Shahjahan. It is also known as "Taj Mahal" in English. "Taj" means "Taj Mahal" and "Mahal" means "mausoleum" or "palace". It means "Taj mausoleum" or "Taj palace". It is one of the major heritage sites of India and is considered as the most amazing architectural decoration of the world.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: vitikrater
review_text:
I was traveling with a guide, which theoretically wouldnt be necessary once you reach the ticket counter. Tomorrow at 5:50 a.m. no queue for tickets, be sure to book the mausoleum (200 rupees more, total 1300 rupees for foreigners) so that you can get to the upper platform in front of the Taj. You get a bottle of water and shoe covers at a second counter. Other drinks and food would not be taken. Entry at the West Gate takes less than a minute at 6 a.m. From 7 a.m. it became noticeably more crowded. Great, spacious facility - no more harassment from salespeople inside. You can find all the paths on your own, the tour is self-explanatory. With lots of pictures, 1.5 hours is sufficient.

review_translated_text: Ich war mit Guide unterwegs, was theoretisch aber nicht notig ware, sobald man den Ticketschalter erreicht. Man bekommt eine Flasche Wasser und Schuhuberzieher an einem zweiten Schalter. Andere Getranke und Essen wurden nicht mitgenommen werden. Einlass am West Gate dauert um 6 Uhr keine Minute. Ab 7 Uhr wurde es deutlich voller. Tolle, weitlaufige Anlage - innen auch keine Belastigung mehr durch Verkaufer. Man findet alle Wege auch alleine, die Fuhrung ist selbsterklarend. Mit vielen Bildern sind 1,5 Std. ausreichend.

name: Y T
review_text:
This tomb was built by Shah Jahan, the fifth emperor of the Mughal Empire, for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal, who died in 1631.

He was trying to build a grave of the same shape as his wifes, whom he loved enough to build such a wonderful grave, on the opposite bank in black marble, but that wish did not come true (;;)

Unparalleled beauty, registered as a World Heritage Site
It is said that Shahjahan built it as a symbol of his eternal love for his beloved wife.
Registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983.
A masterpiece of Indian architecture that combines Mughal culture and Islamic art!

I dont think anyone goes to India and leaves without seeing this place.
You should go!
Baggage checks are strict, so bags larger than A4 size are prohibited, and battery-related items are also prohibited. Shoe covers and a bottle of water are available with the ticket purchase.
There is an additional fee to enter the Taj Mahal.
Visited on
Weekend

name: Chen Yan San
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is truly an amazing architectural marvel! It not only shows the outstanding architectural skills of the Mughal Empire, but is also full of romance and eternal love. The smooth white marble, exquisite gem inlays, and symmetrical design make it one of the most beautiful and memorable monuments in the world. Whether it is the first ray of sunrise or the soft glow under the moonlight, the Taj Mahal always displays extraordinary beauty. It is indeed one of the new seven wonders of the world! It's truly a place worth visiting at least once in a lifetime.

name: Ben
review_text:
Visiting TAJ MAHAL was an experience that transcended all my EXPECTATIONS.

This MAGNIFICENT MONUMENT, with its STUNNING ARCHITECTURE and PERFECT SYMMETRY, is a true TESTIMONY OF ETERNAL LOVE.

As I approached the entrance gates, I was immediately captivated by the IMMACULATE BEAUTY of the white marble that gleams in the sunlight.

Every INTRICATE DETAIL and every WELL MAINTAINED GARDEN around TAJ MAHAL contributes to an atmosphere of PEACE and TRANSIT.

Walking through the corridors and feeling the aura of devotion and respect is a PROFOUND experience.

The view of the YAMUNA RIVER in the background adds a touch of SERENITY to the already perfect setting.

Without a doubt, TAJ MAHAL is one of the WONDERS OF THE WORLD, and its BEAUTY and MEANING leave a lasting mark on the hearts of all who are lucky enough to visit it.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait
review_translated_text:
Visitar o TAJ MAHAL foi uma experiencia que transcendeu todas as minhas EXPECTATIVAS.


Este MONUMENTO MAGNIFICO, com sua ARQUITETURA DESLUMBRANTE e SIMETRIA PERFEITA, e um verdadeiro TESTEMUNHO DE AMOR eterno.


Ao me aproximar dos portoes de entrada, fui imediatamente cativado pela BELEZA IMACULADA do marmore branco que resplandece sob a luz do sol.


Cada DETALHE INTRICADO e cada JARDIM BEM CUIDADO ao redor do TAJ MAHAL contribuem para uma atmosfera de PAZ e TRANSITO.


Caminhar pelos corredores e sentir a aura de devocao e respeito e uma experiencia PROFUNDA.


A vista do RIO YAMUNA ao fundo adiciona um toque de SERENIDADE ao cenario ja perfeito.


Sem duvida, o TAJ MAHAL e uma das MARAVILHAS DO MUNDO, e sua BELEZA e SIGNIFICADO deixam uma marca duradoura no coracao de todos que tem a sorte de visita-lo.

name: Agrippina Bykow
review_text:
When fame is justified: the Taj has a unique magic. We entered through the east gate. Monday in August at 9 in the morning: few people, we didnt have any queues inside or outside. You have to buy the ticket in the adjacent street and then enter. Please, leave lighters and tobacco in the cloakroom which will make you come back: scrupulous checks by the military at the entrance! It is also worth buying the ticket to enter the mausoleum (it is not possible to take photos inside and you enter barefoot or with shoe covers). The visit can be done calmly in two hours. If you stay inside for more than three hours you have to pay an exit penalty.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No
review_translated_text: Quando la fama e giustificata: i Taj e di una magia unica. Siamo entrati dalleast gate. Lunedi di agosto alle 9 di mattina: poca gente, non abbiamo fatto nessun fila ne dentro ne fuori. Bisogna fare il biglietto nella strada adiacente e poi entrare. Mi raccomando, lasciate accendini e tabacco al guardaroba che vi faranno tornare indietro: controlli scrupolosi dei militari allingresso! Vale la pena comprare anche il biglietto per lingresso al mausoleo (allinterno non e possibile fare foto e si entra scalzi o con il para scarpe). La visita si puo fare con calma in due ore. Se si sta allinterno piu di tre ore bisogna pagare una penale in uscita.

name: Jesus
review_text:
One of the 7 wonders of the world  well deserves 5 stars!  It all depends on the expectations you have about things, but I was very impressed by this marble mausoleum with a lot of meticulously cared for details. I visited it at dawn and the feeling was incredible! The sun was caressing the marble and the light projected was perfect! I bought the ticket at the time without any problem and thats it! Keep in mind that there are a lot of things that you cannot bring inside the venue, such as a selfie stick , pens, notebooks, books... The experience was incredible!

Weekday

Wait time

Reservation recommended

review_translated_text: Una de las 7 maravillas del mundo  bien merece 5 estrellas!  Todo depende de las expectativas que tengas en las cosas pero a mi me impresiono mucho este mausoleo de marmol con un monton de detalles minuciosamente cuidados. Lo visite al amanecer y la sensacion fue increible! El sol iba acariciando el marmol y la luz proyectada era perfecta! La entrada la compre en el momento sin ningun problema y eso si! Ten en cuenta que hay un monton de cosas que no puedes llevar dentro del recinto, como palo selfie , boligrafos, libretas, libros... La experiencia fue increible!

name: Diego Perez Morales
review_text:
The monument is impressive and the gardens are beautiful, all the marble inlay and carving work is exquisite. Inside there are guides that show you the transparency of the embedded semi-precious stones and the translucency of the Marble. When I went, the Mosque could not be visited since it was under restoration. It is recommended to go early due to the heat and the large influx of people around midday. There is nothing to eat or buy anything. You can only enter with water

review_translated_text: El monumento es impresionante y los jardines bellisimos, todo el trabajo de incrustaciones y tallado de Marmol es exquisito. Cuando fui, la Mezquita no se podia visitar ya que se encontraba en restauracion. Se recomienda ir bien temprano por los calores y la gran afluencia de gente cercana al mediodia. name: Kei
review_text:
I drove from Delhi on a tour I had booked in advance.

The English speaking tour guide told me that the entrance ticket was 3000 rupees, but after checking the information online in advance, I told him that it wouldnt cost that much and I would buy it myself at the ticket office.

If I bought it myself, it would have cost 1100 rupees.
Instead, I was told that there was an additional fee to go inside the Taj Mahal, so I didnt go in, but when I saw it later on Youtube, it didnt seem like there was a separate fee. Even after leaving India, I still dont understand.

The Taj Mahal, one of the seven most mysterious wonders of the world, is a must-visit spot.

name: PARAMJEET SINGH KALSI
review_text:
We got down in the car parking at the West gate of Taj Mahal, where some e-rickshaw pullers surrounded us and said that they will charge  160 from four people for going to the gate and visiting Meena Bazaar.
, I told my friends that we should first ride on the R-cart of the tourist department, but we were trapped in the sweet language of the e-rickshaw drivers. That e-rickshaw driver took us from the West Gate back to the Main Road and then through the narrow streets and dropped us at the East Gate. During this entire journey, mine and my friends knees collided with other e-rickshaws many times. Had they collided, we would have had to spend a few days in the hospital and it is not known how long we would be able to walk properly.
My request to everyone is that the best way to go to Taj Mahal is from the West Gate and to go inside from the parking here, use the e-cart of the tourist department which has about 12 seats. And whenever you travel anywhere by e-rickshaw etc., do not take your feet out of the e-rickshaw at all. Otherwise any serious accident can happen to you. And if you go by purchasing the ticket online, it will be even better, you will not have to stand in line for the ticket.
Jai Hind Jai Bharat

Weekend

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended

name: CR SIYAG
review_text:
Taj Mahal needs no introduction. This monument is included in the list of seven wonders of the world. No wonder people flock to it throughout the year to witness the grandeur of its beauty. This monument is located in the city of Agra, Uttar Pradesh in India. In other words, the Taj Mahal symbolizes the excellence of Mughal architecture.

essay on Taj Mahal

Taj Mahal is one of the main reasons why India is famous. Many people associate India with the Taj Mahal. However, for me, more than the spectacular architecture, it is the story behind it that fascinates me the most. This magnificent beauty stands strong as a symbol of a husbands love for his wife. Furthermore, it reminds us of the power of love and how it can set an example for future generations.

Taj Maha - Symbol of Love
The famous Taj Mahal was brought to life from the vision of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan. He built this memorial for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal after her death.

To honor the memory of his beloved wife, Shah Jahan ordered the finest artisans from around the world to create it. He wanted to create something that had never been created for anyone before. The king wanted to give his last gift to his wife whom he loved very much.

name: LUCKY TECH. COM
review_text:
The Taj Mahal (Urdu: tj mHl) is a World Heritage mausoleum located in the city of Agra in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India, and one of the 7 Wonders of the World. It was built in the 17th century by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.[1]

Duration: 10 minutes and 7 seconds.10:07
Taj Mahal incomparable heritage
Mughal architecture was at its peak during the time of Mughal emperor Shahjahan, Taj Mahal is the most famous example of that architecture. Taj Mahal is an excellent example of Mughal architecture. Its architectural style is a unique fusion of elements from Persian, Ottoman, Indian and Islamic architecture. In 1983, the Taj Mahal became a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along with this, it was described as one of the most universally praised human creations of world heritage. Taj Mahal has also been declared the gem of Islamic art of India. Unlike the commonly seen buildings which are covered with large sheets of marble blocks, its white dome and tiles are covered [2] with marble in shape. The tomb built in the center shows the combination of beauty in its architectural superiority. The special thing about the structure of the Taj Mahal building group is that it is completely symmetrical. Its construction was completed around 1648. [1] Ustad Ahmed Lahauri is often considered its chief designer. [3] It took about 22 years to construct the Taj Mahal.

architecture
Main article: Origins and architecture of Taj Mahal
mausoleum

Map of floor plan of Taj Mahal
The centerpiece of the Taj Mahal is the white marble mausoleum built on a square foundation. It is a symmetrical building, which has an iwan i.e. a very large curved (arch-shaped) door. A large dome adorns the top of this building. Like most Mughal tombs, its basic components are of Persian origin.

basic premise
Its basic foundation is a huge multi-chambered structure. This main chamber is cubic, each side of which is 55 meters (see: floor map, right). On the long sides is a massive pishtaq, or arched-roofed chamber gate. It is connected to the arched balcony above.

main arch
On either side of the main arch, two additional pishtaqs are built on either side, one above the other. In the same style, two pishtaqs (one above the other) are built on all four sides of the chamber. This structure is completely symmetrical on each side of the building, which makes the building an octagon rather than a square, but since the four corner sides are much shorter than the other four sides, it would be appropriate to call it square. The four towers around the tomb seem to frame the view of the building, at the four corners of the original base post. The main chamber contains the fake tombs of Mumtaz Mahal and Shahjahan. These are very decorated, and their original is situated on the lower floor.

Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

taajmhl atulniiy dhrohr

mugl smraatt shaahjhaaN ke smy meN mugl vaastuklaa apne crm shikhr pr thii, taajmhl un sbhii vaastuklaaoN ke udaahrnn meN srvprsiddh hai /  taajmhl mug'l vaastuklaa kaa utkRsstt nmuunaa hai /  iskii vaastu shailii ph'aarsii, turk, bhaartiiy aur islaamii vaastuklaa ke ghttkoN kaa anokhaa smmiln hai /  sn 1983 meN, taajmhl yunesko vishv dhrohr sthl bnaa /  iske saath hii ise vishv dhrohr ke srvtr prshNsaa paane vaalii, atyuttm maanvii kRtiyoN meN se ek btaayaa gyaa /  taajmhl ko bhaart kii islaamii klaa kaa rtn bhii ghossit kiyaa gyaa hai /  saadhaarnntyaa dekhe gye sNgmrmr kii silliyoN kii bddii- bddii prto se ddhNk kr bnaaii gii imaartoN kii trh n bnaakr iskaa shvet gumbd evN ttaail aakaar meN sNgmrmr se[2] ddhNkaa hai /  kendr meN bnaa mkbraa apnii vaastu shresstthtaa meN saundry ke sNyojn kaa pricy dete haiN /  taajmhl imaart smuuh kii sNrcnaa kii khaas baat hai, ki yh puurnntyaa smmitiiy hai /  iskaa nirmaann sn 1648 ke lgbhg puurnn huaa thaa / [1] ustaad ahmd laahaurii ko praayH iskaa prdhaan ruupaaNknkrtaa maanaa jaataa hai / [3] taajmhl ke nirmaann meN lgbhg 22 vrssoN kaa smy lgaa / 


vaastu klaa

mukhy lekh: taajmhl ke muul evN vaastu

mk'braa


taajmhl ke phrsh/tl kii yojnaa kaa maancitr

taaj mhl kaa kendr biNdu hai, ek vrgaakaar niiNv aadhaar pr bnaa shvet sNgmrmr kaa mk'braa /  yh ek smmitiiy imaart hai, jismeN ek iivaan yaani atiiv vishaal vkraakaar (mehraab ruupii) dvaar hai /  is imaart ke uupr ek vRht gumbd sushobhit hai /  adhiktr mug'l mk'broN jaise, iske muul avyv ph'aarsii udgm se haiN /

iskaa muul-aadhaar ek vishaal bhu-kkssiiy sNrcnaa hai /  yh prdhaan kkss ghnaakaar hai, jiskaa prtyek kinaaraa 55 miittr hai (dekheN: tl maancitr, daaNye) /  lmbe kinaaroN pr ek bhaarii-bhrkm pishtaak, yaa mehraabaakaar cht vaale kkss dvaar haiN /  yh uupr bne mehraab vaale chjje se smmilit hai / 


mukhy mehraab

mukhy mehraab ke donoN or,ek ke uupr duusraa shailiimeN, donoN or do-do atirikt pishtaak' bne haiN /  isii shailii meN, kkss ke caaroN kinaaroN pr do-do pishtaak (ek ke uupr duusraa) bne haiN /  yh rcnaa imaart ke prtyek or puurnntyaa smmitiiy hai, jo ki is imaart ko vrg ke bjaay assttkonn bnaatii hai, prNtu kone ke caaroN bhujaaeN baakii caar kinaaroN se kaaphii chottii hone ke kaarnn, ise vrgaakaar khnaa hii ucit hogaa /  mkbre ke caaroN or caar miinaareN muul aadhaar caukii ke caaroN konoN meN, imaart ke dRshy ko ek caukhtte meN baaNdhtii prtiit hotii haiN /  mukhy kkss meN mumtaaj mhl evN shaahjhaaN kii nklii kbreN haiN /  ye khuub alNkRt haiN, evN inkii asl nicle tl pr sthit hai /

name: yuri paris324
review_text:
A world heritage site that you must visit at least once. Ive always wanted to go to the Taj Mahal. He finally went. I went early in the morning, so it was beautifully illuminated by the morning sun. The mausoleum is huge and beautiful, and it also has a melancholy feel to it. The whiteness of marble rather than chalk, and the beauty of the symmetry were also wonderful. There is a strict inventory check to enter. You can get water inside. There is a replica grave inside the mausoleum, so photos are not allowed. But since it is a mausoleum, there is only a grave. The Taj Mahal has an amazing exterior that somehow reminded me of Mont Saint Michel in France. The silhouette is also beautiful. My advice is to go during the dry season. In the summer it would be too hot, and in the rainy season it would be cloudy and difficult to see. It seems best to go when its not raining or hot. If its not sunny, the beauty may be halved.

You cant even take photos inside the mausoleum, even with your phone, but the carved fence is worth a look. I advise you to ask the attendant to highlight the marble and stone inlay (he does this with a flashlight) - an unforgettable impression of translucent natural stones.

name: Gianfranco Marchetti
review_text:
Rightly considered one of the seven wonders of the world, the mausoleum presents itself in its majesty from the entrance to the gardens in front. Once you get close, beyond its grandeur you can admire the marble inlay in the various geometric shapes. Inside there are faithful reproductions of the two tombs of the emperor who had it built for his beloved third wife who is buried in the tomb next to him. Truly a work from which it is difficult to look away when the visit is over and you have to move away.

review_translated_text: Giustamente considerato una delle sette meraviglie del mondo il mausoleo si presenta nella sua maestosita fin dallaccesso ai giardini antistanti. Giunti in prossimita oltre la sua imponenza si ammira lintarsio del marmo nelle svariate forme geometriche. Allinterno si trovano le fedeli riproduzioni delle due tombe dellimperatore che lo fece costruire per la sua amatissima terza moglie che e sepolta nella tomba di fianco a lui. Davvero un opera da cui si fa fatica a distogliere lo sguardo quando finita la visita ci si deve allontanare.

name: im J (Ji Mu)
review_text:
Today I finally set foot in one of the seven wonders of the world: the Taj Mahal. This spectacular building no longer only exists on the Internet and TV screens. Now it is right in front of me, causing an indescribable feeling. moved.

The white marble sparkles in the sun, like a poem precipitated by time. Each stone brick carries an ancient story, delicate and moving.

There is a touching history behind this magnificent building. It was built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his late wife. The story that was once told on the Internet, TV and textbooks can now be experienced in front of my eyes. .

Appreciating the beauty of this architectural craftsmanship feels like a journey through time. The ancient times and the present intertwine into a beautiful resonance, which makes me deeply intoxicated in the embrace of history.

Everyone must come and take a look if you have the opportunity.

name: Corey Squarzoni
review_text:
The most beautiful place seen during my trip to Northern India.
This mausoleum is a mix of perfection and symmetry, it is no coincidence that it is one of the seven wonders of the modern world.
I was lucky enough to visit it twice in the space of three days. The first time on August 15th was free (during the Indian Independence Day period many monuments in India are free, but also very crowded) and there were a lot of people and the Taj could not be visited inside, the next time on dawn and.. what a show! I highly recommend going there at these hours, the colors and lights make everything even more spectacular. Even inside you will be enchanted by the beauty and perfection.
We didnt find much queue at the ticket counter, also because foreigners have a dedicated queue. Entry costs 1300 INR, perhaps the most expensive attraction entry in northern India, but worth it. Absolutely.
You can enter from the east and west entrances, while only exit is permitted in the south. They are all well signposted.
Be careful, you cant take photos by jumping (strange Indian rules).
review_translated_text:
Il posto piu bello visto durante il mio viaggio in India del Nord.

Questo mausoleo e un mix di perfezione e simmetria, non a caso e una delle sette meraviglie del mondo moderno.

Ho avuto la fortuna di visitarlo due volte nellarco di tre giorni. La prima volta il 15 agosto gratis (durante il periodo della festa dellindipendenza Indiana molti monumenti in India sono gratis, ma anche molto affollati) e cera molta gente ed il Taj non si poteva visitare allinterno, la volta successiva allalba e.. che spettacolo! Consiglio vivamente di andarci a queste ore, colori e luci rendono il tutto ancora piu spettacolare. Anche allinterno verrete ammaliati dalla bellezza e dalla perfezione.

Non abbiamo trovato molta coda al ticket counter, anche perche gli stranieri hanno una fila dedicata. Lingresso costa 1300 INR, forse lingresso per unattrazione piu caro nellindia nel nord, ma ne vale la pena. Assolutamente.

Si puo entrare dallentrata est e ovest, mentre a sud e permessa solo luscita. Sono tutte ben segnalate.

Attenzione, non si possono fare le foto saltando (strane regole indiane).

name: Kartikeya Pratap Singh
review_text:
Taj Mahal is a very famous and unique grand building of India, which is located in the city of Agra. It was built as a love symbol by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

The Taj Mahal is an important site of Indian and world heritage whose beauty, graceful architecture, and love story inspire people across the world. Tourists from all over the world visit it to enjoy its architecture and liveliness.

The construction of Taj Mahal started in 1631 AD and was completed in 1653 AD. A team of approximately 20,000 workers was created to make it operational. Its main objective was to build an ideal mausoleum in memory of the wife of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

The Taj Mahal is characterized by its Makarna style architecture, its intricate carvings, and transparent marble lattices, which make it a unique attraction. Its beautiful construction and its liveliness have included it among the unique buildings of the world.

Visiting the Taj Mahal is a unique experience that takes you through Indian cultural and historical heritage as well as a unique story of love. Here you can get detailed information about Taj Mahal and enjoy its unique beauty.
Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Nguyen Nhan
review_text:
Unique architectural works of humanity in general and of India in particular.
The buildings architecture is designed to be absolutely symmetrical in both location and aesthetics. The temples construction materials were all made of stone, with the contributions of more than 22,000 people and 4,000 elephants, and construction lasted 3 decades.
Currently, inside the temple, there are two mausoleums of the king and queen. The temples domed roof makes the sound echo like in a movie theater.
The ticket price to ride the tram and enter the gate is 1,300 rupees, equivalent to 390,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Davide Cavadini Pilot
review_text: The Taj Mahal which literally translated means the crown palace or the crown of the palace is the name given to a stupendous construction located in the Indian town of Agra whose origins are very uncertain according to tradition the work was commissioned by the Indian emperor Shah Jahan to fulfill one of the promises made to his wife when he was still alive, the works which began in 1632 were completed only in 1654 and employed the work of many craftsmen, some of whom came from Europe and even one from Italy named Geronimo Veroneo who used different materials from all over India and Asia. In total there are 28 different types of precious and semi-precious stones set in the white marble as a decorative motif for the entire structure.
review_translated_text: Il Taj Mahal che letteralmente tradotto significa "il palazzo della corona" o "la corona del palazzo"e il nome dato ad una stupenda costruzione situata nella cittadina indiana di Agra le cui origini sono molto incerte secondo la tradizione l'opera sarebbe stata voluta dall'imperatore indiano Shah Jahan per realizzare una delle promesse fatta alla moglie quando era ancora in vita i lavori che ebbero inizio nel 1632 si conclusero solo nel 1654 ed impiegarono il lavoro di tantissimi artigiani alcuni dei quali provenienti dall'Europa e addirittura uno dall'Italia di nome Geronimo Veroneo che si servirono di diversi materiali provenienti da ogni parte dell'India e dell'Asia In totale si contano 28 diversi tipi di pietre preziose e semi preziose incastonate nel marmo bianco come motivo decorativo dell'intera struttura.

It is a mausoleum but truly extraordinary. There is no paint, everything is white marble with inlaid stones which give shine.
I agree with other comments which indicate that, although we know the Taj Mahal by name and photo, nothing beats arriving through the main gate, walking a little and discovering this monument. It looks like a 3D photograph in suspense!
It's truly incredible!

review_translated_text:
Splendide temple de l'amour. Quand on connait l'histoire et qu'on voit cette merveille d'architecture, on se dit que l'amour existe !

C'est un mausolee mais vraiment extraordinaire. Il n'y a pas de peinture tout est en marbre blanc avec des pierres incrustees qui donne de la brillance.

Je rejoins d'autres commentaires qui indiquent que, bien qu'on connaisse le Taj Mahal de nom et en photo, rien de vaut l'arrivee par la grande porte, marcher un peu et decouvrir ce monument. On dirait une photographie en 3D en suspens !

C'est vraiment incroyable !

name: Cocktaill Molotovv
review_text: It is a must, the place you must necessarily visit in India. This monument and the gardens surrounding it are simply splendid. It must be recognized that it would never have seen the light of day without the mastery and know-how of the stonecutters, decorators, calligraphers and Persian engineers who were mobilized (or enslaved) to build it.

name: Eno Elbika M
review_text: Tak Mahal is a magnificent mausoleum located in Agra, India. Built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century as a tribute to his wife, Mumtaz Mahal, this monument is a prime example of Mughal architecture. Tak Mahal is famous for its white dome made of marble, as well as intricate decorations that include carvings and gemstones. The complex consists of manicured gardens, a reflecting pool, and a mosque. Tak Mahal is recognized as one of the wonders of the world and a symbol of eternal love, attracting millions of visitors every year. Its symmetrical architectural beauty and elegant design reflect the refinement of art and building techniques of that time.
review_translated_text: Tak Mahal adalah sebuah mausoleum megah yang terletak di Agra, India. Dibangun oleh Kaisar Mughal Shah Jahan pada abad ke-17 sebagai penghormatan untuk istrinya, Mumtaz Mahal, monumen ini adalah contoh utama arsitektur Mughal. Tak Mahal terkenal dengan kubah putihnya yang terbuat dari marmer, serta dekorasi rumit yang mencakup ukiran dan batu permata. Kompleks ini terdiri dari taman-taman terawat, kolam refleksi, dan masjid. Tak Mahal diakui sebagai salah satu keajaiban dunia dan simbol cinta abadi, menarik jutaan pengunjung setiap tahun. Kecantikan arsitekturnya yang simetris dan desainnya yang elegan mencerminkan kehalusan seni dan teknik bangunan pada masa itu.

name: Pettyfer410
review_text:
Last fall, I went there early in the morning on a tour with a certain company H. As you can see in the photos and videos, it is a very beautiful place, and even now, even after all this time, I am glad I visited.
We had planned to go in casual clothes, but the night before we ended up running a tour guide (there were no other tour participants other than ourselves, so it was essentially a private tour), so both my husband and I wore rented costumes. I regret it a lot. Women are allowed to wear sarees, but men are strongly advised not to wear costumes. 95% of tourists are in casual clothes, so its easy to see.
There was a baggage check immediately after entering the venue, so it was a good idea to keep the minimum amount of luggage.
You can get shoe covers and bottled water a little further away from the entrance.
It was a weekday according to the Japanese calendar, but it was before Duwali, and many people from India were there.
Since it was a tour, I drove there from Delhi. It took about 4 hours one way at high speed, but there were several service areas along the way, so I was able to travel without worrying too much about bathroom breaks.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
10-30 min

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Belen JB
review_text:
It totally deserves to be considered one of the 7 wonders of the world.
It is truly amazing to see it up close and you can take some spectacular photos. Lets not forget that it is a tomb so remember that you must have respect and you cannot take photos inside.
Things to keep in mind:
- It is inside a park and to access it you have to walk for a while. There are little trains available but you have to pay. The walk is pleasant and safe but it is about 10 minutes on foot.
- You have to visit it early in the morning around 6/7 ideally. The reason is the extreme heat, especially because the white marble reflects the sun and in summer it can reach 47-50 degrees near the building.
- You are not allowed to bring anything, cigarettes, food, etc. will be confiscated. The best thing is to take your water bottle and cell phone for photos and thats it.
- Be careful with street vendors when you go out!! They are everywhere and there are many people attentive to your wallet.
- It is necessary to pay entry. You can buy it online beforehand to avoid lines.

100% recommended!!
review_translated_text:
Merece totalmente ser considerada una de las 7 maravillas del mundo.

Es una autentica pasada verla de cerca y se pueden hacer unas fotos espectaculares. No olvidemos que es una tumba asi que recordar que hay que tener respeto y no se pueden hacer fotos dentro.

Cosas a tener en cuenta:

- Esta dentro de un parque y para acceder hay que andar un rato. Hay trenecitos disponibles pero hay que pagar. El paseo es agradable y seguro pero son unos 10 minutos a pie.

- Hay que visitarlo por la manana pronto sobre las 6/7 idealmente. El motivo es el calor extremo, sobre todo porque el marmol blanco refleja el sol y en verano se puede llegar a los 47-50 grados cerca del edificio.

- No se permite llevar nada, los cigarros, comida, etc te los requisaran. Lo mejor es llevarte tu botella de agua y movil para fotos y ya.

- Cuidado con los vendedores ambulantes cuando sales!! Estan por todos y hay mucha gente atenta a tu cartera.

- Es necesario pagar entrada. Puedes comprarla online previamente para evitar colas.


100% recomendable!!

review_text:
If you visit Into, this is a place you should visit at least once.
To be honest, until I go there, when I think of India, I think of the Taj Mahal. I wasnt too keen on it, but after going there I changed my mind.
It was a place I had to go to at least once.

Although there are some negative aspects such as the high entrance fee and the fact that it is crowded, I think it is wonderful that so many ruins remain in such beautiful condition.

Is marble melting due to acid rain these days? Will it hurt? Apparently, there are restrictions on the movement of private cars in the surrounding area.
However, I guess its because of India that I feel like Im not talking about something like this around the Taj Mahal.

name: electra lite
review_text:
A superb, well-maintained monument. I have been there several times, in summer the fountains are often turned off.
Lots of people, but the guards ensure that the visits run smoothly for tourists.
Entrance is more expensive for tourists than for locals, but the monument is definitely worth the detour.

From New Delhi, the easiest way is to take a taxi, or a shared taxi.

Some other magnificent monuments are in the surrounding area so dont hesitate to go see them in addition to the Taj Mahal.
review_translated_text:

Beaucoup de monde, mais les gardes veillent au bon deroulement des visites pour les touristes.

Lentree est plus chere pour les touristes que pour les locaux, mais le monument en vaut vraiment le detour.


Depuis New Delhi, le plus simple est de prendre un Taxi, ou un taxi partage.


Quelques autres monuments magnifiques sont dans les alentours alors nhesitez pas a aller les voir en plus du Taj Mahal.

name: Rajkumar Gothi
review_text:
The Seventh Wonder of the World ......Taj Mahal mainly known for its architecture and design.....
The Taj Mahal (Crown of the Palace) is an white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in the Indian city of Agra Uttar Pradesh. It was commissioned in 1631 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (r. 1628-1658). to house the tomb of his favorite wife, Mumtaz Mahal; it also houses the tomb of Shah Jahan himself. The tomb is the centerpiece of a 17-hectare (42-acre) complex, which includes a mosque and a guest house, and is set in formal gardens bounded on three sides by a crenellated wall.
Taj Mahal. Crown of the Palace) is a white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the Yamuna River in the Indian city of Agra, Uttar Pradesh. It was built in 1631 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (r. 1628-1658) to house the tomb of his favorite wife, Mumtaz Mahal; It also houses the tomb of Shahjahan himself. The mausoleum is the centerpiece of a 17-hectare (42-acre) complex, which includes a mosque and a guest house, and is set in formal gardens, surrounded on three sides by a retaining wall.

name: Muhammad Abdur Rahim
review_text:
The Taj Mahal (Hindi: ttaaj mhl, Urdu: taaj mhl) is a royal mausoleum located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan built this magnificent monument in memory of his wife Arjumand Banu Begum, also known as Mumtaz Mahal. The construction of the monument started in 1632 AD and was completed around 1653 AD.
The Taj Mahal (sometimes simply called the Taj) is considered a striking example of Mughal architecture, combining Persian, Turkish, Indian and Islamic architecture. Although the white marble domed royal mausoleum is the most admired, the Taj Mahal is actually a complex monolithic structure as a whole. It was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983. The Taj Mahal is one of the Seventh Wonders of the World. It was then called the Universally Acclaimed Masterpiece of World Heritage.

name: sudhir kumar
review_text:
This historical building was built by Mughal emperor Shahjahan in the memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Its construction lasted 22 years from 1632 to 1653. Its architect was Ustad Ahmed Lahori. This mausoleum made of white marble has been included in the UNESCO World Heritage list since 1983. It is also included in the list of seven wonders of the world. Most of the foreign tourists come to India to see it. This is considered a sign of love. Its carvings and decoration of precious colored stones are worth seeing. The fountain and flower garden in front of the main building further enhances its beauty. This is the best example of Mughal architecture.
It is being adversely affected due to the polluted air of factories in Agra. Therefore, we all should pay special attention to its conservation.

Weekday

review_text: Without a doubt the most beautiful construction I have ever seen. Compared to this, the Eiffel Tower is a mass of iron that could be thrown into the Seine. The bad things are that the entrance price for being a tourist is like 20 times more expensive than the normal one, 1100r (approximately EU14). But it is worth it without a doubt. It also highlights how well taken care of everything is and what they invest in this place with the poverty in the streets of Agra.

name: Chia-Yin Hwang
review_text: It's so beautiful that it's hard to describe such a perfect creation in words. It's a must-see attraction in India! The security check is very strict. Tour buses can only park on the outside. You have to change to a minibus and then walk in. When taking the minibus, you have to negotiate the price and dont be fooled by those selling itineraries on the roadside. They often deceive tourists. After entering the park, there is a perfectly symmetrical pool garden. The reflection of the Taj Mahal is reflected in the pool, which is a pleasure on the way to the mausoleum. You cant image how beautiful Taj Mahal can be until you seen it. Dont miss it when you come to India. You will be surprised by how great it is. The security check is very strict. Buses can only park outside and tourists need to transport to small buses. Dont trust those people who say they sell cheap one day pass. Just buy the ticket on counters.

name: Miroslaw Siemieniuk
review_text:
The Taj Mahal was built in Agra, a city on the Yamuna River in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. Agra is located approximately 200 kilometers from Delhi - the former capital of India. It is one of the highlights of many trips abroad.
The Taj Mahal building complex consists of the main mausoleum with a large onion-shaped dome, characteristic of Islamic art, and a huge gate, symbolizing the gate to Paradise. It is set on a plinth, in the corners of which there are four minarets - towers from which the muezzin calls the faithful to prayer. Two identical red stone mosques stand on either side. The complex is complemented by standard elements of this type of buildings: water channels and a landscaped garden divided into four parts. The structure of the Persian garden in front of the mausoleum imitates the Muslim image of paradise, which is very similar to its Christian counterpart.
review_translated_text:
Tadz Mahal zostal wzniesiony w Agrze, miescie nad rzeka Jamuna, w indyjskim stanie Uttar Pradesh. Agra lezy w odleglosci okolo 200 kilometrow od Delhi - dawnej stolicy Indii. Jest to jeden z glownych punktow wielu wycieczek zagranicznych.

Kompleks budowlany Tadz Mahal sklada sie z glownego mauzoleum z wielka kopula, w ksztalcie cebuli, charakterystyczna dla sztuki islamu i olbrzymia brama, symbolizujaca wrota do Raju. Jest ona osadzona na plincie, w ktorej rogach stoja cztery minarety - wieze, z ktorych muezin nawoluje wiernych do modlitwy. Po bokach stoja dwa identyczne meczety z czerwonego kamienia. Uzupelnieniem kompleksu sa standardowe elementy tego typu budowli: kanaly wodne oraz podzielony na cztery czesci ogrod krajobrazowy. Konstrukcja ogrodu perskiego przed mauzoleum imituje muzulmanskie wyobrazenie raju, ktore cechuje duze podobienstwo do jego chrzescijanskiego odpowiednika.

name: Brian C.
review_text:
Its the most popular see sight in India, and the building is so amazing! I suggest visit here early in the morning, but the entrance tickets about 5:30am. Because its the time not so many people and not so hot, the most important is you can take great photos with Taj Mahal!

In the past, I only saw the Taj Mahal from photos, but after actually visiting it, I found it to be much more spectacular than I imagined. It took my breath away to admire the beauty. It is recommended to buy tickets at the ticket office at 5:30 in the morning and then queue up. At this time There are at least few people and it's not too hot, so it's an ideal time to take photos.

name: Timo Daedrich
review_text:
Yes, this place is extremely hyped. Yes, it is usually full. Yes, there are a lot of annoying scammers on the site.
Nevertheless, you MUST see the Taj Mahal! Words cannot describe how impressive this building and surrounding grounds are. You have an absolute wow moment when you walk through the gate and get your first glimpse of the Taj Mahal.
It really looks like a painting, you cant get enough of it. Depending on the weather and lighting conditions, the atmosphere can also be very different.
The inside is also really worth it, up close the building looks even more powerful.
During the week, thanks to the slow pace of tourism, it is currently quite empty, so you can get in without queuing and walk around the facility without being jostled. The scammers also seem to have reduced significantly due to Covid.
Therefore I can only repeat, the visit is a MUST!
review_translated_text:
Ja, dieser Ort wird extrem gehyped. Ja, es ist meistens voll. Ja, es gibt viele nervige Scammer auf der Anlage.

Trotzdem MUSS man das Taj Mahal gesehen haben! Worte konnen nicht beschreiben, wie beeindruckend dieses Gebaude und die umgebende Anlage sind. Es uberkommt einen ein absoluter Wow-Moment, wenn man das Tor durchschreitet und man den ersten Blick auf das Taj Mahal werfen kann.

Es sieht wirklich aus wie gemalt, man kann sich uberhaupt nicht satt gucken. Je nach Wetter und Lichtverhaltnissen kann die Atmosphare auch sehr unterschiedlich sein.

Auch das innere lohnt sich wirklich, von nahem wirkt das Gebaude nochmal viel machtiger.

Unter der Woche ist es dank des nur langsam ablaufenden Tourismus aktuell recht leer, sodass man ohne anstehen reinkommt und ohne drangeln uber die Anlage laufen kann. Auch die Scammer scheinen sich durch Covid deutlich reduziert zu haben.

Daher kann ich nur wiederholen, der Besuch ist ein MUSS!

review_text: One of the wonders of the world is the Taj Mahal in the city of Agra, India. To enter this place you have to queue starting at 04.00 in the morning. Make sure you dont bring too many items because the inspection is quite strict and detailed.

The outer walls of the Taj Mahal are white because they are polished, but the dome is a little yellow because it cannot be polished.I wonder if they will polish it? said the guide.
Main topic. Its big, its beautiful. Although the buildings such as Borobudur are large, their beauty is different.
The picture written on it is not a drawing, but a picture with jewels embedded in it.
Even if you are drawn to the beauty of the Taj Mahal in photos, there are many places that are disappointing when you see it in person, but you should definitely see the Taj Mahal in person.
The weather is also great.
From now on, the number of visitors will increase rapidly, so please take every precaution to preserve it.

name: Giacomo Tanzella
review_text:
They should add a star just for this place.
Recommendations:
Go at dawn and you will meet many fewer people. Ticket to be purchased on the official website. You can stay up to three hours inside the complex

name: Lucinda Furci
review_text:
A once in a lifetime experience. I expected it to be beautiful but when you go there it is an experience that moves you. I recommend seeing it with a guide or having it explained well beforehand because it makes the experience 10 times more powerful.

The incredible things are all the inlays made of semi-precious stones inserted into the white marble and the perfect symmetry from all points of view both in the internal architecture and in the entire complex including the gardens, walls and buildings around.

The romantic story behind it is also incredible. It is often told as the story of a king with a beautiful young wife whom he lost at a young age and built a mausoleum for her. In reality it is the story of two boys who have loved each other since their youth and spent almost twenty years together, sharing everything, even the war missions in which the queen accompanied the king.
Furthermore, if it is possible, it is better to see it not in summer because the temperature reaches almost 50deg.
review_translated_text:
Un'esperienza unica nella vita. Mi aspettavo che fosse bello ma quando ci vai e un'esperienza che ti emoziona. Consiglio di vederlo con una guida o farselo spiegare bene prima perche rende l'esperienza 10 volte piu potente.


Le cose incredibili sono tutti gli intarsi fatti di pietre dure inserite nel marmo bianco e la simmetria perfetta da tutti punti di vista sia nell'architettura interna che in tutto il complesso compresi i giardini, le mura e gli edifici intorno.


E incredibile anche la storia romantica che ci sta dietro. Viene spesso raccontata come la storia di un re con una bella giovane moglie che ha perso in giovane eta e le ha costruito mausoleo. In realta e la storia di due ragazzi che si sono amati fin dalla gioventu e hanno passato quasi vent'anni insieme, condividendo tutto, anche le missioni in guerra in cui la regina accompagnava il re.

Inoltre se e possibile e meglio vederlo non d'estate perche arriva la temperatura fino a quasi 50deg.

review_text: Its important to go early in the morning if you dont want to catch a lot of people and take photos without company. Our visit started at 5:30 in the morning. Its 1100 rupees per person for tourists but its well worth the money. The grandeur of the monument, but at the same time the detail in detail, is truly impressive. Its all made of marble with precious stones embedded. The two mosques that accompany the main building are also huge. Well worth the visit. Just one more piece of advice, be careful with the monkeys.
