review_text: We went in on a free day when there were no tickets, so you had to wait more than an hour to get in, but it was worth it
review_translated_text: Mi egy ingyenes napon mentunk be mikor nem volt belepo epp ezert tobb mint egy orat kellett varnia belepeskor de megerte

name: Rafa JB
review_text:
Definitely something not to miss if you travel to India. Doesnt disappoint. I recommend getting your tickets in advance online (you will avoid the queue to buy and you will arrive directly at the entrance queue, which at that time is short). The discount they give is better than the change. With these tickets they give you a discount of 50 rupees if you want to see the Red Fort later. Another option is to take them out in the morning and go just at dawn at 5:30, 5:45 or 6 and enter through the west door. Immediately go to the mosque area. From there, with the sun rising, the photos are spectacular. Next, go to the guest area (opposite side of the mosque) and with a mobile phone on the ground or spilling water on the ground you will get some impressive mirror photos. Then you can return to the central pond to take photos from the canal and finally from the cloisters. from the Darwan gate and at the entrance. The length of stay is 3 hours and be careful that they will constantly overwhelm you for guides, photos, etc. If it is not your plan, say no to everything. Transportation between the west gate and the entrance to the venue is free with admission. Otherwise its 20 rupees per person
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Yes
review_translated_text: Sin duda algo para no perderse si viajas a la India. No defrauda. Recomiendo sacar las entradas con antelacion on line (evitareis cola para comprar y llegareis directos a la cola de entrada, que a esas horas es poca). El descuento que hacen es mejor que el cambio. Con esas entradas te hacen descuento de 50 rupias si quereis ver el Fuerte Rojo despues. Otra mas, sacarlas de manana e ir justo amaneciendo 5:30, 5:45 o 6 y entrar por la puerta oeste (West). Inmediatamente iros a la zona de la mezquita. Desde alli, con el sol saliendo, las fotos son espectaculares. Seguidamente id a la zona de huespedes (lado contrario a la mezquita) y con un movil en el suelo o derramando agua en el suelo saldran unas fotos especulares impresionantes, Luego podeis regresar al estanque central para hacer fotos desde el canal y finalmente desde los claustros de la puerta Darwan y en la entrada. El tiempo de estancia son 3 horas y cuidado que constantemente os van a agobiar para guias, fotos, etc. Si no es vuestro plan decir a todo que no. El transporte entre la puerta oeste y la entrada al recinto es gratis con la entrada. Sino son 20 rupias por persona

name: Aman Raj
review_text:
This was my first experience of seeing the Taj Mahal so closely. I had seen it many times in pictures but the experience of seeing it with my own eyes was very beautiful.
Whenever you go to Agra, you must visit Taj Mahal.
Thank you

name: Maria Paula Gutierrez
review_text: Simply one of the wonders of the world that must be visited because its architecture is completely beautiful and it is spectacular to admire every detail of this work. I recommend going early to see the sunset. It is easy to take an uber from Delhi at approximately 2am to arrive on time and buy tickets
review_translated_text: Sencillamente una de las maravillas del mundo que hay que visitar porque su arquitectura es completamente hermosa y es espectaculat admirar cada detalle de esta obra. Recomiendo ir temprano para ver el atardecer. Es facil tomar un uber desde Delhi aproximadamente a las 2am para llegar a tiempo y comprar las entradas

name: Beni Aryaa
review_text:
The Taj Mahal is one of the wonders of the world that is officially recognized by UNESCO, a UN wing organization that deals with cultural affairs in the world. This recognition makes the Taj Mahal attract the attention of many tourists from all over the world. This building later became one of the popular tourist destinations in Asia.

Foreign tourists do not only hunt for the wonders of the magnificent Taj Mahal building. They also studied the history of the construction of the mosque building and several other parts that had to sacrifice dark history. To the extent that the story of its creation was compiled in a book which has been translated into several languages   of the world.

The story of the construction of the Taj Mahal is still full of historical nuances of the kingdom in the past. This is different from the history of the establishment of the Monas monument in Jakarta, which is covered in nuances of the struggle for independence and nationalism. However, the Taj Mahal building can be compared to the splendor of the Colosseum in Rome and the Tower of Pissa in Italy. These buildings were jointly ranked as the 7 Wonders of the World before being re-designated several years ago

The history of the construction of the Taj Mahal was classified as a major project of its time. The work involved the efforts of thousands of Indian residents and artists in that country to produce a building full of decoration and calligraphy from the Koran written in Arabic. However, in essence, all these designs were planned by the best architect of his time, Isa Muhammed.

The construction of the Taj Mahal was carried out during the reign of the Mogul empire, a large kingdom in India. At that time the empire was held by Shah Jahan who had a queen named Mumtaz Mahal. From the love story full of struggle between the two of them, the Taj Mahal became a building that will not be forgotten by time.

This magnificent building dominated by white, which symbolizes purity, was erected in the Uttar Paradesh area. Its exact location is on the banks of the Yamuna river, which is one of the holy rivers in Agra, India. The completion process took approximately 22 years.

Shah Jahan really wanted a philosophical monument without losing its beautiful impression to commemorate the death of Mumtaz Mahal after giving birth to his son. There were around 20,000 people involved in the process of establishing the Taj Mahal. They were deliberately brought in from all parts of India, Persia and Turkey to arrange the composition of the building so that it was balanced and according to Shah Jahans expectations.
review_translated_text:
Taj Mahal merupakan salah satu keajaiban dunia yang diakui secara resmi oleh UNESCO, sebuah organisasi sayap PBB yang mengurusi urusan kebudayaan di dunia. Pengakuan ini membuat Taj Mahal dilirik banyak turis dari seluruh dunia. Bangunan ini kemudian menjadi salah satu destinasi wisata populer di Asia.


Para turis mancanegara tidak hanya memburu keajaiban bangunan megah Taj Mahal. Mereka pun mempelajari sejarah pembangunan bangunan Masjid serta beberapa bagian lain yang harus mengorbankan sejarah kelam. Sampai-sampai kisah pembuatannya disusun dalam sebuah buku yang telah diterjemahkan ke dalam beberapa bahasa negara dunia.


Kisah pembangunan Taj Mahal masih kental dengan nuansa sejarah kerajaan di masa lalu. Berbeda dengan sejarah pendirian tugu Monas di Jakarta yang dibaluri nuansa perjuangan kemerdekaan dan nasionalisme. Bagaimanapun juga, bangunan Taj Mahal dapat disejajarkan dengan kemegahan Colosseum di Roma serta Menara Pissa di Italia. Bangunan-bangunan tersebut pernah bersama-sama menduduki peringkat '7 Bangunan Keajaiban Dunia' sebelum dilakukan penetapan ulang beberapa tahun lalu


Sejarah pembangunan Taj Mahal tergolong ke dalam proyek besar pada masanya. Pengerjaannya melibatkan tenaga ribuan penduduk India serta seniman-seniman di negara tersebut untuk menghasilkan sebuah bangunan penuh hiasan dan kaligrafi Al Qur'an yang ditulis menggunakan bahasa Arab. Namun pada intinya segala rancangan tersebut direncanakan oleh seorang arsitek terbaik di zamannya, Isa Muhammed.


Pembangunan Taj Mahal dilaksanakan di zaman pemerintahan kekaisaran Mogul, sebuah kerajaan besar di India. Waktu itu kekaisaran tersebut dipegang oleh Shah Jahan yang memiliki permaisuri bernama Mumtaz Mahal. Dari kisah cinta penuh perjuangan antara keduanya itulah, Taj Mahal menjadi bangunan yang tidak terlupakan oleh waktu.


Bangunan megah dengan dominasi warna putih yang melambangkan kesucian tersebut didirikan di wilayah Uttar Paradesh. Letak pastinya ada di bantaran sungai Yamuna yang merupakan salah satu sungai suci di Agra, India. Proses penyelesainnya memakan waktu sekira 22 tahun.


Shah Jahan benar-benar menginginkan sebuah monumen filosofis tanpa menghapus kesan indahnya untuk mengenang kematian Mumtaz Mahal sehabis melahirkan putra beliau. Ada sekitar 20.000 orang terlibat dalam proses pendirian Taj Mahal. Mereka ini sengaja didatangkan dari seluruh bagian negara India, Persia serta Turki untuk mengatur komposisi bangunan agar seimbang dan sesuai harapan Shah Jahan.

name: Ruben Martinez
review_text: Spectacular from the door to the inside. Recommended to see it at dawn, less tourists and hustle and bustle. I loved walking through the gardens and taking dozens of photos. If you like photography you will take advantage of every angle
review_translated_text: Espectacular desde la puerta hasta dentro. Recomendable verlo al amanecer, menos turistas y ajetreo. Me encanto caminar por los jardines y hacer decenas decenas de fotos. Si te gusta la fotografia le sacaras partido a cada angulo

name: Satoshi Tsuji
review_text:
The building was more beautiful than I expected, and it made me shiver. At the same time, tourists from all over the world are coming, and the number of tourists is more than expected, which shows how popular it is.

This building is a tomb made entirely of marble, built by Shah Jahan, the fifth emperor of the Mughal Empire, for his deceased wife Mumtaz Mahal. Normally, in Islam, it is prohibited to worship specific dead people or erect gravestones, but this is one of the exceptional tombstones built.

Its a little over 3 hours by car from Delhi, but if you have a chance to come to Delhi, its definitely a place you should check out.

The beautiful symmetrical tomb allows you to see how much the emperor loved his wife.
